loans.name: Thi Hoan

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoan and her family have been working on the fields and breeding poultry and pigs for generations. Now, they already have around 1000 hens. In order to buy more chicken food, they borrowed 125 USD from Binh Minh CDC (Kiva's partner in Vietnam). This time, she wants to borrow 150USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva Volunteer.

Gia đình anh chị truyền thống làm nghề nông: làm ruộng, chăn nuôi lợn thịt, gà. Hiện nay, gia đình anh chị đã có gần nghìn con gà đẻ trứng. Mong muốn bổ sung vốn mua cám cho gà, anh chị đã vay 2006000 từ Chương trình tài chính vi mô Binh Minh cdc.

loans.use: to buy chicken food

loans.name: Peninah's Group

texts.en: Peninah sells hardware materials. With the extra profits, she wants to extend her business and open up another hardware shop.

loans.use: To purchase more hardware materials

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en: Sarah is married with five children. She sells matooke (green banana) in the market. She intends to use the extra business profits to construct a shelter for her matooke.

loans.use: To expand the business from retail to wholesale

loans.name: Angella Apolot's Group

texts.en: Angella is a hair dresser. She intends to use the extra profits to open up a new salon and also purchase more salon equipment.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Thi Hau

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hau, 38 years old, has 4 children who are going to school. Her husband passed away. By borrowing $125 from Binh Minh CDC ( Kiva's Partner in Vietnam), she was able to sell meat in the market and increase her income to raise her children. Now she wants to borrow $150 more.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Hậu, 38 tuổi, chồng mất, có 4 con còn đi học. Với số tiền 2006000 VNĐ vay theo Chương trình Tài chính vi mô Binh Minh cdc, chị dùng để đi chợ bán thịt, tăng thu nhập để nuôi con nhỏ.

loans.use: to sell meat in the market

loans.name: Mercy's Group

texts.en: Mercy has a poultry farm. She intends to use the extra profits to construct another brooder (chicken house) to expand the business.

loans.use: To build a chicken house

loans.name: Thi Thuc

texts.vi:
Mrs. Thuc, 47 years old, has three children. Two of them married and have their own families. The youngest one is still in school. To improve her living quality, Mrs. Thuc borrowed $125 from Binh Minh CDC (KIva's partner in Vietnam) to collect and then resell scrap-iron, and breeding animals. Now she would like to borrow $150 more to expand her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong N., Kiva Volunteer.

Cô Thục, 47 tuổi có 3 con, 2 người đã lấy chồng, người còn lại còn đang đi học. Để nâng cao đời sống, chị vay 2006000 VNĐ theo Chương trình Tài chính vi mô Binh minh cdc để đi chợ sắt và chăn nuôi.

loans.use: collecting scrap-iron and breeding animals

loans.name: Thi Hai

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hai has 2 children who are still in school. Her family has difficulty in making ends meet. Their income comes from selling fruit and breeding animals. To expand their business, her family borrowed $125 from Binh Minh CDC (Kiva's partner in Vietnam). Now she would like to borrow $150 more.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Có 2 con nhỏ còn đang đi học, đời sống gia đình chị khá vất vả. Thu nhập của gia đình từ việc buôn bán hoa quả và chăn nuôi. Để tăng quy mô kinh doanh, gia đình chị đã vay 2006000 VND từ chương trình Tài chính vi mô Binh minh cdc

loans.use: selling fruit

loans.name: Hellen's Group

texts.en: Hellen has a small retail shop. She sells home products like soap, sugar, flour, salt, and many more. She wants to buy a fridge with the extra profits.

loans.use: To add more stock and buy a weighing scale

loans.name: Zaituni's Group

texts.en: Zaituni owns a small restaurant. She mainly prepares local dishes. With the extra profits from the business, she intends to buy a plot of land and to study for a catering diploma course.

loans.use: To buy food warmers for the restaurant

loans.name: Dorah's Group

texts.en: Dorah is married with 6 children. She runs a pigery business. She wants to use the extra profits to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets

loans.name: Margaret Namushabe's Group

texts.en: Magret has 3 local dairy cows. She supplies milk to a small restaurant. With the profits from her business, she plans to use the extra profits to buy Friesian dairy cows and a milk can.

loans.use: To buy a fridge to store her milk

loans.name: Teddy's Group

texts.en: Teddy is a single mother of three children. Her current business is selling charcoal and firewood. With the extra profits, Teddy intends to open up a small bar.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Angel's Group

texts.en: Angel owns a small restaurant. With the profits that this loan will help her earn, she wants to buy a plot of land and a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy more dishes

loans.name: Ulyana

texts.en:
Ulyana has a small clothing sales business at a market near the bus station in Mukachevo, Ukraine. She started her business about six years ago and it has developed into a stable, profitable enterprise. Ulyana makes about $300 in a typical month, a valuable source of income for her family of four.

Ulyana would like to expand her business by opening a second sales location. She has requested a loan of $1000 to help her with related expenses. Ulyana has been a good client with Nadiya Ukraine in the past. We are happy to be able to assist her in further developing her business.

loans.use: Open a new sales location

loans.name: Louinsa's Group

texts.en: Louinsa has a poultry farm for layers. With the extra profits from the business, Louinsa wants to help pay for her son to do a master's degree.

loans.use: To buy more chicks.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a single mother who supports herself and her child with a small business selling footwear at an outdoor market in Mukachevo, Ukraine. Eva is an energetic, hard-working entrepreneur. She has had her own business for about four years. There is good, stable demand for the shoes and boots Eva sells.

The colder season in Ukraine means higher sales of warm and stylish winter boots. Eva has requested a loan of $600 to broaden her assortment of available inventory so she can meet customer demand and continue making a good profit.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for her little shoe business

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en: Betty is 27 years old and divorced with four children. She plans to build more pig sties with the extra profits from her current business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en: Betty is 27 years old, divorced, and has four children. She plans to build more pig sties with the extra profits from her current business.

loans.use: To buy more pig sties

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna Z. has a business selling fish at one of the busy local markets in Melitopol, Ukraine. Anna’s family has been involved in fish selling for some time. Anna’s mother-in-law was an expert selling fish for many years and Anna’s husband has an identical business at another market. Anna has been selling for about five years and has benefited from the experience and advice of her mother-in-law. Anna and her husband have two small daughters. Their businesses provide the sole means of income for their family.

Anna has requested a loan of $600 to purchase a supply of raw fish that she will be able to marinate and re-sell at her fish stand. This type of fish is popular in Ukraine and should sell well. Anna has benefited in the past from financial assistance from Nadiya Ukraine. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist her with her business.

loans.use: Purchase raw fish to marinate for re-sale

loans.name: Saidat's Group

texts.en: Saidat sells used clothes, moving from door to door. With the profits from her  business, Siadat will buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov has a general retail business selling small items and souvenirs from a little stand at a market near the train station in Melitopol, Ukraine. She has much experience as an entrepreneur having been in business for over twelve years. Previously, Lubov served in the military and is now retired. In addition to her business activities, she is also on the town council in Melitopol. Lubov is divorced and has one son whom she is helping obtain a college education.

Lubov has requested an eight month loan of $1000 to increase her available business capital. She hopes to continue developing and growing her business so that it will be able to meet her financial needs in the future.

loans.use: Increase business capital for her souvenir stand

loans.name: Louinsa's Group

texts.en: Louinsa has a piggery and does a little farming. She wants to buy a piece of land with the extra profits from her business. Louinsa will invest in starting a poultry business in addition to the piggery.

loans.use: To invest in a poultry business

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is an experienced entrepreneur who has been selling at the market for over ten years. She currently has a business selling sports clothing which she enjoys because it helps encourage healthy lifestyles. Valentina has a small kiosk at the center of the large Central Market in Melitopol. It is in a prestigious row of businesses with a great location and lots of passing potential customers. Valentina is married and has one grown daughter. Her granddaughter is also an entrepreneur and Valentina hopes to use some of her profits to help her granddaughter develop her business.

Valentina has requested a loan of $600 to purchase new inventory for her kiosk. She hopes to continue earning a good income and be able to support her family.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for her little sports clothing business

loans.name: Teopista's Group

texts.en: Teopista works as a cook in a restaurant. She intends to use the profits from her business to buy a Friesian dairy cow. She will also buy a phone, so she can receive orders for the restaurant.

loans.use: To buy a public pay phone

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en: Mary is married with two children. She is a tailor and mainly sews school uniforms. With the profits from her, Mary will start a tailoring school.

loans.use: To buy more sewing machines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more used shoes for sale

loans.name: Joy's Group

texts.en: Joy is a fish monger and seller. With the profits from her business, Joy will buy a fridge, and a bicycle to take the children to school.

loans.use: To buy a bicycle and a fridge

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more used shoes for sale

loans.name: Justine's Group

texts.en:
Justine is married with four children. Her group has been together for eleven months.

From the profits from her expanded business, Justine will start a new business. She will open a grocery where she can sell various fruits and vegetables. She believes this may be more profitable than her current business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to increase the inventory in her boutique

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more mangoes for sale

loans.name: Teddy's Group

texts.en:
Teddy is married with seven children. She is a poultry farmer and breeds layers.

From the profits from her business, she will buy a Friesian cow to provide milk for the entire family, for a better, healthier life.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks to increase egg production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her mango business

loans.name: Tochiddin

texts.ru:
Tochiddin R. is 31 years old, has secondary education. He is a teacher and has 4 children. Tochiddin has been in the retail business for the past 5 years and has been selling small merchandise like sawing materials, glue, children's toys, hair clips and other things. For this purpose he is renting a space at the central market of town of Yavan called Tidjorat. He wants to use his loan to buy more assortment of merchandise. This loan will give local residents an opportunity to shop at the market for small, but very useful things for the home at moderate prices.

Tochiddin plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Раджабов Точиддин, возраст – 31 год, образование высшее, специальность – учитель, женат , имеет 4 -х детей. Точиддин в течение 5 лет занимается торговлей мелкими товарами народного потребления такими как нитки, клей, детские игрушки, заколки и другое. Для этого он арендует торговую точку на центарльном рынке города Явана под названием «Тиджорат». Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на пополнение ассортимента продаваемого товара. Данный кредит даст возможность местным жителям приобретать у себя на базаре не большие, но очень нужные вещи в домашнем хозяйстве по умеренным ценам.

Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Oimhol

texts.ru:
Oimhol M. is 45 years old, she has secondary education, is married and has 8 children. Oimhol has been breeding and selling cattle. She has been doing it for the past 6 years and it is her main source of income. She plans to use her loan to buy several calves and food for them for their growth. She will sell them after 40-45 days and buy more calves. She will use her profit to support her family. Her husband and son are helping her with the business.

Oimhol plans to pay off the loan within 12 months

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Мирзоева Оимхол, возраст – 45 лет, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 8-х детей. Оимхол занимается откормкой и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 6 лет и это основной источник приносящий ей доход. На полученный кредит она хочет приобрести несколько молодых бычков, корма для их откорма. Через каждые 40-45 дней она будет продавать их и приобретать молодых бычков. Полученную прибыль от продажи будет использовать для содержание семьи. В этом бизнесе ей помогает муж и сын.

Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Breeding and sales of cattle

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 25 years old. She is married and has two children. Her husband is unemployed. They live in a rented house and she has a small sewing shop in the house. She applied to get $1200 to purchase a new sewing machine and new fabric, renovate the shop, and do some advertising in order to increase her income and develop herself to provide a better life for her family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware and accept that this loan may represent a higher risk.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect her (i.e. masking portions of the picture, altering her name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new sewing machine

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 30 years old he has three children, two of them studying in school. His wife has a chronic disease that needs medical treatment. He has an electric supplies shop and he has applied to get $1200 to purchase new electric supplies and goods for the shop, do some advertising, and paint the shop. He wants to increase his income and provide a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware and accept that this loan may represent a higher risk.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e. masking portions of the picture, altering his name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new electric supplies

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Lê Thị Thắng, 48, is petite but always has a big smile on her face. She operates a restaurant serving breakfast only. She is a member of TYM fund in the village of Phú Minh since 1994. Her initial loan was 20 USD which was used to raise pigs. In later rounds, she always qualified for maximum loans. In 2001, feeling that she has good cooking skills, she decided to take out a loan to open a restaurant right in her house. Her house location is easily accessible, right on route #2 at the intersection with the entrance to the airport. Her husband is a bus driver so he has a lot of contacts who would become her customers. The food served at the restaurant is delicious so it's no coincidence that her restaurant is busy. Her revenue is around 200 USD a month. This time she's requesting a loan of 1200 USD to buy food & drinks, to expand her restaurant to better serve her customers.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Dáng người nhỏ nhắn, nụ cười thân thiện đó chính là ấn tượng đầu tiên khi gặp chị Lê Thị Thắng, 48 tuổi, bà chủ quán bán hàng ăn sáng, thành viên cụm 39 Quỹ Tình thương xã Phú Minh. Chị Thắng tham gia Quỹ năm 1994, ban đầu chị vay mức 20USD để chăn nuôi lợn. Các vòng vốn sau, chị vay vốn rất tích cực, đều vay các mức tối đa. Năm 2001, với chút tay nghề, chị quyết định vay vốn mở cửa hàng ăn sáng tại nhà. Vị trí quán khá thuận lợi, ngay trên đường quốc lộ 2, ngã ba sân bay Nội Bài, cộng với sự quen biết rộng rãi của chồng, một lái xe, và sự hấp dẫn trong món ăn, quán ăn của chị ngày càng đông khách. Thu nhập bình quân của cửa hàng là 200USD/tháng. Chị dự định vay 1200 USD để mua thực phẩm và đồ uống để quán ăn ngày càng phong phú và có chất lượng phục vụ tốt hơn.

loans.use: Buy food and drink

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyễn Thị Hà, 37, is a TTYM member since 1999. She operates a restaurant that caters to the night passengers of the Môi Trường transportation company. Her restaurant is located right on route #3, in the town of Nỉ, one of the most lively towns of Sóc Sơn district. Her customers are in for a treat: the food is delicious and she has such a nice personality, always smiling. Ms Hà confides that she gets a lot of help from her husband who is a transport driver for a construction company. They have 2 children who are still going to school. Her revenue from the restaurant is 200 SD a month. Ms Hà requests a loan of 650 USD to buy food & beverage for her restaurant, to offer a better service to her customers.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hà, 37 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình thương năm 1999. Công việc chủ yếu của chị là bán hàng ăn đêm cho lái xe của công ty Môi Trường đô thị. Cửa hàng của chị nằm ngay trên tuyến quốc lộ 3, tại phố Nỉ, một trong những khu phố sầm uất của huyện Sóc Sơn. Thật tuyệt vời khi được là khách hàng của chị Hà, không chỉ bởi những món ăn ngon mà còn bởi nụ cười lúc nào cũng thường trực gương mặt chị. Chị Hà tâm sự rằng, để tham gia tốt Quỹ Tình thương, chị đã có sự giúp đỡ rất lớn từ phía anh Tân, chồng chị. Anh đang là phụ xe chở vật liệu xây dựng tới các công trình, anh chị có hai con còn đang đi học. Thu nhập bình quân của cửa hàng là 200USD/tháng. Chị Hà dự định đề nghị chi nhánh cho vay mức 650USD để mua thực phẩm và đồ uống cho cửa hàng, phục vụ được nhiều khách hơn nữa.

loans.use: Buy food and beverage

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyễn Thị Thuận is 55 years old. She is a TYM member since 1996, when TYM first opened a branch in Tân Minh district. Before joining TYM, her family of 5 was living in difficult condition, they did not have any capital. They lived in a tiny house. She contracted her first loan, 30 USD, which was used to buy chickens & pigs for raising. Her husband cultivated vegetables, he and his children also worked as laborers to make ends meet. Their lives gradually changed for the better: the meals are more consistent and most importantly, she was able to save money. After 4 years with TYM, in 2000 she borrowed some money plus all her savings, they have built a 4 room house. In April 2007, they have built a 3 room extension to the house to serve as storage. This time she is requesting a loan 0f 650 USD to buy pigs for breeding and 300 chicks to raise, in time for the Tet holidays (new year, in Feb). They have a piece of land (2/10 acre) for vegetable cultivation. Their production is enough to satisfy the demand of the whole Sóc Sơn district. Her husband and 3 children still work in construction to contribute to the family revenue. The family income is 300 USD a month

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Thuận, 55 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ từ năm 1996 lúc chi nhánh bắt đầu triển khai hoạt động về xã Tân Minh. Khi chưa vào Quỹ gia đình chị rất vất vả, không có vốn làm ăn, cả nhà 5 người sống trong ngôi nhà 3 gian chật hẹp dột nát. Năm đầu tiên được vay 30USD, chị đã mua lợn, gà về chăn nuôi. Bên cạnh đó, chị Thuận trồng rau để bán, chồng chị cùng các con đi làm thuê để có tiền hoàn trả hàng tuần và tăng thu nhập. Cuộc sống của gia đình chị đã dần thay đổi, bữa ăn đã có nhiều chất dinh dưỡng hơn nhưng quan trọng hơn là chị đã có tiền tích luỹ. Sau 4 năm tham gia Quỹ đến năm 2000 từ số tiền tích luỹ được và vay mượn thêm, gia đình chị đã xây dựng được ngôi nhà mái ngói 4 gian đẹp đẽ và tháng 4 năm 2007 chị lại tiếp tục xây 3 gian nhà phụ để chứa đồ dùng. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 650 USD để mua lợn giống và 300 con gà thịt chuẩn bị phục vụ Tết Nguyên Đán. Hiện chị còn có 2 sào rau sạch cung cấp cho người tiêu dùng tại chợ huyện Sóc Sơn, chồng chị cùng con trai hàng ngày đi xây dựng kiếm tiền hỗ trợ cho chị. Mức thu nhập hiện tại hàng tháng của gia đình chị Thuận là 300USD

loans.use: Buy pigs and chicken

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
"If you need to buy eggs, go see Ms Dân in Tân Minh village. Her eggs are big, with a big yolk. Her chickens are meaty. And she give you good prices", that's what people from the Vệ Sơn Đoài hamlet are saying about Ms Dân. She is 55 years old, a member of TYM since 1995 in the Tân Minh village. Her success today is due to hard work and determination. She started with a loan of 20 USD which was used to raise chickens thus supplying food to her family. She also brewed rice wine. The next year, due to the successful sales of her batch of chickens, she was confident enough to take out a loan to buy 200 chickens. In 2006, she received a loan of 625 USD which was used to expand her operation, buidimg new cages for her chickens. Today, she has 250 egg laying chickens, 1300 for meat. Her revenue is 300 USD a month. Ms Dân is very happy about her success and she hopes to be able to expand her operation again. This time she is requesting a loan of 950 USD to buy chicken feed, getting ready for the new year rush.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

"Nếu ai có nhu cầu về trứng gà, hãy đến nhà chị Dân ở xã Tân Minh. Trứng gà của chị vừa to lại vừa nhiều lòng đỏ, gà thì con nào cũng béo chắc, khoẻ mạnh. Ngon mà rẻ lắm". Đó là lời người dân thôn Vệ Sơn Đoài vẫn thường rỉ tai nhau khi nói về chị Trần Thị Dân, 55 tuổi, thành viên cụm 22 xã Tân Minh. Chị Dân tham gia Quỹ năm 1995, đến nay đã được trên 10 năm. Nghe chị kể lại quá trình tham gia Quỹ mới thấy chị thật đảm đang, tháo vát. Mới đầu chị chỉ dám vay mức 20USD để chăn nuôi gà thịt, cung cấp thức ăn trong gia đình và nấu rượu bán. Năm tiếp theo, thấy mình khá mát tay trong nuôi gà, chị mạnh dạn vay vốn và đầu tư nuôi 200 con gà. Kết quả kinh doanh có lãi, năm 2006, chị xin vay 625USD để mở rộng chăn nuôi và xây chuồng trại. Hiện tại, trong chuồng trại nhà chị có 250 gà đẻ trứng, 1300 con gà thịt cho thu nhập 300USD/tháng. Chị Dân rất vui với thành quả của mình và mong muốn dự án của mình sẽ còn phát triển mạnh nữa. Vòng vốn này, chị có nhu cầu vay 950USD để mua thêm thức ăn cho gà, vỗ béo để chuẩn bị cho Tết Âm lịch Mậu Tý.

loans.use: Buy chicken-feed

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Trần Thị Nhàn is 31 years old. She grew up in a farmer family. She married Mr Nam who is a mechanic. They are happy despite the fact that life is hard, they have no capital. In 1997, Ms Nhàn joined TYM fund and took out a loan of 30 USD to open a clothing store. She is a skillful businesswoman and has a nice personality. The business is profitable. Her store is located on route #2, she has 2 employees working with her, each earns 50 USD a month. She specializes in making linens, her main customers are Hotels & Inns. Her family income is 200 USD a month. This time she's requesting a loan 0f 1200 USD to buy fabrics and tools, getting ready for the upcoming season.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Nhàn, 31 tuổi, sinh trưởng trong một gia đình thuần nông không có nghề phụ. Đến tuổi xây dựng gia đình, chị kết hôn với anh Nam công nhân cơ khí Z125. Cuộc sống của 2 vợ chồng trẻ thiếu thốn, vất vả nhưng thật hạnh phúc. Năm 1997, chị Nhàn tham gia Quỹ Tình thương vay mức vốn 30USD để mở cửa hàng may mặc. Nhờ bàn tay khéo léo và duyên bán hàng, công việc làm ăn khá thuận lợi, hiện chị đang thuê cửa hàng trên mặt đường quốc lộ 2, thuê 2 công nhân với mức lương 50USD/tháng. Hoạt động kinh doanh chính của chị Nhàn là chuyên may mành rèm ga gối, phục vụ các nhà nghỉ, khách sạn và các hộ gia đình có nhu cầu. Thu nhập của gia đình bình quân 200USD/tháng. Vòng vốn này chị Nhàn có nhu cầu vay 1200 USD để mua vải và khung nhôm, tăng cường phục vụ cho mùa cưới này.

loans.use: Buy fabric

loans.name: Shah Agha

texts.en: Shah Agha lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is uneducated and has 4 children. He has a retail shop and has been in the retail business for the past 5 years. He has attracted a good numbers of customers and now he would like to expand his business so he is requesting an individual loan to complete his stock and make a good income for his family and enroll his children in a better education center. He is happy with all members of his family.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more ties for sale and to rent a premise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his watch repair business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more mangoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more mangoes for sale

loans.name: Fitria

texts.en: Fitria, 31, is the mother of 3 children, 10, 4 and 1 years old. In order to provide for her family's needs, she sells cosmetics on credit door-to-door. She can earn US$10.5 a week, while her husband, E., sells tires and earns a small income. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of US$75 to add to her business capital. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Neneng

texts.en: Neneng J., 33, a mother of 2 daughters, sells clothes on credit door-to-door, earning US$80 a month.  Her husband, Sukarman, does not work anymore, so she is the only source of income in the family. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of US$75 to buy more clothes so she can earn more income for her children's education. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Onah

texts.en: Onah is a 62-year-old widow who has a son. Her husband passed away a long time ago, so she has to earn income to support her family by herself. She sells fresh milk door-to-door, earning US$4 a day. She also sells clothes and sandals, earning US$16 a month. She is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan of US$100 to add to her business capital. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To add to her business capital

loans.name: Yayat

texts.en: Yayat, 40-years-old, is the mother of 3 children. To earn extra income for the family she sells beverages at her house and also sells veils at her religious community, earning US$21 a month. Her husband, R., sells crispy snacks door-to-door and only gets a small income. She is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan of US$125 to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expand her beverages business

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en: Shahin F. is a 37-year-old farmer who owns a small business in the southern part of Azerbaijan, Saatli region. He breeds sheep and sells them to local people and bazaar traders. He has 7 years of experience in this field. Shahin is married and has one son and two daughters. Shahin is an IDP and it is difficult to support his big family and cover all their needs. As spring is season for weddings and he anticipates a greater demand, he would like to expand his herd and purchase 15 sheep for and fodder. For this purpose he is applying for a loan of $1200.

loans.use: To purchase fifteen sheep for his herd

loans.name: Akhmadova

texts.en: Akhmadova T. is a 47-year-old woman who owns a small livestock business in a southern village in Saatli. She is married and has four children. She sells dairy products, such as milk and yogurt. T. has 9 years of experience. As her business is the only one source in her family she works very hard to keep in normal life conditions. She would like to expand her business and vary her production. Meat is very popular all across Azerbaijan. Azerbaijani people use meat almost every day and most of dishes consist of meat.  She would like to purchase three calves for approximately $300 and fodder for meat production. She has applied for a loan of $1000 .

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder for her livestock business

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en: Parviz M. is a 25-year-old trader who owns a small food store in a village in Sattli. He has 3 years of experience in trading. He started out selling candies and now sells many different kinds of products including food and cosmetics. Parviz would like a loan of $900 to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his small food and sundries store

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en: Zakir Q.  is a 27-year-old farmer who owns a small herd of 10 sheep. He has been selling sheep for meat production to the Saatli bazaar traders for 5 years. As he is an IDP, Zakir's living conditions are difficult and he works very hard to look after his herd. Zakir also looks after his parents. He would like to expand his herd and purchase 15 additional sheep for an estimated price of  $60-70. For this purpose he has applied for a loan of $1200, which would also cover the cost of fodder. Mutton is very popular all across Azerbaijan. Azerbaijani people use mutton almost every day and most of dishes consist of meat.

loans.use: To purchase 15 additional sheep for his herd

loans.name: Fatali

texts.en: Fatali F. is a 36-year-old trader who sells food products in Saatli. He has 3 years of experience in trading. He is married and has two children. As he is IDP and his family lives in very hard financial conditions, he would like to increase his income. He is asking for a loan of $1000 to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business selling food products

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali H.  is a 47-year-old farmer who raises and sells sheep in a small village in Saatli. He lives with his family in small IDP camp, under difficult conditions. He has been breeding and selling sheep for 9 years. He is very successful in his business, but beginning last year prices for fodder tripled and have remained at that level. To counteract this rise in costs, he would like to expand his business and his herd. He applied for a loan of $1100. The estimated price for one sheep is $60-70 and with the rest of loan he will purchase fodder.

loans.use: To purchase 15 sheep and fodder to expand his livestock business

loans.name: Nashravan

texts.en: Nashravan H.  is a 46-year-old farmer in a village in the Saatli region. He is married and has two children. He has been selling dairy products to neighbors and local bazaar traders for 9 years. Now he would like to expand his business from one to three cows. Nashravan would like a loan of $1200 to purchase two additional cows.

loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows

loans.name: Sabri

texts.en: Sabri A. is a 39-year-old man who sells dairy products to the neighbors and local bazaar traders. He has 7 years of experience in this business. He is married and has three children. Sabri is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) and the income he makes is not enough to purchase meat for his family. He is determined to improve his family's situation and purchase additional two milk cows to expand his business to meet the growing needs of his children. He would like a loan of $1200 to purchase two cows.

loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows

loans.name: Qubad

texts.en: Qubad I. is a 42-year-old man who breeds sheep in a small village in the Sattli region.  He has a small herd of four sheep. I. has 6 years of experience breeding and selling sheep. Qubad is married with four children. As he is an Internally Displayed Person (IDP), his family is very poor and his income hardly covers his family needs. He would like to improve his financial situation and purchase 15 sheep and fodder. For this purpose he has applied for a loan of $1200.

loans.use: To purchase 15 additional sheep for his herd

loans.name: Mirvari

texts.en: K. Mirvari is a 50-year-old woman who breeds sheep in a small village of the Saatli region of Azerbaijan. She has 9 years of experience in this business and sells sheep to the local bazaar traders. Mutton is very popular in Azerbaijan and is used almost every day in various dishes. Mirvari is married with five children. Her livestock business is the only source of income for her family and she works hard to support them. She would like to expand her business and purchase 15 additional sheep for estimated price of $65 USD each. She has applied for a loan of $1000.

loans.use: To purchase 15 additional sheep for her livestock business

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Yem Y. is a widow and has three children. To earn her living, and to support her children's tuition fees, she and one of her daughters sell a variety of fruits at Phsar Pouk market, earning collectively about $4 each day.

Yem has requested a loan to expand her inventory by purchasing more fruits to meet her client demand; she will also use part of the loan to install in her house a protection from flooding, which she experienced a couple years ago.

loans.use: To expense her inventory by purchasing more fruits to meet her cleint demand.

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Yem Yun start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy K., 36, is married with three children and works on a plot of farmland growing rice crops. Her husband is self-employed as a carpenter and typically makes around $2 per day. One of her children works as a mirror cutter; another is a security guard and the third is employed by a garment factory.

Thy hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle to use for her family’s transportation. This will help to reduce her expenses, as it will be better than using a motor-taxi service each day.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use for her family's transportation.

loans.name: Hosamoh

texts.en: Hosamoh has been engaged in the candy trade for over 10 years. She has her own shop, which is located in Sahovat bazaar in Dushanbe,Tajikistan. She has raised one child by herself. Her business is the only income of her family, and she wishes that in future she could create better conditions for her child. As a businesswomen she is very accurate and is a responsible person. She also is very polite with clients, and many of them become her constant clients. During her work activities, she has learned more information about client needs, and she tries quickly to meet their needs. From KIVA she wants to recieve a loan for future expansion. She wants to purchase several new kinds of candies to sell.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Khin

texts.en: Khin S., 35, is the mother of three little children. She runs a butcher stand in her community selling pork and beef and earning about $4 each day. Her husband is a construction foreman and generally makes around $2 each day. Khin intends to use this loan to purchase more butchery supplies to meet her increasing customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase more butchery supplies

loans.name: Thang

texts.en:
Thang Sokunthy, 34, is the mother of two children and lives with her husband in a part of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To aid in meeting her family’s expenses, she runs a stand selling a variety of grocery products to the people in her area and typically makes on average around $7 each day. Her husband is self-employed as a fortune-teller and generally makes around $2 each day.

Thang will use this loan to expand her inventory by purchasing more grocery products to meet her clients’ needs. Additionally, she will buy poultry and pigs to breed for additional income.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to meet her growing customer demands.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
Mavluda was born in Dushanbe. She is not married. Currently she lives with her parents. She has a stable business and she has been doing it for the past 10 years. Her shop is close to the market “Sahovat”. She began her business with a small inventory, slowly increasing her turnover. After a while, Mavluda was able to save money and opened her own shop. In 2003, she rented a stall (in the picture). Currently, she has wide range of products: baked goods, which she purchases in the local bakeries and confectioners shops as well as soft drinks and juices from local manufacturers. The rest of her goods she purchases at local wholesale markets. Her inventory is worth $1000 and she is applying to KIVA with a request for a loan of $1200 (5000 Somoni) for 6 months for the purchase of her next batch of products.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Мавлюда родилась в Душанбе,незамужем.В настояшее время живет с родителями. Имеет стабильный бизнес и занимается этим делом на протяжении 10 лет.Её магазин расположен около рынка "Саховат".Она раньше продавала не большую партию товара.Постепенно она расширила свой ассортимент и смогла накопить деньги на магазинюВ 2003 году она арендовала магазин где вы сейчас можете её увидеть.В данное время она имеет широкий выбор товаров.Мучные продукты она закупает в местных кондитерских цехах, напитки привозят с лиманадных цехов и заводов.Остальной товар она закупает на оптовом рынке.Она имеет в обороте $1000 и в данное время она обратилась в КИВА с просьбой на 5000сомони на 6 месецев для заукпки очередной партии товара.

loans.use: Buying food porducts.

loans.name: Abdunazar

texts.ru:
Abdunazar has been breeding livestock for 10 years. He is married and has four children. His wife and kids help him with his business. Breeding livestock is profitable business for his family. He breeds sheep and goats and recently he decided to start breeding cattle. Abdunazar is applying for a loan in order to start breeding cattle and he is planning to expand and grow his business.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Абдуназар занимается разведением скота десятый год. У него 4 детей. В этом бизнесе ему помогают жена и дети. В поселке кроме откорм скота и сель.хоз культура не чем больше заняться, поэтому этот бизнес является самым прибыльным для его семьи. У Абдуназара имеются большое пастбища овец, коз и недавно начал заниматься крупно рогатым скотом. В разведение Крупно рогатого скота ему необходим был кредит с Микроинвест, где он планирует расширится и развиваться.

loans.use: Buy cattle to breed

loans.name: Alahmad

texts.ru:
Alahmad was born in 1964, is married and has five children. His wife is a homemaker - she looks after the children. Alahmad’s oldest son helps him with his business selling DVDs. In order to attract more customers, Alahmad started selling computer games and other consumer electronics in addition to DVDs. He purchases his merchandise from suppliers from China.

Alahmad started his business to support his family. He rented a store and used all his savings to buy the first batch of DVDs. He built his business slowly and was able to purchase additional consumer electronics. Currently his business is stable, but he wants to buy a new batch of DVDs using the proceeds from his loan from KIVA.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Алахмад 1964 года рождения, женат имеет 5 детей. Жена домохозайка, занимается воспитанием детей. Старший сын помогает по бизнесу,продает диски в месте с отцом. Для привлечения больше клиентов Алахмад также включил в свой ассортимент компютерние игры и прилежащую технику. Он закупает товар у поставшиков из Китая. После распада СССР он был вынужден найти работу для того чтобы прокормить большую семью. На сбережения он арендовал этот магазин и закупил первую партию дисков. Постепенно он начал закупать и технику. Сейчас его бизнес довольно стабилен и он просит у КИВЫ мах сумму займа на закупку новой партии новых дисков.

loans.use: Buying his next batch of goods.

loans.name: Erkin

texts.ru:
Erkin I. is in need of a loan to purchase furniture. He is married and has 4 children. He works as one of the truck drivers in Geological expedition. He delivers goods (heavy) from the location of the expedition to the organization. He is a contract worker, so he has work only when there are goods to be delivered. However, this is not enough to provide his family with all the necessities. His parents pension is very small. The children ares till little and do not work. The loan from MicroInvest will allow him to improve his family's financial situation.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Исмоилову Эркину необходим кредит для приобретения мебели. Он женат, имеет четверых детей. Работает водителем грузовых машин в Комплексе Геологической экспедиции. Он привозит товары (тяжелые грузы) с места в свое предприятие. Он работает по контракту, когда есть товар , есть работа. Но этого мало, что бы обеспечить семье всем необходимым. Его родители получают очень маленькую пенсию. Дети еще малы и не работают. Микроинвест является очень кстати для того что бы обеспечить самым необходимым.

loans.use: consumer credit

loans.name: Barot

texts.en: Barot  Z. lives in Spitamen (Soghd oblast, Tajikistan) and he is married and has 2 children. Z. Barot applied to MicroInvest in 2007 and recommended himself as a serious and executive client. His business stability and income increase helped him to return in time the previous loans and to improve the business situation. Mr. Z. Barot is experienced in business of livestock because he has been in the livestock business from the early years when he helped his father to raise and sell cows and sheeps. It is the family business where his wife and children help him. Now he is a hydraulic engineer in JSC “Boboev," as a profession, but he continues the business started by his father. He is engaged in livestock raising and selling. In time, he dreams on the horn pedigree bull purchasing for the further livestock breeding. Now Mr. Z. Barot requests a loan of $500 for horn pedigree bul purchasing.

loans.use: a horn pedigree bull purchasing

loans.name: Ziedullo

texts.ru:
Over the past 2 years Ziedullo I. has been working as an ambulance driver in the hospital of the city of Dushanbe, Tadjikistan. Previously he worked as a trolley driver but lost his job with the fall of the USSR. His children were small and his wife was taking care of the household. It took him a while to find work once again. He even worked as a construction worker for a time. Currently he has a stable full time position. Two of his 9 children are married and own their own businesses. This year Ziedullo is planing to celebrate the wedding of his youngest son. When he heard about the services offered by MicroInvest, he decided to become a Kiva client.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

На протяжении 2 лет Исмоилов Зиёдулло работает водителем скорой помощи в городской больнице в городе Душанбе,Таджикистан.Раньше он был водителем тролейбуссов и с распадом СССР он потерял работу. Дети были маленькими,жена домохозайка он долго искал работу и одно время он работал наемным работником на стройке. Сегодня у нег есть стабильная работа и из 9 его детей,двое женаты и имеют свой бизнес.В этом году Зиёдулло планирует сыграть свадьбу соего младшего сына.Услышав о предоставлении потреб. займов со стороны Микроинвеста он стал клиентом нашей организации и захотел принять участие в КИВА программе.

loans.use: To pay for his son's wedding

loans.name: Ocheng A (I) Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Allen is 41 years old. She is a single mother of four children and six dependants. She has a vegetable business. With the extra profits, she intends to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To stock more fruits and thus enlarge her business

loans.name: Anor

texts.ru:
Anor has been in business of reselling dried fruits for the past 10 years. She rents a spot on the food market "Sahovat". She is married and has 5 children. Her husband is earning money in Russia. He sends her $500 every month. However, because the children have grown up this money is insufficient to pay for education and food. Anor is happy to have 5 children and work hard to provide for them. She has a stable business. She purchases goods from peasants from distant villages which is delivered to her ready to sell. Anor's business has a good turnover. She is a good client of our organization.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Анор занимается куплей продажей сухофруктов уже 10 лет.Она арендует место на пищевом рынке "Саховат".Замужем,имеет 5 детей.Муж работает в России наемным рабочим. Ежемесечно присылает деньги в размере $500.Но так как дети выросли этих денег недостаточно на образование и питание.Анор счастлива что имеет 5 детей и работает для них.У неё стабильный налаженный бизнес, то есть она закупает свой ассортимент у крестян с отдаленных кишлаков и он привозят готовую продукцию( расфассованную и высущенную.)Анор имеет нормальный оборот товара и в данный момент успешно кредитуется в нашей организации.

loans.use: Purchase 20kg of peanuts, 30kg of almonds, 20kg of raisins, 30kg of pistachios, 15kg of salted apricot pits and 40kg of dried apricots with pits.

loans.name: Ocheng A (Ii) Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Annet has a small retail shop and is a single mother of one. She wants to send her child to school with the extra business profits.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Latofat

texts.ru:
Latofat R. is divorced and has 8 children. She is a very strong and determined woman. She has previously proved herself to be a good client our organization. The children have grown up and are helping her with the business. She used to purchase goods in Uzbekistan. Now she has an agreement with private distributing companies in Russia. These companies promptly fulfill Latfat's orders. Thanks to her upbringing and past experiences Latofat is able to easily come to agreements with suppliers and make sure that the deal is advantageous. Her produce is well know among clients for it's good quality. A lot of her clients are local stores. She came to Kiva in order to secure additional funds that will allow her to purchase the next batch of candy.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Рахимкулова Латофат разведённая, сама воспитывает 8 детей.Женщина сильного характера,стойкая и волевая. Аккуратный клиент нашей организации.Дети выросли и помогают ей по бизнесу.Раньше она покупала товар в Узбекистане а сейча у неё есть договор с частными фирмами-дистрибюторами с России.Они принимают заказ от неё и выполняют за короткие сроки.Блогодаря жизненому опыту и закалке она искусно ведет переговоры с поставщиками на выгодных условиях.Она так же хорошо зарекомендовала свою продукцию среди клиентов и имеет наибольшее количество клиентов среди местных магазинов.В Киву она обратилачсь с запроссом на мах. сумму для закупки очередной партии конфет.

loans.use: Purchase 10kg of chocolate, 20kg of sugar candies and 20kg of fruit marmelade

loans.name: Ocheng B (I) Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Florence is a 48 year old widow with three children. She has a market stall where she sells raw foods like cassava stems, sweet potatoes, and matooke. She would like to use the profits to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Ocheng B (Ii) Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.p>

Edith is a 30 year old widow with seven children. She has a small broiler poultry farm. She wants to use the profits to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more broilers to increase business volume

loans.name: Prum

texts.en:
Prum T. is 35 years old and married with four children. She works with her husband on a piece of land growing various vegetables; together they earn around $4.80 each day. One of her children is employed by a private company and makes $1.60 each day, while her remaining children are in school.

Prum wants to raise her income generation by expanding the quantity of her crops and needs a water-pump machine to increase her water supply. This loan will enable her cultivation to grow steadily.

loans.use: To purchase a water-pump to provide water for their crops.

loans.name: Ocheng B (Iii) Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Annet is a single mother of three children. She has a poultry farm. With the extra business profits, she intends to construct rental houses so that she can have a monthly income.

loans.use: To buy more poultry birds.

loans.name: Plong

texts.en:
Plong S., 54, sells food and general products to the people in her community, typically earning around $3 each day.

Plong's husband is a construction foreman, generally earning around $6 each day. Plong also has four children, two of which are employed at a garment factory; one child is still a student and the other is married and no longer living with Plong.

Plong intends to use this loan to purchase more products and expand her business. Additionally, she hopes to buy more construction tools for her husband, making his job more convenient, faster and more effective.

loans.use: To expand her business and purchase tools for her husband's job

loans.name: Nansana West I B(Ii) A Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Diana sells and distributes water to the local people. She intends to use the extra profits to buy a water tower which can accommodate more than one tank. The tower will increase the quantity of water for sale.

loans.use: To buy more containers for water storage

loans.name: Nansana West I B(Ii) B Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Harrisa is divorced with six children. She has a retail shop and mainly sells household items. With the extra business profits, she wants to pay school fees for the children and to provide other necessities like food and medicine.

loans.use: To add stock in her shop

loans.name: Nansana West I B(Ii) C Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Florence is married with seven children. Her current business is poultry farming. She wants to use the extra profits to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: Buy more birds for rearing.

loans.name: Nansana West I B(Ii) D Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Cotrida is marreid with seven children. She sells fresh foods and raw foods in the market. She intends to use the extra business profits to provide necessary services to the children, such as food, education, and medical care.

loans.use: To buy more fresh foods

loans.name: Thoy

texts.en: Thoy C., 46, is a mother of three children and lives with her husband in a part of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband work together selling a variety of fruit to the people in her area. Two of her children are at school. Thoy hopes to use this loan to purchase more fruit to fulfill her growing customer demands.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit and fulfill her growing customer demands.

loans.name: Nansana 7/8 2037 (A) Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Aisha is a single mother of eight children. She has a small poultry farm. She would like to use the extra business profits to buy food and clothes, and to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To widen the chicken house

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 42 years old. He is married and has 3 children. Two of them are studying in school, and the other one is going to university. He has a small general store and applied to borrow $1200 to purchase more new goods and to purchase a new ice box. He also wants to make new shelves and renovate the store to increase his income and develop his business. He wants to have a safer and better life for his children.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase a new ice box  and more new goods

loans.name: Urinboev

texts.en: Urinboev A. lives in Spitamen; he is married and has a child. Urinboev A. made the decision to become the client of MicroInvest because he heard many stories from friends on the MicroInvest loan procedure that helped his friends to develop and improve their businesses. So he has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007. Urinboev A., from the first days, showed himself a reliable and executive client. The business stability and income increases helped him to return in time the previous loan. Mr. Urinboev A. is experienced in business and has the appropriate knowledge of livestock because he has worked with bovine animals from his early years. He helped his father on the farm raising and selling livestock, with the milk production and with other work. It was the family business. Now he is the railway station worker but he still is engaged in livestock raising and selling because he dreamed of having a large herd. He has the appropriate knowledge that he used in practice. In time, he dreams of purchasing a horn pedigree bull and milk cow for the further meat and milk production. (It will supply the bazaars with pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd, etc.) Now Mr. Urinboev A. requests a loan for business development and a horn pedigree bull purchase that will allow him to increase significantly his family income and will further improve his business development.

loans.use: For business development and a horn pedigree bull purchase

loans.name: Nansana 7/8 2037 (B) Group

texts.en: Dorothy is 30 years old. Her current business is seeling clothes.With the extra business profits, Dorothy intends to buy a container (kiosk) for her boutique which she can station in one place. She belives this will increase total sales.

loans.use: To increase stock.

loans.name: Nansana 7/8 2037 (B) Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Dorothy is 30 years old. Her current business is selling clothes. With the extra business profits, Dorothy intends to buy a container (kiosk) for her boutique which she can station in one place. She belives this will increase total sales.

loans.use: To increase stock.

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Khim C., 51, is blind in one eye and is the mother of two children. She works raising pigs on her property, typically earning around $1 each day. Khim's husband has a job at a carpentry store and makes on average around $3 per day. Additionally, one of her children is employed by a private company and the other works as a construction foreman; together they earn around $180 each month.

Khim C. hopes to use this loan to dig a well and purchase a pump to supply water to her pigs.

loans.use: To purchase a water-pump

loans.name: Kuldashev

texts.en: Kuldashev D. lives in Spitamen; he is married and has 4 children. Kuldashev D. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007, and he recommends himself as a serious and strongly motivated client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. The business stability and income increases he's had have helped him to return in time the previous loan. Mr. Kuldashev D. is engaged in home business of charcoal selling. Mr. Kuldashev D. is a tractor driver in the JSC “Saidkurgan” also. In time he wants to try carved wood and selling as a business, too. Now Mr. Kuldashev D. requests the loan for his charcoal selling business and its development. It permits him to increase the business income and to plan the business implementation and modernization.

loans.use: To improve his business selling charcoal

loans.name: Nansana 7/8 2037 (C) Group

texts.en: Betty is a widow with five children. She sells fresh food in the market. She wants to pay school fees for the children and buy food with the business profits.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Nansana 7/8 2037 (D) Group

texts.en: Sauda runs a charcoal business. With the extra business profits, she intends to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Pulatova

texts.en: Pulatova A. lives in Spitamen, Tajikistan. She made the decision to become the client of MicroInvest because all her friends and colleagues improved their business situtions thanks to MicroInvest. Mrs.Pulatova became the client of MicroInvest in 2007, and now recommends herself as a reliable and executive client. She works in the food bazaar and she is engaged in business of food products selling. Despite the fact that she started the business from scratch, now Mrs. Pulatova has a very wide assortment of goods and thanks to her politeness and sensitiveness she has the repeat customers for cultured milk products, meat products, sweets, vegetable oil, flour products, etc. She works with the suppliers, and that gives her opportunity to work with clients of the different income levels. But working in the trade sphere, she meets stiff competition and wants to provide a wider assortment of new goods. It allows her to realize new business plans and to develop the existing business. Mrs. Pulatova A. requests the loan of $350 for business development and to widen her assortment of goods.

loans.use: for business development, by building the assrtment of goods she offers

loans.name: Goibova

texts.en: Goibova N. lives in Spitamen, Tajikistan. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007, and she recommends herself as a serious and executive client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. She works in the food bazaar and she is engaged in business of food products selling. She has a wide assortment of milk-sour (cultured milk) products, meat products, sweets, vegetable oil, flour products, etc. Mrs.Goibova is a very polite and warm-hearted woman--that is why she has many repeat customers. She works with the suppliers, and that is why the prices for her goods are lower than the bazaar prices. She works with the customers of the different income levels. She wants to provide a wider assortment of new goods to attract more repeat customers. It allowss her to implement new business plans and to develop the existing business. Mrs. Goibova N. requests a loan for business development and and to improve the assortment of goods.

loans.use: for business development and to improve the assortment of goods she sells

loans.name: Kamuli C1 (B) Group

texts.en: Jane is 30 years old and married with four children. She runs a tailoring business. She would  use the extra profits to start a tailoring school.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines

loans.name: Otajonova

texts.en: Otajonova D. lives in Spitamen (Soghd oblast, Tajikistan), and she is married and has 3 children. Mrs. Otajonova D. applied to MicroInvest in 2007 and recommended herself as a serious and executive client. The business stability and income increases she has had have helped her to return the previous loan funds on time, and to improve her business situation. Mrs. Otajonova D. is experienced in business of livestock and has the appropriate knowledge of livestock. She has been engaged in the livestock business from her early years when she helped first her mother on the farm with cows and sheep, and then she heldped her husband. It is the family business that brings the general income. Now she is an accountant in the JSC “Tagayak” as a profession, but most of the time she is engaged in the family business. She helps with livestock raising and selling, the milk production and other work. In time she dreams of purchasing a horn pedigree milk-cow for to produce more milk-sour (cultured milk) products. Now Mrs. Otajonova D. requests a loan for business development that will allow her to increase significantly the family income and to plan for more milk-cow purchases.

loans.use: For a milk-cow purchase

loans.name: Abduvahobov

texts.en: Abduvahobov R. lives in Spitamen, and he is married and has a child. Abduvahobov R. made the decision to become the client of MicroInvest because he heard many stories from friends on the MicroInvest loan procedures that helped his friends to develop and improve their businesses, so he has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007. Abduvahobov R., from the first days, showed himself as a reliable and executive client. The business stability and income increases he's had have helped him to return in time the previous loan. Mr. Abduvahobov R. is experienced in business and has the appropriate knowledge of livestock because he worked with bovine animals from his early years. He helped his father in the farm with livestock raising and selling, the milk production and other work. It was the family business. He still is engaged in livestock raising and selling because he dreamed of having a large herd. In time, he dreams of purchasing a horn pedigree bull and milk cow for the further meat and milk-sour (cultured milk) goods production, which supplies the bazaars with pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd, etc. Now Mr. Abduvahobov R. requests a loan for business development and to increase the business income, and to plan for more pedigree milk-cow purchases.

loans.use: For business development

loans.name: Kamuli C1 (C) Group

texts.en: Yudaya is a 42-year-old widow. She has five children. She has a hardware business where she sells equipment and supplies. She intends to buy a mortocycle (boda boda) with the extra profits.

loans.use: To stock her hardware store

loans.name: Kamuli C1 (D) Group

texts.en: Harriet is 27 years old and married with one child. Her current busienss is selling charcoal. She would use the extra profits to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy coal wholesale

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei is married and lives with his family in Vasilyevka.

Andrei sells ceramic tiles in the local department store where he rents a facility for his shop. He is still learning how to do business, as he started his venture only one year ago.

Andrei is a focused entrepreneur. He likes working for himself and being independent. He decided to go into business to be able to support his family and manage his time more efficiently. One of his main goals is to make money and grow professionally.

Andrei has requested a loan of $1000 to buy more tiles to sell in his store.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna Z. has a business selling fish at one of the busy local markets in Melitopol, Ukraine. Anna’s family has been involved in fish selling for some time. Anna’s mother-in-law was an expert for many years selling fish and Anna’s husband has an identical business at another market. Anna has been selling for about five years and has benefited from the experience and advice of her mother-in-law. Anna and her husband have two small daughters. Their businesses provide the sole means of income for their family.

Anna has requested a loan of $600 to purchase a supply of raw fish that she will be able to marinate and re-sell at her fish stand. This type of fish is popular in Ukraine and should sell well. Anna has benefited in the past with financial assistance from Nadiya Ukraine. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist her with her business.

loans.use: Purchase fish inventory to marinate

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov has a small retail business selling personal care items, jewelry and souvenirs from a little stand at a market near the train station in Melitopol, Ukraine. She has much experience as an entrepreneur having been in business for over twelve years. Previously, Lubov had served in the military and is now retired. In addition to her business activities she is also on the town council in Melitopol. Lubov is divorced and has one son whom she is helping obtain a college education.

Lubov has requested an eight month loan of $1000 to increase her available business capital. She hopes to continue developing and growing her business so that it will be able to meet her financial needs in the future.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Kamuli C1 (E) Group

texts.en: Betty is 32 years old. She is a caterer and owns a small restaurant. With the extra profits, she intends to expand her business by building a bigger restaurant.

loans.use: To stock her restaurant and catering business

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is an experienced entrepreneur who has been selling in the market for over ten years. She currently has a business selling sports clothing which she enjoys because it helps encourage healthy lifestyles. Valentina has a small kiosk at the center of the large Central Market in Melitopol. It is in a prestigious row of businesses with a great location and lots of passing customers. Valentina is married and has one grown daughter. Her granddaughter is also an entrepreneur and Valentina hopes to use some of her profits to help her granddaughter develop her business. 

Valentina has requested a loan of $600 to purchase new inventory for her kiosk. She hopes to continue earning a good income and be able to support her family.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married and has a grown son. She lives in the Zaporozhye region of Ukraine and runs a small business selling women’s outer-wear in several markets.

Yelena owns four vending facilities in the towns of Volodarskoye, Kamish-Zorya, Chernigovka and Pology. Yelena has been in this trade for 10 years. Her inventory is characterized by uniqueness and high quality. She tries to choose good quality merchandise which will always be in demand and sell well.

Yelena is requesting a loan of $200 to increase her stock of jackets, sheepskin coats, sweaters and hats for the winter season. She believes her conscientious efforts and perseverant work will help her expand her trade even more and boost her sales. Yelena is planning to use a portion of her profits to support her son’s family financially. She is ready to invest in her family's well-being and is planning to work hard to ensure a stable future for them.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Kamuli C1 (F)) Group

texts.en: Fatuma is 42 years old. She is divorced and has three children. She runs a beauty salon. She would use the extra profits to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr:
Mr. Komlan A. is 35 and a married father of six children. He has been a butcher for over ten years, and this is his principal source of income. With this income, he pays for his children's school fees and health costs and the family's other expenses. With this loan, Mr. Komlan A. would like to increase his supply of meat in order to meet his customers' ever-growing demand.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr Komlan A. est agé de 35 ans, marié et père de 06 enfants. Il exerce l'activité de la boucherie depuis plus de 10 ans. Sa principale source de revenu vient principalement de cette activité. Avec ce revenu il finance les charges de scolarités de ses enfants , de leur santé et autres charges familliales. Avec cet emprunt Mr Komlan A. pense augmenter son stock de bétail afin de satisfaire la demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle

loans.use: Purchase of 5 cows, 3 goats and 5 rams to slaughter and sell the meat at the market in Kpalimé

loans.name: Zuhrajon

texts.en: J. Zuhrajon lives in Spitamen and she is married and has 4 children. Mrs. J. Zuhrajon applied to MicroInvest in 2007 and recommended herself as a serious and executive client. Mrs. J. Zuhrajon is experienced in business of livestock and has the appropriate knowledge. She has been engaged in the livestock business from her early years when she helped firstly her mother on the farm and now she helps her husband. It is the family business that brings the general income. Now she works in the hotel “Orom,” too, but most of the time she is engaged in the family business. She is engaged in milk production and its work out. In time she dreams of purchasing a pedigree milk-cow for the milk-sour products making. Now Mrs. J. Zuhrajon requests a loan of $375 for the milk-cow purchasing.

loans.use: milk-cow purchase

loans.name: Ese

texts.en: Mrs. Ese O. is 42 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Benin City. She specializes in selling  smoked fish, a business she's been in since 2005. Ese is requesting a loan of $450 to buy more fish so she can service more customers. She is a LAPO member and a very hard worker dedicated to improving her children's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her business

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.en:
Alexandra S. is a widow with one grown son named Valeryi. They live in Vasilyevka.

Alexandra sells clothing in the local market. She has been in this trade for 10 years. Alexandra believes her consistent efforts and perseverant labor have helped her reach success in business. Presently, Alexandra has about $2000 in inventory.

Alexandra is willing to work hard to see her business grow and expand. She wants to continue to support her family and grandchildren which is why she hopes to keep her business sustainable and receive a stable income. Alexandra says she will put in many hours to get the job done and make sure that her venture achieves its full potential. She is requesting a loan of $200 to increase her inventory stock.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Kamuli B1 (A) Group

texts.en: Joy is married with three children. She owns a small drug shop. With the extra business profits, she intends to open up a clinic and start admitting patients.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine

loans.name: Ruzimatova

texts.en: Ruzimatova F. lives in Spitamen (Soghd oblast, Tajikistan). Mrs. Ruzimatova F.  applied to MicroInvest in 2007 and recommends herself as a serious and executive client. The business stability and income increases she's had have helped her to return the previous loan and to improve her business situation. Mrs. Ruzimatova F. is experienced in business of livestock and has the appropriate knowledge in the livestock because she has been engaged in the livestock business from her early years when she first helped her mother on the farm with cows and sheep, and now she helps her husband. It is the family business that brings in the general income. She is engaged in the home of livestock raising and selling and milk production. In time, she dreams of purchasing a horn pedigree milk-cow for the milk-sour (cultured milk) products and selling. Now Mrs. Ruzimatova F. requests a loan for business development to increase significantly the family income and to purchase another milk-cow.

loans.use: For business development

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr:
Mrs. Adzo A. is 27 and a married mother of two children, both of whom are in school. She has been in this business for nearly five years. With the income she earns, she helps pay the family's expenses and pays for 25% of her children's school fees. With this loan, Mrs. A. would like to expand her business in order to better meet her customers' needs.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Adzo A. est agée de 27 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants tous à l'école. Elle exerce cette activité depus bientôt 5 ans. Avec les revenus de son activité elle participe aux dépenses du foyer et supporte à 25% la scolarité de ses enfants. Avec ce crédit madame Adzo souhaite augmenter la capacité de son commerce pour mieux satisfaire les besoins de ses clients.

loans.use: Purchase of 4 bales of traditional cloth for resale

loans.name: Kamuli B1 (B) Group

texts.en: Christine owns a retail shop. She wants to use the extra profits to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for her shop

loans.name: Layla

texts.en: Layla is a 41 year old mother of 3. She lives with her family in the region of Keserwan. She used to paint drawings on fabric but after watching a TV program on creating handicraft with egg shells, she started learning this skill on her own until she mastered the art. Layla needs $300 to buy the necessary material to continue producing her newly-learned lovely art work.

loans.use: To buy material for her business

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina K. is married with a grown son and a 14-year-old daughter. Her family lives in Berdyansk, on the Azov Sea.

Marina works in the local market, “Privoz”, selling women’s pants, skirts and footwear. One of the advantages of her business is a good balance of price and quality. Marina has been working with Nadiya Ukraine for four years. She has a perfect credit history and can be characterized as a very disciplined client with integrity. Currently, Marina has about $7000 in inventory. Her turnover capital is about $6000 and her monthly net profit is about $4000.

Marina is hoping to use this loan of $1200 to help attract additional funding, modernize her business and increase customer demand. She also wants to use some of her profits to remodel her apartment and possibly purchase a vehicle which would serve business purposes and make life more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Kamuli B1 (C) Group

texts.en: Hadijah runs a poultry business. She would like to use the extra business profits to build rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase poultry for breeding

loans.name: Georges

texts.en: George is a very ambitious 26 year old person. He is a self-made man who owns a mini market. With the revenue generated by his business, he was able to buy a house and to open a shop selling mobile phones. George is a very hardworking micro-entrepreneur. This is his 4th loan from Al Majmoua. He is requesting $1,200 to buy merchandise for his business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Alexan

texts.en: Alexan is a 52 year old father of twins. He lives in the region of Beirut with his family. He owns a mini market and provides for his family with the revenue generated by the mini mart. This is  Alexan's 12th loan from Al Majmoua, as he is always planning to develop his grocery store. He needs to buy enough merchandise to continue expanding his store.

loans.use: To buy enough merchandise

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Mrs. Abra E. is 38 and a married mother of four children, three of whom are in school. She helps pay the family's expenses with the profit she earns from her business and pays the school fees for her second child. With this loan, Mrs. E. would like to expand her business while meeting the needs of her growing customer base.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Abra E. est âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 03 fréquentent. Elle participe aux charges du foyer par les profits qu'elle tire de son activité et supporte les charges scolaires son deuxième enfant. Par ce crédit madame Adzo souhaite améliorer la capacité de son commerce tout en satisfaisant les besoins de la clientèle qui ne cesse d'augmenter au jour le jour.

loans.use: Purchase of 10 bags of corn, 5 bags of beans and 8 bags of millet and renting of a storehouse

loans.name: Albert

texts.en: Albert is a 37 year old father. He lives with his family in the region of Keserwan. Albert is a car mechanic who fixes steering wheels. He used to have just a small car workshop but after earning a reputation as a good mechanic, he formed a partnership with another mechanic and opened a larger workshop. Albert needs a loan to sustain and continue developing his business.

loans.use: To maintain his auto repair workshop

loans.name: Namataba A Group
