texts.en: Christine S. is married and has three children. She runs a hardware store, and has joined with four of her friends to apply for a loan to expand it. Because the rent in her shop's current location is high, Christine plans to use the extra profits to build her own shop.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for a hardware store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 53 year old mother of 4. She lives with her family in the region of Mount Lebanon. Mary is a hospital employee. She also owns a mini market in order to provide for her family. This is the 8th loan Mary is requesting from Al Majmoua. She is asking for $1,200 to purchase merchandise to keep her grocery store going.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Mrs. Angela O. is 30 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City. Angela sells box speakers, a business she started in 2005. She is requesting a loan of $450 to expand her business.  She is a LAPO client who works hard and enjoys her work. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy materials for production of Electronics Speakers

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 25 year old young man who owns a DVD store. Mohamad is a self-made man, an ambitious and determined young entrepreneur. Mohamad needs a loan to be able to widen the variety of the movies he can offer his clients. Boosting sales is important for him so that his store can generate enough revenue to pay for his father's medicA. bills.

loans.use: To widen the variety of movies sold in his DVD store

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Mrs. Beatrice O. is 50 years old and married with 7 children. She lives in Benin City. Beatrice sells Garri (a popular West African food made from cassava tubers) to people living in her community. Beatrice has been in this business since 1996. She is requesting a loan of $450 to expand her supply of Garri. She is a hard-working LAPO member.

loans.use: To expand her supply of Garri

loans.name: Namataba B Group

texts.en: Jane Francis K. is 42 years old and married with five children. She owns a retail shop where she sells products that the people in her area use in their homes. She and her colleagues have applied for a loan to expand this business.  Jane Francis plans to use the additional profits to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy new products to sell

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: Zeinab is a 20 years old young woman. Zeinab lives in the region of Beirut. She is paying her university tuition fees with the revenue generated by her DVD business. She now needs a loan in order to purchase new movies to sustain and develop her business and to be able to pursue her studies.

loans.use: To purchase new movies

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en: My name is Nasreen K., and I am the wife of Muhammad Arshad. I live with my family in a small town, Borewala, in Pakistan. I need a loan for my husband to repair his tractor. He uses his tractor to plough the fields. I plan to repair my house in the future, if our income increases. I mostly do my household chores, but whenever I get time I embroider clothes that I get on order from the women in my neighborhood. I have a few friends in my neighborhood who are my loan group members as well, let me introduce them to you: Safia W., who plans to use the loan for her son’s salon; Rafia B., who became divorced two years ago, and she runs a beauty salon to make her living and now needs a loan to improve her business; and Nasreen N., who will invest the loan in their used items trading business.

loans.use: Get our tractor repaired

loans.name: Namataba C Group

texts.en: Margret M. is married and has two children. She runs a stall in the local market where she sells food. Margret also leads a group of five women who have applied for a loan to expand this food-selling business. Margret plans to use the extra income to build a home for herself and her family.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en: Mrs. Agatha E. is 60 years old and divorced with 3 children. She lives in Benin City. Agatha sells recharge cards & video cassettes, a business she started in 2004. She is requesting a loan of $450 so she can buy more recharge cards and video cassettes to satisfy her customers. She is a dependable, hard-working LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more Recharge cards & Video cassettes to sell

loans.name: Kito A Group

texts.en: Edith S. is married and has six children. She runs a small appliance-repair shop, and has joined with a group of her friends to apply for a loan to expand the business. With the extra income made possible by this expansion, she would like to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: To expand a small appliance-repair business

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 26 year old father who lives with his family in Beirut. Mahmoud is an independent and ambitious young man who owns and runs his own butcher shop. He provides for his family with the earnings from his business. This is the first time Mahmoud is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. He is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for his butcher shop.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Komil

texts.ru:
Komil T. was born in the city of Hudjanda. He is 40 years old, married and has 3 children. His wife works as a school teacher. Komil works as head of military headquarters. His close friend and colleague wishes to travel to Russia in order to get additional military training. Komil came to MicroInvest hoping to secure a loan that will allow him to purchase an airplane ticket for his friend.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Тошходжаев Комил , уроженец г. Худжанда возрост 40 лет имеет троих детей и жену учительницу в средней школе.Сам работает в военном штабе начальником.Комил имеет близкого друга и коллегу по работе.Он хочет помочь взять авиа билет для друга .Его друг хочет уехать в Россию для переквалификации в военной деятельности.Для этого Комил захотел взять кредит в Микроинвесте для приобретения авиабилета.

loans.use: purchase of an airplane ticket for his friend

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Afi A. is 42 and a married mother of three children. She has been working in this industry for ten years. Her primary source of income is the profit she earns from her sales. This allows her to meet her family's needs, as her husband's income is not enough to pay all of their expenses. With this loan, she would like to purchase 300 yams in order to satisfy her principal customers, which are restaurants with high demand. In the photo, Mrs. A. is seated third from the left.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

madame Afi A. est est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle tient ce secteur depuis 10 ans. Sa principale source de revenu est les profits qui proviennent de ses ventes et subvient aux besoins de sa famille étant donné que le revenu de son mari n'arrive pas à supporter les charges du foyer. Elle désire avec ce fonds, acheter 300 unités d'ignames pour satisfaire plus ses principaux clients qui sont les restaurants dont la demande est imprtante. madame Afi est celle qui est assise en troisième position en partant de la gauche.

loans.use: Purchase of 10 units (300 total) of yams for resale

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: AmA. is a 49 year old mother of one, living with her family in Beirut. AmA. is a handicraft artist and is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua -her second to date- to buy materials to sustain and continue developing her business.

loans.use: To buy enough material

loans.name: Kito B Group

texts.en: Stella N. is single and the mother of one child. She supports her small family by selling new clothing, and has joined with four of her friends to secure a loan to buy more inventory. With the extra profits made possible by this loan, Stella plans to open a retail shop.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Blossom

texts.en: Mrs. Blossom A. is 30 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Benin City.  Blossom is a tailor who sews and sells material in her community. She has been in this business since 2003. She is requesting a loan of $875 to purchase more material for her business.sews and sells tailoring material for people in her community. Blossom is a hard-working LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more material for her tailoring business

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en: Zahra is 28 years old and single. She lives in Beirut, where she runs a clothing store. She aims to generate enough revenue to be able to open a new store. This is the second time Zahra is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. A $1000 loan would help her take a significant step towards accomplishing her business expansion plan.

loans.use: To help her open a new business

loans.name: Rissala

texts.en: Rissala is a 43 year old woman and the mother of a young girl. The two of them live in Beirut, where Rissala works as a tailor. Rissala is a very competent tailor and has a large number of clients. Rissala's work is much appreciated. This is the second time Rissala is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. She needs to purchase material to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To purchase material for her tailoring business

loans.name: Kito C Group

texts.en: Harriet T. runs a small business selling firewood and charcoal to the people of her community. She also leads a group of five applicants who would like a loan to buy more inventory to sell in the local market. Harriet will use the extra income made possible by this loan to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is a 52 year old mother of 3 living with her family in Beirut. She owns a dry cleaning business and is requesting her fourth A. Majmous loan to cover the maintenance costs of her business in order to sustain and continue developing it.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance costs for her laundry business

loans.name: Kito D Group

texts.en: Rose N. is 35 years old and divorced with five children. She runs a small restaurant and also offers catering services. She and her four associates have applied for a loan to buy more food warmers for the restaurant and catering business. Rose would like to use the extra income she makes from the loan to buy a piece of land and build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy more food warmers to use in a small restaurant

loans.name: Hanifan's Group

texts.en: I am Hanifan B., and am the wife of Nazir Ahmed. I was born in a small town, Pakpattan, but moved to another small town, Borewala, after my marriage. I need a loan for my husband’s fruit business. He operates his business on a fruit cart in one of the nearby busy markets. I am a mother of three sons and four daughters. Three of my kids are married and live separately. I have two other members in my loan group who are very responsible: Gulshan P., who needs a loan for her husband to buy a rickshaw; and Zaibunisa, who requires a loan for her beauty parlor.

loans.use: Expand fruit business

loans.name: Fahima

texts.en: Fahima is a young, 24 year old young woman living in the region of Mount Lebanon. Fahima is a very ambitious and hard working person who is currently helping her fiancé set up their future home. Fahima owns a grocery store and is requesting a loan -her third from Al Majmoua- to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Miss Mercy O. is 28 years old, single, and lives in Benin City. Mercy sells bread, beverages & cloth, a business she has been in since 2000. She is requesting a loan of $450 to purchase more stock so she can satisfy more customers. She is a dedicated worker and a LAPO client.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her business

loans.name: Nabulezi A Group

texts.en: Peace K. is married and has four children. She helps support her family by selling fruits and vegetables in her town's local market. Peace also leads a group of five women who have applied for a loan to buy more produce to sell to their customers and to start a carpentry workshop.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell and to open a carpentry business

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en: I live in the small town of Borewala in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of five girls and three boys. I need a loan to buy my younger son a rickshaw. I know he can do well, because my elder son is also a rickshaw driver and he has trained his brother. I am a group leader of four other women: Ghaforan M., who plans to buy her son a rickshaw; Naseem Akhtar, who is a widow and needs a loan for their wood business; Kishwer B. will invest the loan in their sheep trading; and Farah A. needs a loan for her husband who paints roads such as pedestrian crossings.

loans.use: Buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Salwa

texts.en: Salwa is a 52 year old mother of 3 who lives with her family in Aley, Lebanon. In addition to baking a special type of Lebanese bread called 'saj', Salwa also produces handicrafts. This is the second time she is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. She needs to buy enough provisions to sustain and develop her bakery business.

loans.use: To buy enough provisions for her bakery business

loans.name: Shovket

texts.en: I. Shovket is a 63-year-old woman who owns her small business in the small village in Saatli region. She has more than ten years of experience in selling dairy products to the local people and bazaar traders. She is married and has four children. Keeping a milk cow is the only financial source for her family. She is IDP, and lives with her family in an IDP camp in poor conditions. Shovket knows how hard it is to cover family expenses, she knows that  it is not enough to keep just one cow. She needs to expand her business and purchase two additional milk cows, for $600 each. I. is requesting a loan of $1200.

loans.use: To purchase two milk cows

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Miss Joy O. is 28 years old, single, and lives in Benin City. Joy has been sewing clothes for people in her community since 2004. She began her business after training for 3 years. Joy is requesting a loan of $450 to buy more material and items for tailoring so she can improve her business. She is a very hard worker and a LAPO client. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials for her business

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en: Ramil Takhmazov is a 28-year-old young businessman who lives with his wife and two children in an IDP camp in Bilasuvar region. Ramil's major source of income is from the sale of milk and yogurt from his one cow. But one cow does not provide enough milk to meet his family's expenses. Ramil is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase two more milk cows so he can improve his business and earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase two milk cows

loans.name: Nabulezi B Group

texts.en: Beatrice W. is married and has two children. She operates a public pay phone which people in her area use when they need to make calls. She and her colleagues have applied for a loan to buy more airtime cards to sell to their customers. Beatrice plans to use the extra income to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more airtime cards to sell to customers who would like to make phone calls

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Mrs. Vero I. is 48 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Benin City where she sells wood, a trade she started in 2004 after studying the trade for 2 years. She is requesting a loan of $450 to increase her stock and expand her business. Vero is a LAPO client, and a very hard worker.

loans.use: To increase her stock of wood

loans.name: Shakir

texts.en: Shakir B. is 43-year-old man who raises livestock in the southern region Bilasuvar. He sells calves for meat production and keeps one cow for dairy products. He is married and has two children. He lives in an IDP settlement and does not have a job. He would like to expand his business and  purchase two more milk cows for $600 each. Shakir is requesting a loan of $1200 to improve his dairy product business.

loans.use: To purchase two milk cows

loans.name: Balli

texts.en: Khanikishiyeva Balli is 35-year-old woman who has been selling dairy products for five years in her IDP settlement in Bilasuvar region . She sells milk and yogurt to the local bazaar traders and sometimes to neighbors. Her business is the only income source in her poor family. She tries very hard to cover her family's needs. She is requesting a loan of $1100 to purchase on milk cow and two calves so she can improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase two baby calves and one milk cow

loans.name: Hameedan's Group

texts.en: I am Hameedan A. R., and I am married and a mother of seven. I live in a three room brick house with my family in Borewala, a small town in Pakistan. One of my sons runs a music center and currently he needs a loan to buy some stock for his store. He started this business with the loans that we took earlier from Asasah, a microfinance institution in Pakistan.  I have a few other women in my loan group and I want them to get loans as well: Sughran B., who needs a loan to buy a rickshaw for her son; Azra B. will invest the loan in their livestock trading; and Parween B. is a widow and needs a loan for their cloth manufacturing business.

loans.use: Buy stock of music discs for the store

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Mrs. Kate O. is 39 years old and married with 1 child. She sells wood in her community, a trade she studied for two years before beginning her own business in 2005. Kate is requesting a loan of $875 to purchase more wood, so she can increase her sales. She is a LAPO member, and a dedicated worker.

loans.use: To increase her stock of wood

loans.name: Kaneez's Group

texts.en: My name is Kaneez F., and I am a widow and a mother of nine: six boys and three daughters. I live with my family in a small town called Borewala in Pakistan. None of my kids could attend school, due to our impoverished condition that we had to face after my husband’s death. I need a loan for my son to expand his barber shop. Last year, I received a loan for his barber shop, and with its profits I bought a television for my house. My group members are: Rani T., who requires a loan for her bangles and grocery store; Hasmat B., who will buy a goat with the loan; Shahnaz B., who requires a loan for her poultry farm; and Parween R. needs a loan for her husband’s restaurant.

loans.use: Expand barber shop

loans.name: Sitsofe

texts.fr:
Ms. Sitsofe D. is single and has two children, one in high school and one in middle school. She is 35 and has been selling fruits and vegetables for over five years. Ms. D. is able to pay her children's school fees and the family's other expenses with the profit she earns from her business. Thanks to her good management skills, she was recently able to open a sales stand for her younger sister. With this loan, she would like to expand her business and increase her sales.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Sitsofe D. est célibataire avec 02 enfants dont le prmier est en classe de troisième et le second en classe de sixième. Elle est âgée de 35 ans et exerce ce metier depuis plus de 5 ans. Madame Sitsofe subvient aux charges scolaires de ses enfants et aux autres charges de la famille avec les profits qu'elle tire de son activité. Grâce à sa bonne gestion, elle vient tout récemment d'ouvrir un point de vente pour sa petite soeur. Elle souhaite par ce crédit améliorer la capacité de son activité.

loans.use: Purchase of 10 trays of eggs, 5 boxes of potatoes, 3 baskets of cabbage and 2 baskets of lettuce

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Mrs. Blessing U., is 32 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Benin City. Since 1999, she has been selling baby clothes and other merchandise for babies to people living in her community. Blessing is requesting a loan of $450 to increase her stock so she can meet the needs of more customers. She is a LAPO client who works very hard. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy baby merchandise stock for her business

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en: I am Shamim G. H., and I have lived all my life in Borewala, a small town in Pakistan. I was married eight years ago. I know how to embroider, and in the future I want to start a business of embroidered clothes.  My husband is a rickshaw driver and he bought a rickshaw last year with the credit we obtained from Asasah, a microfinance institution. Now, my husband wants to expand his business by buying another rickshaw. He plans to rent this rickshaw to his brother. Kindly lend us money for this purpose. My group members are:  Parween A., who to buy pesticides and fertilizers; Sughran B., who will use this loan to buy her son a donkey cart, so that he can transport vegetables from the food market to various shops; Anwer B., who requires a loan to buy a donkey cart; Shamim K., who needs a loan to expand our weaving business; and Sakina B., who needs a loan to expand her snacks stall.

loans.use: Buy an additional rickshaw

loans.name: Anwer's Group

texts.en: My name is Anwer G. Fareed, and I have lived in Borewala, a small city in Pakistan, since my marriage. Before my marriage I lived in Faisalabad, an industrial city in Pakistan.  I am a mother of six girls and three sons. My husband wants to buy a rickshaw and needs a loan for this purpose. I weave carpets at my house and earn a good income. I am a group leader of a few other women, who are: Sughran B., who plans to use her loan for her nephew to start a car spare parts shop; and Hameedan B., who needs a loan to buy a rickshaw for her son.

loans.use: Buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Mrs. Florence I. is 51 years old.  She is married, has four children, and lives in Benin City. She sells female clothing. She is requesting a loan of $450 to enable her to buy more clothing to sell.  She spent three years learning about her trade before starting her own business in 2003.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en: I am Shahnaz B., and the wife of Muhammad Ramzan. I am a mother of two: one boy and one girl. I want my children to get an education and, therefore, I will enroll them in school in the near future. My husband trades used items. Currently, our income is small and we want to expand our business, for which we require a loan. We live in a mud house that we have recently constructed. My group members are: Khalida B., who will use the loan to buy a donkey cart to sell vegetables; Jameela B. who also plans to buy a donkey cart; and Rubina B. who needs this loan for her husband to start a beetle nut shop.

loans.use: Expand used items business

loans.name: Farida's Bahati Group

texts.en:
Farida, 34, is a single mother of a 4-year-old son. She is a food vendor, and she sells various types of dishes and snacks from 8 am to 3 pm daily. She has had this business for over 6 years now. In a month, she can make about $27 in profit from her work.

Farida hopes for a loan to increase her food stock for her business. She will be sharing this loan with her subgroup, who like her, are all food vendors in the same neighborhood. They belong to the loan group Bahati, which totals 40 members.

loans.use: To buy more food stock

loans.name: Basheeran's Group

texts.en: My name is Basheeran Q.. I am married and a mother of two boys, both of whom attend kindergarten. I want one of my sons to be a doctor and the other one to join the police. I live with my family in Borewala, a small city in Pakistan. My husband runs a TV cable business and also owns floor grinding machines which he rents out to supplement his income. Currently, he owns two grinding machines and now he wants to buy an additional one, for which we require a loan. My group members are my neighbors and very honest in their dealings. Now, I introduce them to you: Basheeran B. needs a loan to expand her business and manufacture furniture; Basheeran F. requires a loan for her husband to repair his barber shop and also buy other items; and Khalida B. needs this loan to expand her business of manufacturing a local type of sweet known as Murunda.

loans.use: Buy an additional grinding machine

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Mrs. Felicia O. is 50 years old.  She is married, has seven children and lives in Benin City. She sells soup items. Currently, she seeks a loan of $450 to enable her to buy more soup item to sell.  She believes that this will improve her business. Felicia has been in this business since 1992. She is a LAPO client and thanks you for your assistance.

loans.use: to buy more soup items for sale

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Mrs. Comfort I. is 45 years old.  She is married, has five children, and lives in Benin City. She sells yam and garri for a living.  She is requesting a loan of $275 to buy more yam and garri to sell. She has been in this business since 1991. She is a LAPO client.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuff to sell

loans.name: Nabulezi C Group

texts.en: Grace N. is 27 years old, married and has two children. She owns a small canteen where she sells groceries. Grace also leads a group of applicants who need a loan to build a small grocery store where they can sell food to the people of their village. Grace plans to use the income made possible by the store to send her children to good schools.

loans.use: To build a small grocery store

loans.name: Allah's Group

texts.en: I am Allah R., and wife of Muhammad Rafique. I have lived in a small town called Borewala in Pakistan for the past 20 years. I am a mother of eight: five boys and three girls. My husband buys and sells used items and gadgets. The used items include iron, steel and plastic goods. My husband now requires a loan to buy used items in bulk. He also sells fruit. I am a group leader of other women and all of us have acquired loans together before, and we are mutually responsible for each other's loans. Sakina B. needs a loan to buy a rickshaw for her brother, who currently drives someone else’s rickshaw on rent; and Shahnaz B. will invest the loan in her son’s readymade garments business.

loans.use: Buy used items in bulk for the business

loans.name: Nneka

texts.en: Mrs. Nneka M. is 37 years old.  She is married, has four children and lives in Benin City. She sells drinks and toiletries for a living.  She is seeking a loan of $450 to enable her to buy more drinks and toiletries to sell.  She learned about business from her mother and started her own business in 1997. She thanks you for your help.

loans.use: to buy drinks and toiletries to sell

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en: I am Samina B. from Borewala, a small town in Punjab, a province in Pakistan. I and my brother sell clothes to make our living. Last year, I took a loan for my business and as a result of my business expansion I bought a TV and a cow. I am also saving and collecting dowry for my marriage. I need a loan to further expand my business. The other women who are in need of loans are: Sobia B., who requires a loan for her husband who wants to start his own embroidery business, as he currently embroiders for someone else; Kalsoom B.‘s husband supplies wood to various brick furnaces and now he needs a loan to improve his business; Rasool B. needs a loan to buy her husband a donkey cart; and Naseeba B. is a widow who wants a loan to buy her son a rickshaw on installments.

loans.use: Expand clothing sales business

loans.name: Sada's Tujikomboe Group

texts.en:
Sada, 27, is married and has 3 children (ages 12, 9, and 7). She also takes care of her parents. Sada runs a food business and sells various types of dishes and snacks between 7am and 3 pm daily. She began this business in 2006 and now makes a monthly profit of about $140. She hopes to expand her business with a loan.

Sada will be sharing this loan with her subgroup, who have businesses in donuts, eggs, and other food sales. They belong to a loan group called Tujikomboe, which totals 30 members who ensure that others in the group meet their obligations.

loans.use: To increase food inventory

loans.name: Mukisa A Group

texts.en: Catherine K., who leads this group of loan applicants, is married and has five children. She makes a living selling tomatoes in her town's local market, and would like to buy a plot of land on which she and her associates can grow their own tomatoes. Catherine plans to use the extra income from the plot to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land on which to grow tomatoes

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Mrs. Joy O. is 30 years old.  She is married, has two children, and lives in Benin City.  She sells drinks and recharge cards.   She is seeking a loan of $450 to enable her to buy more drinks and recharge cards to sell. She spent a year learning her trade before starting her business in 2007. She is a LAPO client.

loans.use: to buy more drinks and recharge cards for sale

loans.name: Abida's Group

texts.en: I am Abida A. D., and I am married and a mother of three. I live with my family in a small town called Borewala in Pakistan. My husband is a rickshaw driver and at present, he drives someone else's rickshaw on rent. Therefore, acquiring a loan to buy our own rickshaw will increase our income. I embroider and stitch clothes on order. My husband and I also tried our luck in the big city of Lahore, but could not find employment there and came back to our town. Now, if our income increases, I plan to construct an additional room in my house.  I have a few other members in my loan group and I want all of these women to get loans for their businesses so that they can bring about positive changes in their lives. These members are: Kishwer P., who is a widow and a mother of one son, and trades sheep and goats, needs a loan to buy a few more goats for her business; Shamim A. needs a loan to buy a new stitching machine for her stitching business; Nasim A. plans to invest this loan in her husband's business of supplying candies and toffees to various shops in the city; Zarina B., who needs money to start a fruit business; and Rukkiah A., who needs a loan to buy her husband a donkey cart.

loans.use: Buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Mukisa B Group

texts.en: Justine K., who leads this group of five loan applicants, is married and has three children. She owns a small medical clinic, and will use the loan to buy more beds for her patients. She intends to use the increased income made possible by these beds to buy a generator.

loans.use: To buy more beds for the patients in a medical clinic

loans.name: Grace's Tujikomboe Group

texts.en:
Grace, 30, is married and has 2 children (ages 10 and 7). She runs a clothing business, which she began in 2005. Every day, she sells from 10 am to 5 pm, and now she can make a monthly profit of about $70 from this business.

Grace hopes for a loan to buy more clothing for resale. She will share this loan with Amina, a member of her loan group. Amina is a food vendor and lives in the same neighborhood as Grace.

loans.use: To buy clothing stock

loans.name: Parween's Group

texts.en: I am Parween M. S. from Borewala, a small town in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of four: two boys and two girls. We live in a one room brick mud house. My husband trades goats and sheep, and he plans to buy a few additional goats for his business. I also help my husband in his business and take care of his goats and sheep. My group members are: Naziran B., who needs a loan to buy her son a rickshaw; Ramzana B., who needs a loan to buy goats and start our livestock trading; Barkat B. needs a loan to buy her husband a rickshaw; Naziran I., who will invest the money in her husband’s sheep and goat trading; and Zarina B. requires a loan for their rickshaw repairing business.

loans.use: Buy additional goats for the business

loans.name: Parween's Group

texts.en: I am Parween M. S. from Borewala, a small town in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of four: two boys and two girls. We live in a one room brick mud house. My husband trades goats and sheep. Currently, he plans a loan to buy few additional goats for his business. I also help my husband in his business and take care of his goats and sheep. My group members are: Naziran B. needs a loan to buy her son a rickshaw. Ramzana B. tends a loan to buy goats to start our livestock trading. Barkat B. wants a loan for her husband to buy him a rickshaw. Naziran I. will invest the money in her husband’s sheep and goats trading.  Zarina B. requires this loan for their rickshaw repairing.

loans.use: Buy additional goats for the business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Mrs. Gina C. is 29 years old.  She is married, has three children, and lives in Benin City. She sells drinks. She is requesting a loan of $450 to buy more drinks to sell.  She spent six months learning about the trade before starting her business in 2005.  Mrs. C. is very committed to her business and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Rukkiah's Group

texts.en: My name is Rukkiah A. A.. I have two sons and six daughters, and my husband is retired and currently not working. My elder son is the bread winner of the family and I need a loan for him to buy a rickshaw on installments. Currently, he drives someone else rickshaw that produces a meager income. Koser P., Muniran B. and Zubaida B. all need loans to buy their sons rickshaws. Hajran B. will invest the loan in her husband’s business as a farmer.  I hope all of these women will make the best of these loans, and that their economic conditions improve.

loans.use: Buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Rukia's Tuimarike Group

texts.en:
Rukia, age 30, is a single mother of a 10-year-old. She also takes care of her 20-year-old niece who is dependent on her. Rukia owns a cosmetics business, which she started in 2006. She works from 7am to 8 pm daily and can now make a monthly profit of about $280 from her sales.

Rukia hopes for a loan to buy more cosmetics for resale. She will share this loan with her subgroup, who have businesses dealing in clothing, juice, and food sales.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics inventory

loans.name: Masanda A Group

texts.en: Maureen S. is married and has five children. She helps support her family by running several small companies, including tailoring, brick-making and poultry-farming businesses. She and the other four loan applicants shown in the photo have come to us for a loan to expand the brick-making business they operate. Maureen intends to use the extra money she will make to increase her poultry farming business.

loans.use: To expand a brick-making business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Mrs. Grace A. is 40 years old.  She is married, has four children, and lives in Benin City. She sews and also sells clothes and tailoring materials.  She is seeking a loan of $700 to buy clothes and tailoring materials.  She believes this will help her improve her business. She spent four years learning the trade and started her business in 1986. She is a LAPO member.

loans.use: to buy clothes and tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Haneefa's Group

texts.en: I am Haneefa B., and I live in a small semi-urban town, called Kot Radha Kishan in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of two: one boy and one girl. My son is in grade seven and my daughter is in grade five. My husband works at a local factory. I sell milk from my house and now I want to buy an additional cow for my business. I have a few group members in my loan group: Reshma B. and Asiah B. need loans to buy cows; and Anofi B. wants a loan to pay off the remaining installments of the cow. All of these women are very hard working entrepreneurs and we are responsible for each other's loans.

loans.use: Buy an additional cow

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Ms. Daisy E. is 26 years old. She is single and lives in Benin City. She operates a restaurant where she sells cooked food and drinks. She requests a loan of $700 to buy more drinks to sell. She started her restaurant in 2004. She is a LAPO client.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuff and drinks to sell

loans.name: Subhani's Group

texts.en: I am Subhani M., and I am a mother of five: two of whom attend school. I belong to a small town called Kot Radha Kishan in Pakistan. Last year, I started a grocery shop with the loans we received from Asasah, a microfinance institution. Currently, I require another loan to buy stock for my store. The other women who need loans with me are: Shazia B., who needs a loan to expand her beetle nut shop; Zahida B., who needs loan to buy a cow; and Sakina B., who will use the loan to buy a cow; and Arshad B., who requires a loan to expand her milk business. I help these women because I want to help these women to have an important place in their houses and help them provide income for their families.

loans.use: Buy stock for the grocery store

loans.name: Subhani's Group

texts.en: I am Subhani M.. I am a mother of five: two of whom attend school. I belong to a small town Kot Radha Kishan in Pakistan. Last year, I started a grocery shop with the loans we took from Asasah, a microfinance institution. Currently, I require another loan to buy stock for my store. The other women who need loans with me are: Shazia B. tends a loan to expand their beetle nut shop. Zahida B. needs loan to buy a cow. Sakina B. will also use the loan to buy a cow. Arshad B. requires this loan to expand their milk business. I help these women because I want to have these women an important place in their houses and help them bring incomes to their families.

loans.use: Buy stock for the grocery store

loans.name: Masanda A (Ii) Group

texts.en: Hasifah N., who leads this group of five loan applicants, is 39 years old and married with four children. She and the other women in the photo run a stone quarry, which they would like to expand. Once that task is complete, Hasifah hopes to use the extra income she will earn to open up a stall in her town's local market.

loans.use: To expand a stone quarry business

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en: I am Mariam S., and I live in a lush green small town called KRK, Pakistan. I am a mother of ten, and we have a family business of milk sales. Last year, I bought a cow for my business with the loans we received from Asasah, a microfinance institution. I want to increase the milk production to increase our income, therefore, we need a loan. I am a guarantor of a few more women in my neighborhood, and they are: Maqbool B., who requires loan to buy a cow; Zarina B., who will invest the loan in their beetle nut shop; and Rani B. who needs a loan to expand her milk business.

loans.use: Buy an additional cow

loans.name: Fatuma's Tuimarike Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, 36, is married and has 8 children (ages 20, 18, 16, 14, 12, 10, 7, and 3). She runs a business selling snack foods, which she began in 2002. She works daily from 7 am to 10 pm and makes a monthly profit of about $105 from this business.

Fatuma hopes to take out a loan to buy more food stock in order to increase her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup who have businesses dealing in clothing and food sales.

loans.use: To buy food stock

loans.name: Masanda A (Iii) Group

texts.en: Hanifa N., who leads the group of five women applying for this loan, is married and has three children. She and her partners earn a living by running a stone quarry, which they would like to expand, as well as open a sand  quarry. Hanifa is excited at the prospect of securing this loan, because the additional income she hopes to earn will allow her to buy a calf.

loans.use: To expand a stone quarry and start a sand quarry

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Mrs. Rachael E. is 59 years old.  She is married, has seven children and lives in Benin City.  She sells soup items and foodstuff. She is requesting a loan of $450 to buy more foodstuff to sell.  She spent a year learning this business before starting her business in 2001. She is a LAPO client.

loans.use: to buy more soup items and foodstuff to sell

loans.name: Masanda (Iv) Group

texts.en: Rebecca is 38 years old and married with four children. She heads a small retail shop, and would like to use the extra profits to finish her shop sites that are under construction.

loans.use: To add stock in a retail shop.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Ms. Roseline O. is 22 years old. She is single and lives in Benin City where she operates a fashion home and also sells tailoring materials. She is seeking a loan of $450 to buy more tailoring material and cloth to sell. She spent three years learning the business before starting her business in 2006. She is a LAPO member.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Salma's Tuimarike Group

texts.en:
Salma, 45, is married and has 5 children (ages 20, 18, 16, 9, and 2). She is a food vendor and works from 6 am to 5 pm daily, selling a variety of dishes and snacks. She began this business in 2004 and now makes a monthly profit of about $82 from this business.

Salma hopes for a loan to increase her food stock. She will share this loan with Edith, a member of her loan group. Edith, also a food vendor, is Salma's neighbor.

loans.use: To buy food stock

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Mrs. Felicia O. is 48 years old.  She is married, has five children, and lives in Benin City. She sells provisions. She is requesting a loan of $450 to enable her to buy more provisions for sale.  She has been in this business for over 30 years. She is a LAPO member.

loans.use: to buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Kazinga A (I) Group

texts.en: Juliet is 33 years old. She has a small poultry farm. She intends to use the extra profits to expand her polutry business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Rosalina's Group

texts.en:
Rosalina, Herminia, and Oton have been members of the community bank “Prosperity” for the past year. In their bank they learned to be disciplined, responsible, and thrifty. They also learned how to care for their families and avoid sickness. They mentioned that in their community banks they forget their problems, it is a time when they can celebrate birthdays, sing, and be happy.

Rosalina, 25, is single. She sells clothing and shoes in open-air markets and to her friends and family. In the past Rosalina sold books but decided to start a new business where she could make more money. Herminia, 53, is married and has two children. She has been selling toys in the Santa Clara market for five years. She also transports her toys to Lima to sell them there. Oton, 38, is single. He owns a factory where he makes musical instruments like guitars, mandolins, and charangos (a small stringed instrument similar to a ukelele). He learned this trade from his father and now sells his instruments from his store and to stores around Peru under the name of “Guitarras A..”

Rosalina, Hermanita, and Oton need loans of 125, 350, and 350 dollars, respectively, which they will invest in shoes; small toys such as toy cars and dolls; and wood, veneer, sealants, leather, and guitar strings.

They hope to use their savings to increase their working capital, to buy a house, and to save some for emergencies.

Herminia and Oton dream of having their own stores and their own homes. They also hope that their children will be professionals. Oton would like to sell all of the accessories needed for musical instruments. Rosalina dreams of finishing her studies.

loans.use:
To buy shoes for a shoe business; small toys for a toy business; and wood, veneer, sealants, leather, and guitar strings
for a musical instrument workshop

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Mrs. Evelyn G. is 42 years old.  She is married, has 5 children, and lives in Benin City.  Her business is selling bread. She is requesting a loan, to the amount of $450, to enable her to buy more bread for sale. She spent 10 months learning this business before starting her business in 1980. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bread to sell

loans.name: Kazinga A (Ii) Group

texts.en: Hanifa is married, and has four children. Her current business is poultry farming. She would to apply for a loan to purchase more birds and increase her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Mr. Patrick O. is 42 years old.  He is married, has 2 children, and lives in Benin City. He sells handsets to people living in his community. He requests a loan of $700 to buy more handsets to sell. He believes that the loan will help him increase his business.  He has been a LAPO client for 2 years.

loans.use: to buy more handsets to sell

loans.name: Kazing A (Iii) Group

texts.en: Grace is 42 years old. She already has a poultry business, however, with the extra profits she will be able to start a mushroom growing business in addition.

loans.use: To invest in the poultry business.

loans.name: Lidia's Group

texts.en:
Lidia, Rosalia, and Deysi are part of the community bank “Prosperidad”. The first two have been members for one year, while Deysi has been a member for seven. In their bank they have learned to save, to be responsible, and to be united. They mentioned that when someone is sick or is in need of anything, all of the associates help out.

Deysi is 25 years old and lives with her partner and son. She sells meat in the Nery Garcia market. She has had her business for two years. Deysi learned this traD. from her grandmother. She travels to the markets around Ayacucho to buy animals and then butchers them.

Rosalia is 22 and also lives with her partner and one son. She was born in the town of Viscapalpa. She brings cheese from her old hometown to sell in different stores and to friends and neighbors.

Lidia is 68 years old. She is a widow and has eight children. Lidia sells grains and root vegetables from a cart in the Santa Clara market, and has done this for 50 years. Deysi, Rosalia, and Lidia need loans of 275, 150, and 200 dollars, which they will invest in sheep, pigs, cheese, corn, wheat, and flowers. They plan to use their savings to start a new business and save some for emergencies.

Deysi dreams of opening an auto parts store and improving her house. Rosalia dreams of having her own house and opening a store that sells windows and other types of glass products. Lidia’s dream is to have good health and, failing that, the money to pay for medical care.

loans.use: To buy sheep, pigs, cheese, corn, wheat, and flowers.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en: Mr. Gabriel O. is 28 years old.  He is married, father of a child, and lives in Benin City.  He earns his living selling frozen fish and chickens.  He is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy more frozen fish and chickens for sale. He spent three years learning how to do business and started his own business in 2002. He is a LAPO client.

loans.use: to buy frozen fish and chickens to sell

loans.name: Kazinga C (I) Group

texts.en: Barbara is 34 years old, married, and has five children. She would like to purchase materials to expand her business and product range.

loans.use: Expand her retail shop

loans.name: Elham

texts.en: Elham is a 37-year-old mother of 3. She lives with her family in Aley. She helps to support her family by creating embroidery work on an instrument called "A. nol." This is the fist time Elham is asking for a loan from A. Majmoua, because she needs to buy materiA. for her business.

loans.use: To buy material for her business

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Mrs. Eunice O. is 38 years old.  She is married, has one child, and lives in Benin City.  She sells frozen chickens and turkeys.  She is requesting a loan of $875 to buy more frozen chickens and turkeys to sell. She spent a year learning how to do business from her sister and started her own business in 2002. She is a LAPO client.

loans.use: to buy frozen chickens and turkeys to sell

loans.name: Joumana

texts.en: Joumana is 50 years old. She lives with her family in Aley. Joumana helps support her 4 children. She knits and produces scarves, bags etc. Joumana needs to buy material to create more work to sell. This is the first time Joumana is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To buy material for her work

loans.name: Serafina's Group

texts.en:
Irma and Serafina have been part of the community bank “Prosperidad” for the past 6 and 12 years, respectively. Serafina is one of the founding members of the bank and started with only two dollars in savings. In the community bank they learned to be punctual and responsible, to save, and to believe in themselves. Serafina told us that with the money she saved she was able to build her house. Meanwhile Irma used her savings to increase her business capital.

Irma, 48, is married and has six children. She has a building that she rents out for events and also serves foods typical of the region. Furthermore, she sells grocery items at the markets in the jungle area near Ayacucho. She travels there once every 15 days. Serafina, 62, is a widow and has seven children. She sells traditional food in the Santa Clara Market. She has had this business for 38 years.

Irma and Serafina need loans of 200 and 550 dollars, respectively, which they will use to buy guinea pigs (a delicacy in Peru), pork, potatoes, oil, rice, sugar, beans, and vegetables. They plan to use their savings to increase their business capital and to buy a motorcycle which their youngest sons will use to work.

Their dreams are that their businesses will continue to grow, thay will be able to start new businesses, and that their children will be professionals.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Sania

texts.en: Sania is 62 years old and a mother of 5. She lives with her family in Aley. Sania is participating in supporting her 5 children. She makes crochet and many kinds of handicraft. She needs to buy materiA. in order to make more items to sell. This is the second time Sania is asking for a loan from A. Majmoua.

loans.use: To buy material for her work

loans.name: Franca

texts.en: Mrs. Franca I. is 41 years old, married with two children and lives in Benin City. She sells frozen chickens and turkeys. She solicits a loan of $875 to buy more frozen chickens and turkeys for sale. She learned her business for 12 months and started hers in 2000. She is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more frozen chickens and turkeys for sale

loans.name: Etaf

texts.en: Etaf is a 44-year-old mother of 3. She lives with her family in the Chouf. Etaf helps support her family. She does crochet work. She needs to buy materiA. to continue producing items. This is the third time Etaf is asking for a loan from A. Majmoua.

loans.use: To buy material for her work

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
The lady Josefina lives on Nicolas Palma Street in the San Pedro zone in the city of La Paz. She is separated from her husband and must support her children. She has a newsstand in España plaza in the Sopacachi zone where she sells candies, crackers, etc. She has been doing this activity for 15 years and this is her only means of subsistence. The loan that she requests is to install a telephone booth, since the location is very commercial and thus to be able to improve her income. Her previous credit history is good, and one can agree to a new loan, as she has already had a loan through Kiva and the repayment went very well.

translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Josefina vive en la calle Nicolás Palma de la zona de San Pedro en la ciudad de La Paz; es mujer separada y mantiene a sus hijos, tiene un Kiosco en la plaza España de la zona de sopocachi donde vende dulces, galletas, etc. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 15 años y es su único medio de subsistencia. El crédito que solicita es para instalar un punto de teléfono (una cabina telefónica) ya que el lugar es muy comercial y así poder mejorar sus ingresos.

Por su antecedente histórico puede acceder a un nuevo crédito, ya era parte de Kiva y pago muy bien.

loans.use: to install a telephone booth in order to improve her income.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria rents a place in the street of Manuel Cofre on Tacagua in the city of La Paz. She makes and sells doughnuts and empanadas in order to provide for her and her mother, since they live together

She is asking for a loan of $ 250 that she will use to buy an oven which she will use to make pies. This will be her second loan through Kiva. The previous loan has been totally cancelled. Her credit history allow her to ask for a new credit, since payment describes her very well like a preferential client.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria vive en alquiler en la calle Manuel cofre de la zona de Tacagua en la ciudad de La Paz; se dedica a la elaboración de donut´s y también vende empanadas con lo cual mantiene a su mama ya que viven las dos solas. El crédito que solicita es para comprar un horno y poder elaborar diferentes pasteles. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita crédito a través de Kiva. El anterior préstamo ha sido cancelado en su totalidad. Por su antecedente Histórico puede acceder a un nuevo crédito, ya que pago muy bien califica como cliente preferencial.

loans.use: To buy an oven for her  bakery business

loans.name: Celina

texts.es:
The lady Celina F. is a person who has worked very hard. For 5 years she has worked to manufacture and sell foods and tortillas in the Israel lewites market of Managua. She is a mother of 3 children, for which she has the responsibility to offer them an education, since they all study in the grade school.

She began selling tortillas by walking around in the market, which incented her to buy her own location at the market until she finally obtained it. Nowadays, in spite of the difficult economic situation that she finds herself in, she has been able to do well, offering a variety of dishes in her business.

For two years, she has successfully completed loans with Ceprodel, from which she has benefited greatly by being able to supply her variety of dishes. In addition she has been able to offer an education to her children that need her so much. Her loan accounts receivable is 12 credits with Ceprodel.

translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Celina F. es una persona muy esforzada, desde hace 5 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida y tortillas en el mercado Israel Lewites de Managua. Es madre de 3 hijos de los cuales tiene la responsabilidad de brindarles educación ya que todos estudian en la primaria.

Inició vendiendo tortillas a la intemperie en el mercado por lo que se propuso conseguir un local propio en el mercado hasta obtenerlo. Hoy en día a pesar de la difícil situación económica que atraviese ha podido salir adelante ofreciendo variedad de platillos en su negocio.

Desde hace dos años, ha realizado prestamos en Ceprodel los cuales le han beneficiado grandemente por el hecho de que ha surtido su variedad de platillos y además ha podido brindarle la educación a sus hijos que tanto necesitan de ella. Su cartera crediticia es de 12 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: To buy materials for making foods for sale.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 35 years old and has two young children. She has been part of the community bank “Maria Antonieta” for the past four years. Here she has learned to save, to be punctual, and to be an exceptional associate of the bank. One year ago Teodora won a special certificate for good conduct from the organization. Teodora is saving to be able to buy a car so that her husband can work as a taxi driver.

For the past two years Teodora has had a small grocery store located near the cemetery in the town of Huamanga. From the same store she serves breakfast and lunch.

With the loan of 1000 dollars she hopes to buy more groceries for her business such as oil, rice, beans, sugar, and milk. She will also buy meat and vegetables for her prepared meals.

At the moment Teodora and her family live in the store. For this reason her dream is to own a house. It would be big and have a garage, and a separate room for each of her children.

loans.use: To stock her grocery and buy ingredients for prepared meals

loans.name: Leo

texts.en: Mr. Leo U. is 29 years old. He is still single and lives in Benin City. He types and photocopies documents for people living in his community. He is soliciting a loan of $875 to enable him to buy additional photocopying machines that will enhance his business. He learned the business for six years and started his in 2005. He is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy additional photocopier machines

loans.name: Marco A.

texts.es:
Marco lives on Ismael Montes Street in the Pasankeri zone of the city of LaPaz with his parents. He works manufacturing bricks along with his brother, who is the one that has the oven. Due to the rains which collapsed his wall, he lost his tools. The loan that he requests is to buy tools so that he can continue his business. Marco does not have a credit history, as this is his first loan with Impro, but from his work record he qualifies to obtain a loan.

translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Marco vive en la calle Ismael Montes de la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz con sus padres; se dedica a la elaboración de ladrillos trabaja juntamente con su hermano que es el que tiene el horno. Debido a las lluvias se derrumbo su pared y perdió sus herramientas; el crédito que solicita es para comprar herramientas y continuar con su actividad.

No tiene historial es su primer crédito con Impro, pero por su actividad califica para obtener un crédito.

loans.use: to buy tools for his brick business.

loans.name: Mirtalia

texts.es:
For 15 years the lady Mirtalia M. has worked selling clothes of all sizes and for all ages in the Israel Lewites market of the city of Managua. She has her own section at the market which she has invested a lot in. Being a single mother with two small children to support, she has managed to supply greater quantities of clothes for her business.

The business began 15 years ago, when she sold by walking in all the markets, being exposed to the sun and to the physical wear produced by walking a lot. Little by little she began to invest in order to pay for a location in the market until she finally obtained it.

Since her achievement of obtaining the section in the market three years ago, she has completed 8 loans with Ceprodel that have greatly impacted her business by allowing her to buy greater quantities of clothes to offer. In addition she has been able to maintain the nucleus of her home, being a single mother, and she has been able to offer an education to her two small children that today more that ever need their mother.

translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace 15 años en la ciudad de Managua en el mercado Israel Lewites, la señora Mirtalia M. se dedica a la venta de ropa de todos tamaños y para todas las edades. Posee un tramo propio el cual le ha costado mucha inversión y por ser una madre soltera y con dos hijos pequeños a que mantener ha logrado surtir de mayores cantidades de ropa su negocio.

El negocio lo comienza hace 15 años vendiendo ambulante en todo el mercado, exponiéndose al sol y al desgaste físico de producidos por el caminar mucho. Poco a poco comenzó a invertir para pagar un local interno en el mercado hasta que lo obtuvo.

Desde que logro obtener el tramo en el mercado hace tres años, ha realizado 8 créditos en Ceprodel que le han impactado grandemente por el hecho de que ha comprado mayores volúmenes de ropa para ofrecer y además ha podido sostener el núcleo de su hogar por ser madre soltera y brindarle la educación a sus dos pequeños que hoy mas que nunca necesitan de su madre.

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel lives in his own home on Moxos street in the tembladerani zone of the city of La Paz. He is 70 years old and he lives only with his wife. The work that he does is making men’s and women’s suits, since he is a tailor. With this activity he supports his wife and covers his needs. The loan that he requests is to buy fabric, threads and other supplies.

His previous history qualifies him as a good client and one can agree to a new loan. He has already been a client of IMPRO since the year 2003 with an excellent repayment record.

translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Fidel vive en casa propia en la calle moxos de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene 70 años y vive únicamente con su esposa, la actividad que realiza es la confección de trajes de varón y de mujer ya que es sastre, con esta actividad mantiene a su esposa y cubre sus necesidades. El crédito que solicita es para comprar tela, hilos y otros.

Su antecedente histórico lo califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2003 con excelentes antecedentes de pago

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread and supplies for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Frida

texts.es:
The lady Frida lives in her own home on Ugarte street in the Tacagua zone of the City of La Paz with her husband and children. Her husband works in a business where they pay very little, so she works making caps and she will create costumes for the Carnival. The loan that she requests is for purchase of fabric and other materials for the making of costumes for the festivals of Carnival that are in next month of February.

From her credit history, one can agree to a new loan, since her previous repayment went very well. She and their husband have been our clients since the year 2006.

translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Frida vive en casa propia en la calle Ugarte de la zona de Tacagua de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo e hijos; el esposo trabaja en una empresa donde le pagan muy poco por lo cual ella se dedica a costura de gorras y por las fecha de carnaval confeccionará disfraces. El crédito que solicita es para compra de tela y otros materiales para la confección de disfraces para las fiestas de Carnaval que son el próximo mes de Febrero.

Por su antecedente Histórico puede acceder a un nuevo crédito, ya que pago muy bien. Ella y su esposo son clientes nuestros desde el año 2006.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, thread and other supplies to make costumes.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario lives in her own home on Adrián Patiño street in the Tembladerani zone in the city of La Paz with her husband and children. The work that she does is to make pastries which she sells in the clothes markets and at the schools when there are classes. The loan that she requests is to enlarge her capital and to buy the commodities that she needs (flour, sugar, yeast, etc.) wholesale in order to reduce her costs and also to buy some tools of her trade, such as molds and baking pans.

Her previous credit history with Impro qualifies her as a very good client and one can agree to a new loan. She has been a client of IMPRO since the year 2004.

translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer

Rosario vive en casa propia en la calle Adrián Patiño de la zona de Tembladerani en la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo e hijos; la actividad que realiza es la elaboración de pasteles los cuales los vende en las ferias de ropa y cuando hay clases en los colegios.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y comprar las materias primas que necesita (harina, azúcar, levadura, etc.) al por mayor para abaratar sus costos y también para comprar algunas herramientas de trabajo, como ser moldes y bandejas para hornear.

Su antecedente Histórico con Impro la califica como muy buena cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Ella es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2004.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, yeast, etc. as well as molds and baking pans.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
From the age of 12, in a small stand at the Israel Lewites Market in Managua, Martha P. has been selling all kinds of plastic products such as chairs, plates, glasses, clothing storage, lamps, etc.

Martha is a single mother who is highly motivated to provide a better life for her son. Today, thanks to the support of Ceprodel, she has obtained 8 loans which she has used to purchase new plastic products to sell. She makes a great effort to increase her income to provide an education for her son, as she is the only income provider in her home.

Desde hace 12 años, en un humilde tramo del Mercado Israel Lewites en Managua, la señora Martha P. se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de producto de plástico tales como sillas, bancas, platos, vasos, contenedores de ropa, lámparas, etc.

Martha es madre soltera, sin embargo posee un gran espíritu de superación para seguir manteniendo a su hijo que se encuentran en la etapa escolar. Hoy en día gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel, ha logrado obtener 8 créditos que los ha utilizado para la compra de nuevos productos plásticos y por tal motivo con mucho esfuerzo busca la manera de aumentar sus utilidades para brindarle la educación a su pequeño ya que ella es el único ingreso económico en su hogar.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE PLASTIC PRODUCTS TO SELL,  AND INCREASE HER INCOME  IN ORDER TO PAY FOR HER SON'S EDUCATION

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy and transport grains such as wheat, quinoa, habas, and cebada

loans.name: Monday

texts.en: Mr. Monday N. is 27 years old, single and lives in Benin City. He works in the sale of rice and beans. He solicits a loan of $600 to buy more rice and beans for sale. He learned his trade for two months and started his business in 2003. He is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more rice and beans for sale

loans.name: Jefferson Emilio

texts.es:
Jefferson O. is a hard working and determined young man. He began selling basic household items in the Lewites Market of Managuq. From the time he was very young, he was characterized as an excellent student. He finished his studies, but with the difficult economic situation in the country, he could not find work in any company. He decided to invest his small savings to start his own business selling every day household items.

He started selling his products outside of the main market 15 years ago, but after some time, he was able to obtain his own space which requires a lot of investment. He needs to put up walls, repair the roof and fix the floor. Aside from all this, Jefferson needs to succeed to take care of and pay for the education of his only son, whom he loves dearly.

For 5 years now Jefferson has been a loyal client of Ceprodel, qualifying for 10 loans which he's used to stock more products, grow his business, and continue to take care of his family.

Jefferson O. es un joven muy esforzado y trabajador. Se desempeña en la venta de abarrotes y granos básicos en el mercado Lewites en Managua. Desde muy niño se caracterizó por ser un excelente alumno, logró terminar sus estudios pero por la difícil situación económica que atravesaba el país no logró obtener trabajo en alguna empresa así que decidió invertir sus pocos ahorros en la compra de productos de abarrotes y granos básicos para venderlos.

Comenzó vendiendo en las afueras del mercado desde hace 15 años pero a medida que pasó el tiempo, obtuvo un local propio que de hecho necesita mucha inversión ya que se encuentra en mal estado por lo que es necesario levantar paredes, reparar el techo y embaldosar el piso. A pesar de todo esto, Jefferson ha logrado sobrevivir para mantener a su único hijo que tanto ama y así brindarle sus estudios.

Desde hace 5 años Jefferson ha sido un fiel cliente de Ceprodel, realizando 10 créditos que los ha utilizado para surtir mas sus productos y de esta manera poder mantener su núcleo familiar.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO INVEST IN HIS BUSINESS AND CONTINUE TO PROVIDE FOR HIS FAMILY

loans.name: Osawu

texts.en: Mrs. Osawu A. is 38 years old. She is married with five children and lives in Benin City. She sells foodstuffs. She learned the business for a period of 18 months, after which she started hers in 1992. She is soliciting a loan of $875 to enable her buy more foodstuffs for sale. She is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis is a young father. He and his family live in one of the areas on the outskirts of the city, in a community where he's established his work and his home. He works in agriculture and transport, but the transport provides the most economic support for his family. He does not own his small motor scooter, but rents it, which limits the possibilities of growing his income. Because he must take care of his 2 year old daughter and his wife, he needs his own scooter for work so that he can get some financial stability and generate more income. He is requesting a loan to invest in the land he cultivates, so that with the earnings from the harvest he'll be able to purchase his own scooter on monthly payments. Remember that when one has obligations as a parent, one does everything possible to see their children happy. This is the goal of Luis.

Luis, es un joven padre de familia que vive en uno de los lugares más alejados de la ciudad y en cuya comunidad nativa ha establecido su trabajo y su hogar.Se desenvuelve en la labor agrícola y el transporte terrestre, siendo esta segunda ocupación la más rentable y gran ayuda económica de su familia; sin embargo el mototaxi en el cual trabaja no es propio sino alquilado motivo por el que Luis ve limitada la posibilidad de aumentar sus ganancias.Debido a que necesita mantener a su hija de dos años y a su esposa requiere de una herramienta de trabajo propia para estabilizar su economía y llevar mayores ingresos a casa. Por eso solicita su apoyo con un préstamo, cuyo dinero invertirá en su terreno de cultivo y con las ganancias de cosecha comprará su propio mototaxi en cuotas módicas que podría pagar.Recuerde que cuando uno tiene obligaciones como padre hace hasta lo imposible por ver a sus hijos felices y Luis es uno de ellos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE A GREATER QUANTITY OF SEEDS AND FERTILIZERS TO MAXIMIZE PROFITS FROM HIS HARVEST.  WITH THE PROFITS,  HE WILL BE ABLE TO PURCHASE HIS OWN SCOOTER FOR HIS TRANSPORT BUSINESS.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a hard-working entrepreneur from Kahovka, a city on the beautiful Dnepr River in southern Ukraine. She has been self-employed for five years. Elena sells  from a small kiosk at the central market in Kahovka. Elena is married and enjoys her children and grandchildren. One of her goals for having her business is to be able to help support her family financially.

Elena requests a short term loan of $500 to purchase new shoes to sell in her kiosk. The shoe sales business involves a high amount of inventory turnover. This loan will help Elena keep a good supply of shoes on-hand and meet customer demand.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Moyzilol

texts.ru:
Moyzilol H. is 53 years old, has finished high school, is married and has 5 children. Mrs. H. has a small stall at the Qurgan-Tube's central market "Atush" where she deals in cosmetics and house cleaning supplies. She is planning to use this loan to expand the variety of goods she is offering to her customers. This will allow the locals to purchase the necessary cosmetics and household goods at prices which are much lower then those of other markets, since the market "Atush" is a whole sale market and prices are low. Mrs. H. is hoping to pay back her loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Ходжаназарова Мойзилол– 53 года, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 5-х детей. Мойзилол имеет небольшой вагончик на центральным рынке города Курган-Тюбе под названием «Атуш» и занимается продажей парфюмерии и чистящих бытовых средств. На полученный кредит она хочет увеличить ассортимент продаваемого товара. Данный товар даст возможность местным жителям приобретать необходимую косметику, а также чистящие средства для бытовых нужд по ценам намного ниже цен на других базарах, так как рынок «Атуш» это оптовый рынок и цены здесь ниже. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: expansion of merchandise

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana has a business selling popular cookies and candies from a rented space at the city market in Kahovka, Ukraine. She carries a nice selection of delicious cookies – from jelly cookies to chocolate covered delights –  as well as Ukrainian made chocolate bars and boxed candies. Cookies and candies are popular snacks with tea in Ukraine and boxed candies are frequently given as gifts for special occasions so there is always a good demand for the products Oksana sells. Oksana is married and has two teenage children. Her business is a good source of income for her family. 

Oksana requests a loan of $500 to purchase new inventory for her business. She hopes to see good sales and income while meeting the needs of many customers.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Daryani

texts.en: Daryani is a 44-year-old mother who has 2 sons. She supports her family by selling home appliances, earning about US$ 5 a week. She is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan of US$ 100 to expand her little business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of her little home appliances business

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei recently started a business selling cleaning supplies at a market in Kahovka, Ukraine after he was unable to make enough as a farmer to support his wife and young daughter. He’s only been in business for about 4 months but would like to be the best in the market. Sergei currently has around $1000 worth of inventory on hand and makes around $200 in profit per month. 

Sergei is requesting a loan of $500 to help purchase new inventory to sell. We are happy for this opportunity to help him at this critical time in his business and look forward to seeing where his venture will take him in the future.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Jorahon

texts.ru:
Jorahon T. is 67 years old, has finished high school, is married and has 5 children. Jorahon has been selling fruits and vegetables at the local market "Hiloli" for the last 5 years. He is planning to use the loan to purchase a large batch of produce, since during winter months the mountain pass is sometimes closed due to snow and Jorahon cannot always replenish his merchandise. With this loan the people living in the region will be able to purchase the produce they need even in the case the mountain passes leading to the region are closed. Mr. T. is planning to pay back the loan within the next 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Точиев Чорахон, возраст – 67 год, образование среднее, женат, имеет 5-х детей. Чорахон занимается продажей продуктов сельского хозяйства на базаре «Хилоли». Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 5 лет. На полученный кредит он планирует увеличить свой товарный запас селскохозяйственной продукции, так как в зимнее время не всегда функционирует перевал в связи с выпадом снегопада, и он не всегда сможет ездить за пополнением запасов. Жители данного района будут иметь возможность приобрести необходимый им товар, даже в случае закрытия перевала. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 15 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Yayah

texts.en: Yayah is a 45-year-old mother of 3 children. She works at home as a tailor, earning about US$ 5 a day. Her husband, S., works as an employee at a factory and earns US$ 31.50 every two weeks. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of US$ 125 to buy another sewing machine and expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine for her tailor shop

loans.name: Hakimali

texts.ru:
Hakimali F. is 44 years old, has completed high school, is married and has 5 children. Hakimali sells milk as well as makes and sells soured milk products (yoghurt, buttermilk, cheese). He purchases the milk from the local farmers. Mr. F. is planning to use the loan to purchase a larger volume of milk in order to offer more milk and milk products to the local families of Khuroson. He is planning to pay back the loan in the next 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Файзуллоев Хакимали, возраст – 44 года, образование среднее, женат, имеет 5-х детей. Хакимали занимается продажей молока, а также производством кисло-молочной продукции и дальнейшей её реализации местным жителям. Молоко он пиобретает у местных фермеров. Полученный кредит поможет ему приобретать больше молока, что даст ему возможность производить больше продукции и обеспечивать местных жителей молоком и другими молочными продуктами. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of milk and soured milk products

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Mrs. Gloria O. is 35 years old. She is married with two children and lives in Benin City, where she sells provisions and drinks. She is soliciting a loan of $600 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale. She learned the business for a period of six months and started hers in 2004. She is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Arum

texts.en: Arum is a 40-year-old mother of 3 daughters. She sells fresh food at her house such as the typical Indonesian salad 'gado-gado' and crispy snacks, earning about US$ 10.50 a day. Her husband, Agus, is a public transportation driver who earns a small income. She is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan of US$ 100 to add to her business capital. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To add to her business capital

loans.name: Kosim

texts.ru:
Kosim T. is 52 years old, has completed high school, is married and has 4 children. Mr. T. has been raising and selling cattle for the last two years and it is the main source of income for his family. Mr. T. is planning to use his loan to purchase 2 calves for fattening and sale. Every 40-45 days he will sell the cattle and use the money to purchase additional calves. According to his calculations he is planning to have two extra calves at the end of the loan cycle to pay back the loan. Mr. T. is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Темиров Косим, возраст – 52 год, образование среднее, женат, имеет 4 -х детей. Косим занимается разведением и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 2 лет и это является его основным источником дохода. На полученный кредит Косим планирует приобоести 2 молодых бычков для откормки и продажи. Через каждые 40-45 дней он планирует продавать скот, а на вырученные деньги приобретать молодняк. Согласно прогноза в конце кредитного цикла ему должно остаться в качестве поибыли 2 бычка. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase and sale of cattle

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en: Mr. Godwin A. is 49 years old. He is married with five children and lives in Benin City. He sells engine oil and solicits a loan of $525 to buy more gallons of engine oil for sale. He learned the business for a period of three years after which he started his own in 2003. He is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more engine oil for sale

loans.name: Mariyati
