texts.en: Mariyati is the 54-year-old mother of a 21-year-old son. She sells home appliances door-to-door around the villages and she also sells rice cakes at some factories. She earns about US$ 13 a day. She is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan of US$ 100 to expand her business. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of her door-to-door sales business

loans.name: Ahliddin

texts.ru:
Ahliddin T. is 31 years old, has graduated from high school, has two children. Ahliddin owns a store dealing in automotive supplies. His store is located on one of the central markets in the city of Yavan. He has been running his business for the last 5 years. Mr. T. is planning to use the money from the loan to expand his stock of merchandise, specifically he is planning to buy a large shipment of spare parts. This loan will help the local car owners to be able to buy spare parts for their vehicles, as the next automotive store is located about 50 miles from Yavan. Mr. T. is planning to pay back the loan in the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Толибов Ахлиддин, возраст – 31 год, образование среднее, женат, имеет 2-х детей. Ахлиддин имеет магазин по продаже запчастей для автомашин. Он иимеет магазин на одном из центральных рынков города Явана. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 5 лет. На полученный кредит Ахлиддин хочет увеличить свой товарооборот, то есть закупить большую партию запачных частей. Этот кредит поможет местным владельцам транспортных средств приобретать необходимые запчаси для своих автомобилей, так как в близлежащий рынок находится в 80 км от города Явана. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Franca

texts.en: Mrs. Franca O. is 33 years old and married with five children. She lives in Benin City; she sells beef in the open market. She is soliciting a loan of $1200 to buy more beef for sale. She learned this business for two years and started hers in 2000. She is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy beef for sale

loans.name: Concepción De Maria

texts.es:
Maria Medreno is known to her friends as Conchita. She works selling costume jewelry of all kinds, and has her business in the market called Israel Lewites, in the city of Managua.

She began her business 10 years ago with money from her savings and help from her father. Later, she was able obtain a space in the market. She has realized several loans with Ceprodel which have helped her a great deal, allowing her to reconstruct part of her market stall, and to acquire greater quantities of products which keep her sales constant.

Her goal in life, as a mother, is that her small son will be able to complete his studies and have a profession in the future. For that, Conchita realizes she will have to put a great effort into building her business.

Concepción de Maria Medreno conocida comúnmente como conchita, es una dama que se dedica a la venta de bisuterías de todo tipo. Tiene su negocio en el mercado de Israel Lewites en Managua.

Desde hace 10 años comenzó su negocio con una inversión de C$ 5,000 (cinco mil córdobas) obtenidos por medio de sus ahorros y apoyo de su padre, luego a medida que pasó el tiempo fue surtiendo más sus productos hasta obtener el local en el mercado.

Hoy en día ha realizado prestamos en CEPRODEL que le han beneficiado grandemente, ha reconstruido en parte su local, ha adquirido mayores cantidades de productos y de igual manera ha podido mantener constante sus ventas. Su anhelo en la vida, como toda madre es que su pequeño hijo pueda realizar sus estudios y coronar una carrera profesional en el futuro pero para esto, ella está conciente que lo logrará esforzándose muchísimo en este trabajo.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO INVEST IN MORE INVENTORY FOR HER COSTUME JEWELRY BUSINESS, ALLOWING HER TO PROVIDE FOR HER SON'S EDUCATION AND FUTURE.

loans.name: Umiyati

texts.en: Umiyati is a 51-year-old mother of 4 sons. Every day she sells vegetables door-to-door around the villages, earning about US$ 15 a day. She is requesting a loan of US$ 100 to add to her business capital so she will be able to increase her income for her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Adding to her business capital

loans.name: Nurhayati

texts.en: Nurhayati is a 42-year-old mother of 2 children. She has a kiosk where she sells prepaid vouchers for every cell phone provider and also cell phone accesories, earning about US$ 20 a week. She is asking for a loan of US$ 75 to add to her business capital. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Adding to her business capital for her little phone kiosk

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali A. lives in Mayack village near Beylagan, a small town in Azerbaijan. He is 56 years old, married, and has four children. He is engaged in sheep-breeding. Ali has ten years' experience at this business. Every Sunday Ali goes to the livestock market of Beylagan, sells some of his sheep there, and purchases other sheep. (Ali is pictured at the livestock market.) He increases his business capital this way. Now he needs a loan in the amount of $800, with which sum he plans to buy a calf.

loans.use: To expand his livestock business

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti, 26, is the mother of 2 daughters aged 6 and 1. She has a small grocery store at her house, earning about US$ 26 a day. She is asking for a loan of US$ 75 to expand her little store so that she can provide tuition for her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: to expand her little grocery store so that she can afford her children's school fees

loans.name: Gloria's Group

texts.en:
Maria Julia and Angelica have been members of the community bank “Maria Antonieta” for one year, and Gloria has been a member for three. Maria Julia is 37 years old and Gloria is 30. They both live with their partners and have two children. Angelica is 23 and single.

Maria Julia has owned a grocery store in the small town of Ambarmarca for the last two years. She sells milk, sugar, fruit, vegetables, and beans. Angelica has been traveling around the town selling carrots, squash, celery and lemons from a cart for the past 12 years. Gloria has a stand in the Nery Garcia market where she has been selling chili peppers, garlic, and squash for ten years.

Their loans are for de 600 soles, 200 soles, and 1800 soles (3 soles = $1) respectively, which will be invested in buying milk, sugar, fruit, vegetables, beans, corn, and corn meal. Maria Julia, Angelica, and Gloria plan to continue saving. Eventually Angelica would like to open a store and stop moving around as much.

In their bank they feel relaxed and are able to forget their problems. The dreams of Maria Julia and Gloria are to buy their own house. Angelica hopes to prove herself by paying off her loan on time.

loans.use: Their loans are for de 600 soles, 200 soles, and 1800 soles (3 soles = $1) respectively, which will be invested in buying milk, sugar, fruit, vegetables, beans, corn, and corn meal.

loans.name: Talib

texts.en: Talib A. lives in Beylagan, a small town in Azerbaijan. He is 36 years old, married, and has two children. He is engaged in animal sales. Talib has seven years' experience at this business. (He is pictured at the livestock market.) Talib has applied to Normicro's Beylagan Branch for a loan, because he would like to purchase some sheep and expand his business. Talib needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1200 for this purpose.

loans.use: To expand his animal sales business

loans.name: Iman

texts.en: Iman A. lives in Beylagan, a small town in Azerbaijan. He is 43 years old, married, and has two children. He is engaged in animal sales. Iman purchases animals from the livestock market of Beylagan, raises them for some months, and then sells them again. (He is pictured at the livestock market.) Now he needs $900 to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his small animal sales business

loans.name: Agustini

texts.en: Agustini, 42, is the mother of 2 children. She sells cosmetics on credit ,door-to-door, such as perfume, powder, etc., earning about US$ 26 a month. Her husband, Agus Salim, sells frames, earning US$ 20 a week. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of US$ 75 to add to her business capital. She agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Adding to her business capital

loans.name: Costeñitas 2 Group

texts.es:
The association Costenitas 2 is located in a place called Focal de Villa Adela in the city of El Alto. The association has 22 active members, each of them dedicated to a specific trade which helps sustain their families. Some of the activities include handicrafts, knitting and the sales of every day household and seasonal items. The majority of the members have stands in the fairs and markets which depend on this type of commerce.

The association requires capital to buy supplies for their businesses. They are starting a busy season for the kinds of products and items they sell. This will allow them to generate more income to meet the needs of their families.

La asociación Costeñitas 2, actualmente se encuentran en el ciclo 5 dentro del centro Focal de Villa Adela en la ciudad de El Alto, cuenta con 22 socias activas, las cuales se dedican a distintos rubros para el sustento de sus familias. Entre las tantas actividades, encontramos a socias que se dedican a la artesanía, tejidos, comercio de mercadería de todo tipo y por temporadas. En su mayoría, las socias poseen puestos de venta en ferias y mercados específicos dependiendo de la mercadería con la que comercian Actualmente esta asociación requiere de capital, principalmente para abastecer sus negocios, preparando la temporada de inicio de clases de la gestión 2008, en vista que es una temporada alta para la venta del tipo de productos que las socias precisan vender para generar sus recursos y hacer frente a las necesidades de sus familias.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: THE 22 WOMAN OF THIS ASSOCIATION NEED CAPITAL TO BUY SUPPLIES FOR THEIR VARIOUS BUSINESSES AND PREPARE FOR A BUSY SEASON.

loans.name: Maarif

texts.en: Maarif A. lives in Beylagan, a small town in Azerbaijan. He is 55 years old, married, and has three children. He is engaged in animal sales. He has ten years' experience at this business. Maarif purchases animals from the livestock market of Beylagan, raises them for some months, and then sells them again. (He is pictured at the livestock market.) Now he needs $400, with which sum he plans to buy some sheep to add to his flock.

loans.use: To expand his little animal husbandry business

loans.name: Ratmini

texts.en: Ratmini, 58, is the mother of 2 children. Both her children have already finished their schooling. Her husband, K., works at a workshop earning a small income, so she sells snacks at her house, earning about US$ 1 a day, and also kerosene, earning about US$ 1.50 a day. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of US$ 100 to expand her business. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: expansion of her little retail businesses

loans.name: Rosa Victoria's Group

texts.en:
Rosa Victoria and Marcelina are associates of the community bank Maria Antonieta. They have been members for three years and one year respectively.

Rosa Victoria is married and has four children, three of whom are professionals. She is currently the president of her bank. Marcelina lives with her partner and has two children, one of whom is still in high school. She is the treasurer of her bank.

Rosa has owned a business preparing and selling the typical food from Cuzco, another part of Peru, for the past two months. For three years Marcelina has owned a business making and selling a traditional bread called, “chapla”. Their loans are for 1200 and 200 soles respectively (3 soles = $1), which will be invested in improving their businesses by adding decorations, and buying basic groceries such as rice, oil, potatoes, meat, flower, and sugar.

Rosa and Marcelina say that in their community bank they feel happy and capable. It is like a big family where they can share companionship and values such as punctuality.

Their dreams are to continue improving their businesses and one day own a home.

loans.use: Their loans are for 1200 and 200 soles respectively (3 soles = $1), which will be invested in improving their business by adding decorations, and buying basic groceries such as rice, oil, potatoes, meat, flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Bertha Socorro

texts.es:
Bertha V. is a single mother of 7 children, most of them already married themselves. Bertha has a strong work ethic and was one of the founders of the market called Israel Lewites in Managua. She now has 28 years in her business selling cosmetics, as well as plastic jewelry such as bracelets, earrings, etc.

She began her business with her life's savings, but she's been through difficult circumstances such as the earthquake in 1972, when she lost her good merchandise but kept on working to take care of her children. Today Bertha, aside from the difficult economic situation, has realized several loans with Ceprodel which have helped her a great deal, allowing her to remodel her place in the market little by little and increase her stock of merchandise to sell.

Bertha V. es madre soltera y con 7 hijos de los cuales la mayoría son casados. Es una mujer muy trabajadora por el hecho de que es una de las fundadoras del mercado Israel Lewites ya que tiene 28 años de laborar en la venta de cosméticos y prendas de plásticos como colas, pulseras, aretes, etc.

Inició su negocio con ahorros propios que realizó desde su juventud, sin embargo ha pasado circunstancias difíciles ya que fue afectada fuertemente por el terremoto en Nicaragua en el año 1972, donde perdió sus bienes materiales pero siguió trabajando para mantener a sus hijos.

Hoy en día la señora V. a pesar de la difícil situación económica que atraviesa, ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel lo cual según cuenta le han beneficiado grandemente ya que ha ido remodelando su tramo poco a poco y además ha surtido sus productos para su respectiva venta.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE FOR HER COSMETICS AND COSTUME JEWELRY BUSINESS.

loans.name: Zargalam

texts.en: Zargalam M. lives in Shafag village of Beylagan, a small town in Azerbaijan. She is 45 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is engaged in animal-breeding. She makes butter, cheese, buttermilk, etc. from the milk of her cows and sheep and sells these products at the Beylagan market. Now she needs a loan in the amount of $600 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business selling homemade cheese, buttermilk, etc.

loans.name: Neneng

texts.en: Neneng, 49, is the mother of 2 children. Her husband, A., works at building construction as a day laborer and earns a meager income. She has to work to earn more income for the family by selling salty (pickled) eggs at the market, earning about US$ 4 a day. She is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan of US$125 to add her business capital. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Adding to her business capital

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim R. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 56 years old, married ,and has three children. He engaged in animal sales. Ibrahim purchases  animals from the  livestock market of Beylagan, raises them for some months and then sells them again. (He is pictured at the livestock market.) He is one of Normicro's best clients. Now he needs $600 to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his small animal husbandry business

loans.name: Minah

texts.en: Minah, 40, is the mother of 4 children aged 20, 15, 8 and 7. Her husband, H., works as a day laborer at construction and earns a meager income. She has to earn some extra income to support her family's needs. She sell crispy snacks and vegetables at her house, earning about US$ 16 a day. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of US$ 125 to expand her business. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: expanding her little crispy snack sales business

loans.name: Titi

texts.en: Titi, 43, is the mother of 3 children and sells crispy snacks door-to-door earning about US$ 7 a day. She also sells snacks and beverages at her house and earns about US$ 3 a day. She has to work hard to provide for her family's needs. She is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan of US$ 100 to add to her business capital. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Adding to her business capital

loans.name: Blanca Nubia

texts.es:
Blanca Sanchez has been dedicating herself to the sales of stationary products and photocopy services at the market of Del Israel Lewites in Managua. Before dedicating herself to this business, she sold water in different places. As soon as she knew that the business didn’t support her financially, she decided she had to do something about it, so she began saving her money to finally start her own business and buy stationary products. Blanca Sanchez is a single mother with three children to support. This is why she needs a loan to help her buy the right equipment for her business. She has already received 3 microloans through Ceprodel. With these loans she was able to improve her business with the purchase two glass cases to display her products in and also a small photocopier. She needs enough money to buy a new photocopy machine. Her goal is to keep restocking her business with great selections of products and acquire a new photocopy machine since the one she has now needs to be replaced.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Blanca S. desde hace 27 largos años se dedica a la venta de productos de librería y servicios de fotocopiado en el mercado del Israel Lewites en Managua.

Antes de dedicarse a este negocio, vendía agua en diferentes lugares, pero al darse cuenta de que este negocio no le beneficiaba en lo absoluto decidió realizar ahorros por mucho tiempo hasta realizar compras de los productos de librería.

Es necesario destacar que la señora Blanca S. es madre soltera y con tres hijos que mantener. Por este motivo es que ella decide realizar prestamos en Ceprodel (3 prestamos actualmente) el cual le han beneficiado para la compra de dos vitrinas para colocar sus productos y a la vez, para la adquisición de una pequeña fotocopiadora. Su meta es seguir surtiendo su negocio con mayores cantidades de productos y a la vez adquirir una nueva fotocopiadora ya que la que posee actualmente necesita ser cambiada.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorr

texts.es:
Mrs. E. is a 44-year-old married mother of 2 children (12 and 14) who attend middle school. Esperanza’s husband works a security guard and does gardening during his free time. In light of her husband’s low wages, Esperanza decided to start a phone and room rental business, thus helping her husband with the household expenses and working for a better life. With both her savings and this loan, she will build a room so that she can expand her business and obtain a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Esperanza tiene 44 años de edad, casada, con 2 hijos, de 12 y 14 años quienes estudian la Secundaria. El esposo de Esperanza es Guarda de Seguridad y en su tiempo libre se dedica a la jardinería. En vista de los bajos ingresos por parte de su esposo Doña Esperanza decidió iniciar en el negocio del alquiler de teléfono y cuartos de habitación. Para así poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos familiares y aspirar a una mejor vida. Con los ahorros hasta ahora hechos y con el crédito que necesita construirá un cuarto para poder seguir expandiendo su negocio y obtener una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase of materials, such as sheet metal and wood, for construction of room

loans.name: Denis Alberto

texts.es:
Mr. Denis G. is a 44-year-old married father of 3 underage children. His wife is a homemaker who looks after their children. Mr. G. has a business in Villa Flor, one of the oldest neighborhoods in Managua. He sells motor oil, and he also offers carwash services. Mr. G. started out with a small inventory, but it has slowly increased. With this expansion, he has been able to set up a carwash. Currently, his goods and services are in high demand, so Mr. G. needs to invest in his business, thus further expanding it.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El Señor Denis tiene 44 años de edad, casado y con tres pequeños menores de edad. Su esposa es ama de casa y es quien se encarga de cuidar a sus tres niños. El Sr. Denis tiene un negocio en el barrio Villa Flor, uno de los barrios más antiguos de Managua, él vende lubricantes para vehículos y tambiñen tiene un autolavado. Don Denis empezó su negocio con un pequeño inventario de estos productos, pero ha ido creciendo y con ese crecimiento tambien pudo poner el autolavado, actualmente el negocio está experimentando una mayor demanda de productos por lo que Don Denis necesita invertir más en su negocio, para así poder crecer más y hacer más grande tanto su negocio como su autolavado.

loans.use: Purchase of motor oil

loans.name: Maria Adelaida

texts.es:
Adelaida is 53 years of age, married to a taxi driver, and mother of 3 grown-up children who work. Her youngest, who is 16 years old, helps her out with the business. She has been selling tortillas, cheese, baked beans, Nicaraguan tamales, and home cooked meals for over 15 years. Her day starts at 4:00 am and ends at 9:00 pm. She lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood of Managua. Adelaida is requesting this loan to invest it into her business and expand the kitchen, which is where she makes 100% of the products she offers. With this expansion, she will be able to offer better services to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Adelaida tiene 53 años de edad, es casada, su esposo es taxista, tiene 3 hijos dos de ellos ya son mayores de edad y trabajan por cuenta propia. Su hijo menor tiene 16 años de edad y es quién la apoya en el negocio. Tiene más de 15 años de tener este negocio el cual consiste en vender tortillas, cuajadas, frijoles cocidos, nacatamales y comida casera. Su día empieza a las 4:00 am y termina a las 9:00 pm. Habita en el barrio Laureles Norte de Managua. Doña Adelaida necesita el crédito para invertirlo en su negocio, quiere mejorar la infraestructura del lugar ampliando la cocina que es donde se desarrolla el 100 % de los productos que ofrece, y así poder ofrecer mejores condiciones a los vecinos que la visitan.

loans.use: Purchase of cinder blocks, sand, and metal to build kitchen

loans.name: Arely Del Socorro

texts.es:
Arely is 40 years old, married and has two small kids. She lives in North Laureles in Managua. Arely is a merchant and has a local store that she operates out of her home. She dedicates most of her time to the store and she also cares for and raises her children. In her business she sells basic grains, fruits, vegetables, hardware products, and other general merchandise. With the help of her husband, who also is a merchant, they have been able to get ahead, little by little. At the present time they only have one bedroom in their home. The loan will be needed to create another room, so that her kids can sleep in it, and so that so she can give them comfort and space. With the earnings of the store she wants to save the money so she could improve her house little by little and to improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Estefany of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Arelys tiene 40 años de edad, casada y con 2 pequeños hijos, vive en el populoso barrio Laureles Norte de Managua. Arelys es comerciante tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación, a la cual le dedica la mayor parte de su tiempo, el tiempo restante es para el cuido y formación de sus hijos. En su negocio ella vende toda clases de granos básicos, frutas y verduras, productos ferreteros y mercadería en general. Con la ayuda de su esposo quien también es comerciante han ido saliendo adelante poco a poco. Actualmente su casa de habitación consta de una solo cuarto. El crédito lo necesita para construir un cuarto más para que ahí duerman sus hijos, y así darles comodidad y espacio a sus pequeños. con las ganacias que genera la pulpería ella quiere ocupar un porcentaje para ir mejorando su casa poco y aumentar su calidad de vida y la de su familia

loans.use: Buy construction materials for a bedroom.

loans.name: María

texts.en:
María is in her early forties and has four children (two boys and two girls). She is separated from her husband and is supporting her family on her own. She is a teacher in a primary school in her community.

María also sells an assortment of underwear and fashionable shoes to women of Mulo, a neighborhood of Yamasá. She has to travel outside her community once a month to get the products at very low prices. Currently, she has a well established clientele.

She plans on using her loan to supplement her business with new brands of shoes and she wants to add some chic pants to the business, too.

María hopes her business can keep growing. She says that before long she will rent a locale to run her business out of.

loans.use: To purchase shoes and underwear to add to her inventory

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.en:
Yesenia is thirty-two years, and she and her husband have five children, who range from 8 to 15. They all attend school. The entrepreneur lives in Mulo, a neighborhood of Yamasá.

Yesenia runs a little grocery store which she started five years ago. Every day, from early in the morning, people in the neighborhood visit her store to get many kinds of products such as bread, sugar, milk, chocolate, spices, ripe fruit and so on. She also sells fresh meats.

“Profit from the store has been very useful for my family”, she says. In fact, she was able buy a washing machine, a television and a new suite of dining-room furniture last year for the comfort of her family.

Yesenia has requested a second loan to supplement her store's inventory with new products.

loans.use: purchase new products for her little grocery store

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.en:
Martha is in her early thirties, and she is a single mother with six school-going children (four boys and two girls). Martha runs a bakery which she started eight months ago, with a loan she had taken from FSMA. She used the funds wisely and she was able to repay the loan on time. Currently, people in the neighborhood visit her house all day long to purchase her mouth-watering cakes, pies, and delectable desserts.

With this loan, Martha will rent a small locale next to her house, and there she’ll run the bakery. She hopes her business will become the best confectioner’s shop of her community.

loans.use: rental of a small locale to run a bakery out of

loans.name: Sandra Carolina

texts.en:
Sandra Carolina, or ‘Sandy’ as her friends and family tenderly call her, is twenty-one years old and she lives with her partner. Sandy is the owner and operator of a beauty salon that she started three years ago. She offers various services: hair straightening, hair dyeing, hairdos and so on. She also sells beauty products and fashionable hair accessories.

As she talks about her dreams for the future, Sandra Carolina explains that she hopes her salon can be very successful and that she can increase her income. That way, she will be able to attend university next year.

Sandy will invest her loan in the purchase of wigs, hair dyes, and other goods to use to run her business. She will also buy a new mirror since her old one has been broken and couldn’t be repaired.

loans.use: To purchase products for hair and a new mirror to continue operating  her beauty salon

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.en:
María Luisa is a 22-year-old single mother of two school-going girls. She has been selling men's and women’s clothing for more than eight years in her community. She explains that at the beginning her selection of clothing was very limited. Fortunately, after two months, she got a loan through FSMA which she used to supplement her inventory with new clothing. Once a month now, she goes outsiD. her community to get garments at very low prices. Sometimes, she has to travel to cities very far from Palavé such as Elías Piña, a border city with Haiti.

María Luisa has requested a second loan to purchase clothing in bulk. That way, she will radically reduce the number of trips she makes outsiD. her community and augment her profit margin.

loans.use: invest in the purchase of clothing in bulk for her small business

loans.name: Sindy

texts.en:
Sindy is an eighteen-year-old girl who works hard to make a living. She lives with her partner, a 24-year-old man who works for a construction company. Sindy sells an assortment of perfumes and clothing to the women of her community. Currently, the entrepreneur operates the business within her house; and sometimes she walks along the streets or visits her neighbors in order to sell her products. However, she hopes that in a little while she can have a small locale so that her customers can make their purchases in more comfort.

With her loan, Sindy will buy clothing in bulk and new brands of perfumes to add to her current stock. The entrepreneur hopes the success of her business will help her attend a university next year.

loans.use: To buy an assortment of perfumes and women's clothing for a small store

loans.name: Nilsa

texts.en:
Nilsa is a thirty-year-old woman who is contributing to the education of the children of Palavé, a community near San Cristobal. Five years ago, Nilsa founded a primary school since children in the community had to walk about an hour to the closest school to attend class. “It grieved me to see the kids in that situation, and I said that I might do something for them," says the entrepreneur who studied Learning Therapy and School Psychology.

Currently, the school provides a good education for fifty children. Nilsa has hired three teachers to teach the pupils. Nilsa says she will keep working hard to nurture in those kids the sense of responsibility and civic-mindedness.

With her loan, the entrepreneur will get some benches and blackboards repaired. Given this loan, Nilsa will be able to continue this very admirable work to help those children who are the future of our country.

loans.use: repair of benches and blackboard for a primary school.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
My husband and I have been running a business from home for a year. Thank God we have been successful, but now we would like to invest a bit in the purchase of more merchandise because we need to have some products that our customers have asked for. With this investment, both our sales and our earnings will increase. I am requesting $800.00 USD to invest in the purchase of more merchandise for my business.
 Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.
“Mi marido y yo tenemos un negocio en mi casa desde hace 1 año gracias a dios nos ha ido muy bien pero ahora nos gustaría invertir un poco en la compra de más mercancía,  ya que necesitamos tener algunas cosas que nuestros clientes nos solicitan y así tendremos más ventas y por la tanto más ganancias”. Solicito $ 800.00 dlls para invertir en la compra de mercancía para mi negocio.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of more merchandise

loans.name: Kenia

texts.en:
Kenia is twenty-eight years old, and she and her husband have three children, two boys and a girl respectively aged 6, 5, and 1 year old. Kenia sells men's and women’s clothing in Palavé, a community near San Cristobal. She explains that she pays close attention to customer demand and the season to choose the appropriate items to add to her inventory. She also says that with persistence, courage, and patience, she will fulfill her dream which is to have a big clothing store with millions of customers visiting it every day.

Kenia has acquired a lot of experience in business, and her store has been thriving. She has built a spacious house made of wood for her children. “Now, we have a better and more comfortable lifestyle”, she says.

With her loan, Kenia will buy clothing in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy clothing in bulk to replenish her small store

loans.name: Avaz

texts.en: H. Avaz is a 60-year-old farmer who raises livestock in the southern regions of Bilasuvar. He has more than ten years experience in breeding and raising cattle for meat production. As meat is a very popular product all across Azerbaijan, it brings Avaz good income. But is does not meet all the living expenses for his family. Avaz is married and has five children. Last year was very hard for Avaz and his family because prices for products increased five fold and Avaz had a difficult time earning enough money.  Avaz decided to expand his business and start selling dairy products. He is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase two milk cows.

loans.use: To purchase two milk cows

loans.name: Ismayil

texts.en: V. Ismayil is a 66-year-old farmer who owns his small business in the southern part of Azerbaijan, Biasuvar region. He lives with his wife and four children in an IDP settlement since 1992. He has more than fifteen years in selling dairy products. One cow used to provide enough product to support his family, but in recent years, prices have increased and earning enough money is difficult. In order to increase his production, he is requesting a loan of  $1200 to purchase two milk cows.

loans.use: To purchase two milk cows

loans.name: Talaia

texts.en: Talaia is  fifty years old and has three children.  She’s one of the oldest member of the program. This is  because she always makes her weekly payments on time and honors the program's rules. She’s got a big plantation now and sells her products at the market  three days per week and makes a profit of $200ST ($80USD) per day. Her current loan of $1750ST was used to buy chemicals to grow her business and the rest was used to repair their bathroom in a European style. She has said, her next loan will used to build a small house for them!  She believes that this is the only financial help she can get and is very thankful. She wants to stay with the program and continue to be an excellent borrower.

loans.use: Buy chemicals for her farming business and home improvement

loans.name: Franklin

texts.es:
Franklin H. is 39 years of age and has a degree in Business Administration. He is married and has 2 children: a six-year-old boy and a 15 year-old girl. Due to the country’s high unemployment rate, Franklin found the need to work as a taxi cab driver. His wife works for an insurance company, which means they both work to support the household. He is requesting this loan in order to invest it in his taxi cab and give it maintenance, thus temporarily securing his source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Franklin H. tiene 39 años de edad, licenciado en administración de empresas. Es Casado y tiene 2 hijos un varon de 6 años y una niña de 15 años. Debido a la baja oferta de empleo por la que pasa el país, Franklin se vió en la necesidad de trabajar de taxista. Su esposa trabaja en una empresa aseguradora y los dos se encargan de llevar el sustento a su familia. Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en su vehículo, darle mantenimiento y así poder asegurar su fuente de ingreso por algún tiempo más.

loans.use: Maintenance and repair of taxi cab

loans.name: Horacio

texts.es:
Mr. Horacio B. is a 41-year-old photographer who lives in the 28 de Marzo district of Managua. Because of the penchant for photography that he has had since childhood, he decided to start his photographic business, which is his family’s source of income. His 18-year-old daughter has also developed this same affinity, so she currently helps him shoot pictures. Mr. B. also offers video services. He is requesting this loan in order to start the construction of a photographic studio, thus broadening his business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Horacio tiene 41 años de edad y es fotógrafo, vive en el barrio 28 de Marzo en Managua. Don Horacio debido a una afición de pequeño decidió introducirse en el negocio de la fotografía el cual es el ingreso de su familia. Su hija de 18 años también ha desarrollado esta afición y actualmente le ayuda en la toma de las fotos. También ofrece grabación de video. Necesita el crédito para empezar a construir su estudio fotográfico y establecerse más ampliamente en este negocio.

loans.use: Construction of photographic studio

loans.name: Mulkadar

texts.en: A. Mulkedar is a 26-year-old young farmer who lives in Imishli region. His business consists of breeding calves and selling them to the local bazaar traders for mat production. Selling livestock is the only financial source in his family.  He is requesting a loan of $1200 to expand his business and build good conditions for his cattle.

loans.use: To expand his business and improve conditions for keeping his cattle

loans.name: Karla Estebana

texts.es:
Karla Rodríguez lives with her family in the town of Villa Reconciliación in Managua, in one of the most vulnerable neighborhoods with regards to infrastructure and poverty. Karla started her business with her store 6 years ago when she inherited it from her mother. With much persistence her store is now the largest in her neighborhood, and is able to support her family. Karla has 6 children, who are completely integrated in the business. It has elevated their quality of life because she has made improvements on her house and acquired her own vehicle. She needs the credit because her goal is to convert her business into a distributor and she wants to increase the sales of her basic grains and perishable products to be able to make a better offer and attract more clients.

Translated from Spanish to English by James Lombardo Volunteer

Karla R. habita con su familia en el barrio Villa Reconciliación de Managua, uno de los barrios más vulnerables de managua en cuanto a infraestructura y pobreza respecta. Karla comenzó el negocio de la pulpería hace 6 años producto de una de su mamá, le puso el mayor empeño al negocio y hoy en día es una de las pulperías más grande del barrio y con la que le ha podido dar el sustento a su familia. Karla tiene 6 hijos los cuales están completamente integrado en el negocio. este negocio ha elevado su nivel de vida porque ha mejorado su casa y también ha adquirido vehículo propio. necesita el crédito porque su meta es llegar a convertir su negocio en una distribuidora y quiere aumentra la venta de granos básicos y productos perecederos para así poder tener una mejor oferta y atraer más clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains and perishable products

loans.name: Liliu

texts.en: Liliu is a forty two year old mother from the village of Sagafili Mulifanua. She has seven children, three of them are attending the village primary school and the rest are at the Secondary level. Her business is selling vegetables such as cabbage, tomatoes, and cucumbers. She sells her produce six days a week including Saturdays and she manages to bring in about $120 a day. She is one of the new members of the programme and this is her first time ever to borrow money. Liliu’s husband works at Aggie’s Hotel and also contributes his income to the family.

loans.use: “Buy chemicals and equipment for her vegetable garden.”

loans.name: Angela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Angela is 49 years of age, married, and lives in the 3-80 neighborhood, one of the poorest sections of Managua. Her husband is a middle school teacher, and Angela receives remittances from her sister in the United States. In light of the high cost of living, two years ago Angela found the need to look for an additional source of income, so she decided to open up a book and office supply store, which has been growing steadily for the past two years. The school year is fast approaching, so Angela needs a loan in order to buy school supplies, thus being able to meet her customers’ needs. She would like to have a store that offers a wider variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Angela tiene 49 años de edad y es casada. Vive en el barrio 3-80 de Managua, uno de los barrios más pobres de la ciudad. Su marido trabaja como docente de la escuela secundaria, y Angela recibe remesas de Estados Unidos por parte de una hermana. Debido a los altos costos a los que se ha elevado la vida, hace dos años Angela se vió en la necesidad de buscar una alternativa para mejorar sus ingresos, es así como ella pone una librería la que ha ida creciendo a través de estos dos años. Se acerca la época escolar es por eso que Angela necesita el crédito para comprar útiles escolares y así poder llenar las necesidades de sus vecinos. Quiere llegar a tener una librería más grande en artículos.

loans.use: Purchase of school supplies

loans.name: Fuatino

texts.en: Fuatino S. is a twenty seven year old mother from the village of Sologa Mulifanua. She has two children and both of them are attending the village primary school. Fuatino’s husband works as a Tile Layer at  Mormon Construction and he gets paid every week. Fuatino is running a plantation which she works on with her husband when he is available. She sells her products at the Fugalei Flea Market three days a week and her income for the week is usually $500. She is one of our oldest members and she is young and active.

loans.use: “Buy fualama {small new plants} and equipment for her Business.”

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria S. is one of the young active mothers in the programme. She is twenty two years of age from the village of Sologa Mulifanua. She is currently running a Fishing business with the help of her husband who is a good fisherman. This is her first loan and she is planning to use this money to buy a new fishing canoe and some sets of fishing nets for her husband. Her husband goes fishing five days of the week but she only goes to the market two days to decrease her traveling costs. She is a hard working mother and she wants to repay this loan on time so that she can have access to more loans In the future.

loans.use: “Buy a new fishing canoe and some sets of fishing nets for her fishing business.”

payments.comment: Kiva Lender, Maria's loan amount was incorrectly posted on Kiva.  The correct amount was properly disbursed to her using alternate funds.  For that reason, no further updates will be made on the website.  Your loan has been refunded.  Thank you for your loan and we apologize for the error.

loans.name: Palasi

texts.en: Palasi has been with the SPBD programme for more than five years. This is her sixth loan and she will use it to buy a new wheel barrow and chemicals for her plantation business. She is married and has children. She is working hard to make sure that her children will continue in school and have better future. Her husband does not work but he is the one that really helps out with the physical work on the plantation. She is hard working and she is honest with the loan repayments and as well as in her business. She is looking forward to earn more income to meet the growing needs of her household.

loans.use: “Buy chemicals, knives, and a wheel barrow for her plantation business.”

loans.name: Faatali

texts.en: Faatali P. is a thirty four year old lady from the village of Satapuala. She is running a Vegetable Garden Business and she sells cabbages, cucumbers, and tomatoes. She delivers her products around the village. This is her second loan and she is using it to buy iron roofing and supplies to improve her home, where she operates her business. She has four children and all of them are attending the village primary school.  Her husband is a good carpenter and is their major source of income. She is one of our oldest borrowers and she is looking forward to earning more money In the future.

loans.use: Buy iron roofing, timber, and cement for home improvement.

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorr

texts.es:
Esperanza F. is a single mother with six kids all of which are in school. Some in elementary school and some in high school. For years ago she began her business selling ice cream. At the Ivan Monte Negro Market in Managua. When she began her business another lady shared her space with Esperanza so that she could sell her ice cream from it. However, as time went by she was able to rent her own space in the market place.

Now she works hard every day to be able to support her family and to give an education to her children. One of Senora Esperanza daughters works with her selling ice cream. This business makes it so Esperanza is able to earn a living with dignity.

For three years now she has received nine small loans and they have benefited her a lot because she has been able to buy more ice cream to sell and she has also been able to save her earnings so that she could remodel her space in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Estefany of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Esperanza F. es una madre soltera y con 6 hijos de los cuales todos estudian, algunos en la primaria y otros en la secundaria. Desde hace 4 años inició su negocio de venta de sorbetes (helados) en el mercado Ivan Montenegro de Managua. Al inicio vendía en un alojamiento que le proporcionó una dama para que pudiese vender los sorbetes pero a medida que el tiempo transcurrió, solicitó un local propio en el mercado y le fue obtenido.

Hoy en día, para poder salir adelante y brindarle la educación a sus queridos hijos, la señora Esperanza se esfuerza grandemente trabajando todos los días acompañada de una de sus hijas en la venta de estos helados y así ganarse la vida dignamente.

Desde hace 3 años ha realizado créditos con ceprodel (9 créditos) y según cuenta le han sido de muchísimo beneficio porque ha logrado comprar los helados para luego venderlos y de igual manera ha ahorrado para comenzar a remodelar su local en el mercado.

loans.use: Remodel her space at the market

loans.name: Dominga De La Cruz

texts.es:
Dominga De La Cruz Davila is a single mother. She has three children, whom are her greatest interest. She’s been dedicating herself to the sales of meat at the Ivan Montenegro Market in Managua, Nicaragua.

She began the business with a mobile service that would go around the market and sell meat products. She wasn’t making enough money this way, so she decided to spend the rest of her savings on getting a stand at the local market so that she could raise her sales.

Once she had her stand, she made the decision to affiliate herself with Coprodel. Coprodel has helped her to receive microloans and she has benefited from being able to buy meet in bulk and has been able to improve the infrastructure of her stand.

She’s a great example of women in Nicaragua who manage to make it through the ups and downs of daily life. She needs your help, in order to re stock her store and have greater quantities of products.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La dama Dominga de la Cruz D. es una madre soltera y con tres hijos que son su mayor interés en este momento. Desde hace 27 años se dedica a la venta de carne de res en una localidad del mercado Ivan Montenegro en Managua.

Este negocio lo inició vendiendo ambulante en los alrededores del mercado pero en menores cantidades de carne, sin embargo al no obtener beneficios satisfactorios, decidió invertir más para mejorar sus ventas y buscar la manera de obtener un local en el mercado.

Una vez obtenido el local, toma la decisión de afiliarse con Ceprodel el cual le ha beneficiado con créditos que los ha aprovechado sabiamente en la compra de mayores volúmenes de carne y además en la infraestructura de su local.

Sin duda alguna, la señora Dominga es un gran ejemplo de las mujeres Nicaragüenses que a pesar de sus escasos recursos ha sabido salir adelante y brindar un apoyo incondicional a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase meat

loans.name: Irma Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mrs Irma F. sells fruit and vegetables in the Ivan Montenegro market in Managua for a living. She has been doing this for 10 years and she started off with the sum of C$500 which she got from her husband. She started her business selling inside the marketplace, but due to her difficult financial situation, her stall is unprotected by walls or a roof, and she wishes to dedicate all her efforts towards finding a way to securely cover her stall.

Ceprodel has lent to her for the last 3 years, and has brought her 4 loans, which were all paid fully and on time. They have improved her business and helped her to acquire more fruit and vegetables, as well as to save up for the remodelling of the infrastructure of the stall.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La actividad económica de la señora Irma F. se inicia con la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado Ivan Montenegro de Managua. Con 10 años de tener el negocio e iniciando con un capital de C$ 500 producto de apoyo de su esposo, comienza su negocio vendiendo a lo interno del mercado. Sin embargo, debido a su difícil situación económica, su tramo aun no está cubierto con paredes por lo que una de sus metas a través de sus esfuerzos es buscar la manera de cubrir su local para mayor seguridad.

Ceprodel le ha brindado la mano financieramente desde hace tres años con un total de 4 créditos otorgados y pagados en tiempo y forma en donde el impacto que han tenido es que han mejorado su negocio por lo que ha adquirido mayores cantidades de frutas y verduras y a la vez ha ahorrado para la remodelación de su infraestructura.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables/Compra de frutas y verduras

loans.name: Janneth

texts.es:
Selling hardware products is a very competitive business as there are many of hardware stores that offer similar products. Knowing this, Janneth Perez sells her products in the Ivan Montenegro market in Managua.

She started doing this 13 years ago. At first she went walking around Managua selling her wares, but due to low income, she decided to sell them from a stall in the market instead. Having her own stall now, she wishes to invest in her business, and it is for this reason that she uses loans from Ceprodel which, according to her, she has benefitted from enormously as she has bought new materials to sell, and she has been able to maintain her family unit.

It is important to point out that she has always paid back the full amount of the loan at the right time since she started receiving them. Her dream is to enlarge her business and therefore give a better quality of life to her kids.

Translated by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La venta de productos ferreteros es un negocio muy competitivo ya que existen muchas ferreterías que ofertan tales productos. Consiente de esta situación, la señora Janeth P. se dedica al negocio de venta de productos ferreteros en el mercado Ivan Montenegro en Managua.

Comenzó hace 13 años en este negocio, primeramente se dedicaba a vender ambulante por las calles de Managua, sin embargo por motivos de bajos ingresos decide solicitar un local en el mercado. Al tener el local propio decide invertir en su negocio y es por esta razón que hace uso de los créditos otorgados por Ceprodel que según cuenta le han beneficiado grandemente en la compra de nuevos materiales de venta y para mantener su núcleo familiar.

Es importante señalar que desde que inició con estos créditos, ha sido una fiel cliente pagándolos en tiempo y forma. Su mayor sueño es ampliar su negocio y brindarle un mejor estilo de vida a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy hardware products/Compra de productos para ferretería

loans.name: Ana Socorro

texts.es:
Ana Socorro R. is an elderly lady worth looking up to as she has worked hard all her life in order to get by. She sells fruit and vegetables and also bags of tortillas and yucas in smaller quantities.

She is a widow and has one son that cannot study because of their financial situation. Instead, he works with her selling these products.

Everyday, in the early hours of the morning, Ana Socorro sells her products from her own stall in the Ivan Montenegro market. It is necesaary to add that Ana has had 7 credits with Ceprodel over the last 2 years, which have greatly helped her to buy and sell fruit and vegetables. Moreover, due to her advanced age, Mrs Socorro R. wishes to invest more in her business so that she can improve its infrastructure and therefore dedicate more time to doing lighter work.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Ana Socorro R. es una anciana, digna de imitar debido a que es una mujer que toda su vida la ha dedicado al trabajo para poder subsistir. Su negocio es la venta de frutas, verduras y bolsas de tortillitas y yucas en menores cantidades.

Es madre viuda y con un hijo que no estudia por la difícil situación económica, sin embargo, se dedica a trabajar con ella den la venta de estos productos.

Todos los días desde muy tempranas horas en el mercado Ivan Montenegro, la señora Ana Socorro vende sus productos en un local propio en el mercado. Es necesario destacar que desde hace 2 años, ha realizado créditos con Ceprodel (7 créditos) el cual le han beneficiado grandemente por lo que ha logrado comprar las frutas y verduras para luego venderlas. Además, a pesar de su avanzada edad, la señora Socorro R. planea invertir mas en el negocio para mejorar su infraestructura y por ende seguir dedicando mas tiempo de su vida al trabajo digno.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercadería

loans.name: Juana María

texts.es:
Juana Maria Jiron sells bicycle parts in the Ivan Montenegro market in the city of Managua. She started this business with the small amount of money that she had been saving all her life.

She is mother of 3 kids, one of whom is a young girl in High School, and this is why she started her business. Before she was just a housewife, but due to their difficult financial situation and her realization that her kids needed support, she decided to start selling bicycle parts in a stall in the market.

Mrs Jiron has had 10 loans with Ceprodel, and she has invested them wisely in the buying of bicycle parts to sell. It is necessary to make it clear that she has been faithful to the repayments despite her difficult economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Juana Maria J. es una dama que se dedica a la venta de repuestos de bicicletas en el mercado Ivan Montenegro de la ciudad de Managua. Su negocio lo inició con un pequeño capital producto de sus ahorros propios obtenido a lo largo de su vida.

Es madre de 3 hijos, entre ellos una jovencita que cursa la secundaria, por este motivo es que ella inicia este negocio ya que anteriormente se dedicaba solamente como ama de casa pero al contemplar la difícil situación económica que atraviesa y consiente de que sus hijos necesitan su apoyo, decide comercializar los repuestos de bicicletas en un local del mercado.

Actualmente, la señora J. ha realizado 10 préstamos en Ceprodel habiéndolos invertido sabiamente en la compra de repuestos para su respectiva comercialización. Es necesario destacar que a pesar de su difícil situación económica se ha mantenido fiel en el cumplimiento de estos créditos en tiempo y forma.

loans.use: To buy bicycle parts/Compra de repuestos para las bicicletas

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Doña Martha was born in the interior of the country on the Atlantic Coast of Nicaragua. Due to the lack of employment, eleven years ago she immigrated to the city of Managua, in search of a better life. Martha is a widow, with seven children, and four are males and 3 are females. She works selling clothing as a traveling salesperson. It’s the only means she has to support her family and thanks to street vending she has been able to support her family. Her way of work is based on buying the clothing and then going to the different communities to sell it. She needs a loan so that she will be able to buy more clothing and increase the income that supports her family.

Translated from Spanish by Johnny of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Doña Martha nació en el interior del país en la Costa Atlántica de Nicaragua, pero debido a la falta de empleo, hace once años emigró a la ciudad de Managua en busca de mejor vida. Doña Martha es viuda y tiene 7 hijos, 4 varones y 3 mujeres. Se dedica a la venta ambulante de ropa. Es el único sostén de su familia y gracias a estas ventas a podido subsistir con su familia. Su forma de trabajar se basa en comprar la ropa y después viajar a los departamentos a colocarla. Necesita el préstamo para comprar más ropa y generar los ingresos que son el sostén de su familia

loans.use: Buy clothes and shoes for her business.

loans.name: Lucia Adelaida

texts.es:
Doña Lucia is 48 years old, and she lives in the neighborhood of Laureles in the North of Managua. She is a baker, and has her business in her house. She makes all sorts of cakes and pastries. She also sells her goods through the corner stores. Doña Lucia is married and has an 18 year old daughter. Her husband is a security guard and he helps her with the supporting their family. She’s a well-known pastry chef in the neighborhood, because she has put a lot of effort and commitment to her work. She needs the loan to buy an oven in order to produce more. Her goal is to be able to increase her earnings with the oven and to be able to improve her home in the near future.

Translated from Spanish by Johnny of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Doña Lucia tiene 48 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Norte de Managua. Ella es panadera, y su negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitación, ella hace todo tipo de tortas y repostería, y también vende a las pulperías por encargos. Doña Lucia es casada y tiene una hija de 18 años, su esposo es Guarda Seguridad y la apoya con la manutención del hogar. Es una reconocida repostera en el barrio porque le ha puesto mucho esfuerzo y empeño a su trabajo. Necesita el crédito para comprar un horno para poder extender su producción ya que con el que tiene actualmente muy poco puede producir. Estos ingresos le ayudarian para mejorar su vivienda que en un futuro próximo es su meta.

loans.use: Buy an oven for her bakery

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.es:
Bernardino V. is a gentleman who makes a living by selling charcoal and firewood in the Mayoreo market in the city of Managua. He started this business seven years ago with a lot of effort and sacrifice. He first sold in the open air, but as the years passed, he decided to invest in obtaining a stretch inside the market.

The difficult economic situation that he has gone through over the years has caused him to invest more in his business. This is why he has completed three credits with Ceprodel. They have benefitted him by letting him buy larger quanitities of charcoal for its respective sale. He also plans to invest in the infrastructure of his location, since it's necessary to point out that the location he has is in bad condition. The roof is in bad shape, which exposes his merchandise to the winter weather, so the charcoal can get wet and be completely damaged.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Bernardino V. es un caballero que se dedica a la venta de carbón y leña en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua. Desde hace 7 años inició este negocio con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio primeramente vendía a la intemperie pero a medida que pasaron los años decidió invertir para conseguir un tramo en el interior del mercado.

Su difícil situación económica que ha atravesado por mucho años lo ha llevado a invertir mas en su negocio, para esto ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel (3 créditos) que le han beneficiado para comprar mayores cantidades de carbón para su respectiva venta y además planea invertir en infraestructura para su local ya que es necesario destacar que el local con que cuenta esta en malas condiciones, el techo está maltratado por lo que expone a que en tiempos de invierno, el carbón se moje y se dañe por completo.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal

loans.name: Aura Elena

texts.es:
Mrs. G. sells clothing, shoes, phone cards, cosmetics, and Nicaraguan tamales on weekends. Her husband is a street vendor who sells phone cards. They have 4 daughters who are 19, 16, and twin 4-year-olds. In the future, Mrs. G. would like to open a store in her home, which is why she is requesting this loan that would enable her to buy school clothing and shoes, taking advantage of the coming school year. The loan will boost her sales and profits, helping her save enough money to set up her store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Aura Elena se dedica a la comercialización de productos dentro de los cuales está la venta de ropa y zapatos, tarjetas telefónicas, cosméticos y venta de nacatamales los fines de semana. Su esposo se dedica a la venta ambulante de tarjetas telefónicas tiene 4 hijas, de 19 años, 16 años y unas gemelitas de 4 años. Doña Aura en un futuro quiere llegar a poner una tienda en su casa de habitación es por eso que pide el crédito para comprar ropa y zapatos escolares, para aprovechar la temporada escolar que se acerca y así vender un poco más e ir mejorando su capital de trabajo para ahorrar y poner su tienda.

loans.use: Purchase of shoes and apparel for the back-to-school season

loans.name: Fátima Salvadora

texts.es:
Fatima Salvadora is a hardworking woman who has been selling fruit and vegetables for 12 years in the Mayoreo market in Managua. She is known as a very happy and humble woman. She started her business using her own savings of C$2000 (two thousand cordobas net) which she had been saving for a long time for.

She has two kids (a boy and a girl) who she must help to get an education as they are still young. Her greatest desire is for her kids to grow up to be professionals and not to suffer as she has, doing hard labour since she was young.

For the last three years Fatima has been supported by Ceprodel, receiving loans that she has invested directly into her business, buying products and remodelling her stall in the marketplace.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Fátima Salvadora es una dama muy trabajadora que desde hace 12 años se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras de todo tipo en el mercado Mayoreo de Managua. Se caracteriza por ser una dama muy alegre y humilde. Su negocio lo comenzó con un capital propio de C$ 2000 (Dos mil córdobas netos) obtenidos por medio de sus ahorros propios de largo tiempo.

Actualmente es madre de dos hijos (un niño y una niña) los cuales tiene el deber de brindarles educación ya que son menores de edad. Su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos se preparen para poder ser profesionales y no sufrir como ella considera que sufrió desde muy joven con trabajos muy pesados. Desde hace tres años, la señora Fátima se ha apoyado de Ceprodel, obteniendo prestamos que los ha invertido directamente en su negocio para la compra de sus productos y la remodelación de su local en el mercado.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables/Compra de las verduras y frutas

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is twenty-seven years old, married, with three sons that range from four to ten years old. To make a living and support her family, Francisca retails fuel. The stall she has placed next to her house to operate the business in is much visited. She sells fuel by the gallon, half-gallon, and bottle.

She modestly explains that her stock of combustibles is still limited, but she plans on expanding the business with the loan she has requested. Francisca expects that this business activity will help her improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fuel in order to expand her small business

loans.name: Alexis

texts.en:
Alexis is a hard-working and responsible woman, mother of four children (three girls and a boy). A few months ago, she took a loan from FSMA with which she started a small business of selling fresh cut-up chicken parts within a small locale she had bought beforehand.

Every day, hundreds of people visit her business to make the purchase of chicken. In fact, rice with beans and chicken is one of most popular meals among Dominican traditional foods. Currently, Alexis makes an average monthly profit of US$ 200. With her loan, the entrepreneur will purchase more live chickens to butcher and retail to people of her community.

loans.use: To purchase chickens to re-sell in her community

loans.name: Paula

texts.en:
Paula is in her early forties, and she lives with her husband and four of their children. The other five boys are grown up and have their own families.

Paula sells women’s clothing. She operates her store within her house. The entrepreneur says that her business supports the children’s studies. She hopes her business success can help her keep supporting her family. With her loan, Victoria will buy more clothing in bulk to supply her store.

loans.use: To buy clothing in bulk to replenish her little store

loans.name: Chhoeung

texts.en: Mrs. Chhoeung T., 39, lives in the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia with her husband. She has four children, two of whom are enrolled in school and the other two are employed at a garment factory located near the boarder of Thailand. She and her husband earn $7 a day buying bananas and vegetables from the growers and reselling them for a profit. Mrs. Chhoeung T. hopes to use this loan to buy a large quantity of bananas from the grower and the remainder of the loan she will use to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of bananas from the grower. She will use the remainder of the money to invest in her business.

loans.name: Alifmo

texts.ru:
Alifmo S. is 61 years old. She has a college education, married and has 4 children. Alifmo is in a retail business and sells children's winter clothing at one of the markets of Vahdat city. She has been in the retail business for the past 4 years. She will use her loan to get a new assortment of merchandise. The loan will also give an opportunity for the locals to buy the necessary clothing for the children at affordable prices because the closest market is 30 kilometers away from the city of Vahdat. Alifmo plans to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Сулаймонова Алифмо – 61 год, образование высшее, замужем, имеет 4-х детей. Алифмо занимается торговлей детской зимней одеждой на одном из рынков города Вахдата. Полученный кредит она хочет использовать на приобретение нового ассртимента товара. Этим видом деятельности она занимаетя уже в течение 4 лет. Данный кредит даст возмлжность местным жителям приобретать необходимые детские вещи для маленьких детей по приемлемым ценам, так как близлежащий рынок находится на расстояние 30 км о города Вахдата. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of inventory

loans.name: Ulmas

texts.ru:
Ulmas V. is 42 years old, she has a specialized secondary education, she is not married and has 2 children. Ulmas is selling perfumes and cosmetics at one of the markets in the city of Vahdat. She has been in this business for the past 12 years. She wants to use the loan to increase the assortment of her merchandise. This loan will give an opportunity for the residents to buy the necessary products like hair coloring products, makeup, facial creams and other essential women care products.

Ulmas plans to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Вафоева Ульмас– 42 года, образование средне-специальное, незамужем, имеет 2-х детей. Ульмас имеет торговую точку на рынке в городе Вахдат. Она занимается продажей парфюмерии. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 12 лет. Полученный кредит она хочет использовать на увелечение ассортимента продаваемого товара. Полученный кредит даст возможность населению приобретать необходимые им товары для покраски волос, тени, крема а также другие принадлежности необходимые женщине для ухода за собой.

Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru:
Marhabo A. is 43 years old, she has secondary education, married and has 3 children. Marhabo sells clothing and other goods for daily needs at the market in the city of Vahdat. She wants to use the loan to get new assortment of her merchandise. Her main customers are the residents of the city of Vahdat and the nearby kishlaks (villages). This loan will give the locals the opportunity to buy some useful things such as mens and womens socks, handkerchiefs, undergarments and many other things at the local market without having to travel outside of the city.

She plans to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Аюбова Мархабо – 43 года, образование средне, замужем, имеет 3-х детей. Мархабо имеет торговую точку на рынке в городе Вахдате, где она торгуе одеждой, а также другими вещами необходимыми для ежедневного пользования. Полученный кредит она хочет использовать на приобретение нового ассортимента продаваемого товара. Основными её покупателями являются жители города Вахдат и близлежащих кишлаков. Этот кредит даст возможность местным жителям приобретать необходимый товар, такой как мужские и женские носки, носовые платки, нижние сорочки и многое другое у себя на местном рынке, при этом не выезжая за покупками за пределы города.

Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Sumangul

texts.ru:
Sumangul D. is 43 years old, she has technical secondary education and she is a chef by profession. She is divorced and has 3 children. Sumangul is selling children's winter clothes, socks and warm pantyhose at one of the markets in the city of Vahdat. She wants to use the loan to increase the assortment of her merchandise because during winter time the demand for her goods is increasing. The loan will also help her increase her commodity circulation which will also increase her profits and allow her to support her family as she is a single mother. The loan will also give residents the opportunity to shop for the necessary children's clothing at their local market.

Sumangul plans to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

Давлатова Сумангул – 43 года, образование среднее – техническое, по специальности повар, разведённая, имеет 3-х детей. Сумангул имеет торговую точку на одном из рынков города Вахдата, основным товаром, которым она торгует это детские зиминие вещи, носки и колготоки для детей. Полученный кредит она хочет использовать на увелечение ассортимента продаваемого товара, так как зимой, во время холодов увеличивается спрос на данный товар. Полученный кредит поможьет ей увеличить свой товарооборот, что в свою очередь увеличит её доход, который позволит ей содержать семью, так как она является матерью – одиночкой. Также данный кредит даст возможность местным жителям приобретать необходимые детские вещи у себя в районе.

Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Ranohon

texts.ru:
Ranohon N. is 50 years old, she has secondary education, married and has 6 children. In the present time Ranohon sells children's toys at the local market in Vahdat. She has been in this business for the past 20 years. Because the demand for warm clothes in the winter is higher, Ranohon wants to use the loan to buy new assortment of merchandise such as winter clothes and new children's toys. The loan will help her increase the variety of her merchandise and drive up sales. The residents will also have the opportunity to make their children happy on their birthdays and on holidays by buying the toys from Ranohon.

She plans to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

Нурматова Ранохон, возраст – 50 лет, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 6-х детей. Ранохон в настоящее время занимается торговлей мягких детских игрушек на рынке в городе Вахдата. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 20 лет. Так как в зимнее время пользуются спросом зимние тёплые вещи, Ранохон на полученный кредит хочет приобрести новый ассортимент товара, то есть зимние вещи, а также детские игрушки. Данный кредит поможет ей обновить ассортимент продаваемого товара и увеличить свои продажи, также местные жители смогут радовать своих детей в дни их рождения и праздники покупая у Ранохон детские мягкие игрушки.

Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase new assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Kumri

texts.en:
Kumri is 45 years old. She and her husband, an artist, raised four children. All of their children are married.

For 15 years Kumri has run her own business. In the largest local market she has a store that sells children's clothing. The store is located in the center of the market. Kumri is very nice and polite, which allows her to easily grow her client base. Kumri is trying to diversify the range of goods that she sells, and thus satisfy the tastes of clients with various levels of income.

Kumri has been working with IMON for about one year. She managed her previous loans accurately and precisely. Today, Kumri requests $700.00 USD in order to buy children's clothing for the winter season. Kumri thanks everyone who supports her and promises to repay the loan in 6 months

loans.use: To purchase new children's clothing to sell for the winter season

loans.name: Rohat

texts.en:
Rohat is 45 years old. She is the loving mother of three kids, whom she is raising alone. Rohat is working hard in order to provide for her kids, give them all they need and pay for their education.

Rohat has been running her own business for four years to provide for her family. In the local market she sells shawls and headscarves and clothing for men. Rohat is very successful in her business, which is important since it is the only source of income for her family.

Rohat has received loans from IMON for more than two years. She has a positive credit history without any late payments. Today, Rohat requests $1,000.00 USD. This courageous woman plans to use the loan to increase the range of goods she sells so that she can improve the lives of her kids. Rohat shall repay the loan in 6 months.

loans.use: To purchase new goods for increase the number and type of goods

loans.name: Abdulhak

texts.en:
Abdulhak is 41 years old. His wife keeps their house and looks after their three children. The children attend school.

Abdulhak is the only breadwinner in the family. He is very hard working. He has a café where he sells the national cuisine and the foodstuffs. He has had the business for seven years. Abdulhak makes sure to have fresh foodstuffs and tasty meals in his café so that his clients can eat and rest. This also ensures he has a lot of business. His business is stable, which allows him to generate income to provide for his family.

Abdulhak has received several loans from IMON. He has been a member since March 2006. He is very accurate and precise in repaying his loans. Today, Abdulhak requests $500.00 USD to purchase cereals, a glass case, and oil for cooking in his café. Abdulhak plans to repay the loan in 9 months and he thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: To purchase cereals, a frig glass case, and oil for cooking in his café

loans.name: Rohat

texts.en:
Rohat is a 44 year old mother of three children, who are all of school age. Her husband is unemployed, so she is the only bread-winner in the family.

Rohat has been running her business for more than 10 years. She sells various carrier bags, handbags and plastic bags in the local central market. The goods are supplied from China. Rohat's trading place is located in a very good spot in the market. She has many clients and is able to generate a stable income for her family.

Since 2005, Rohat had been receiving loans from IMON. She has repaid all of her loans accurately and in a timely manner. Now, Rohat is requesting $1,000.00 USD as she plans to open her own store. Rohat thanks everybody for supporting her and promises that she shall repay the loan in 6 months.

loans.use: To purchase new goods and expand business by opening a private store

loans.name: Orifjon

texts.en:
G. Orif is 28 years old. He and his wife, who is the housekeeper, are raising two wonderful kids. Orif’s kids are small now, but he is working hard in order to ensure the best future for them.

For more than 4 years, Orif has been repairing furniture. At the same time he is involved into producing office furniture for selling. Over the years, Orif became a real expert in his business. Since Orif has a lot of clients, the business is very successful and brings a stable and significant income allowing Orif improving the living conditions of his family.

Orif has been a client of IMON since February 2006. Over this time, Orif has never violated any of the terms or procedures of the loan repayments. Today, Orif is requesting 500 US Dollars to purchase planks, glue, nails, screws and a lathe for producing and repairing furniture. Orif would to thank and ensure everyone supporting him he shall pay the loan in 9 months.

loans.use: Purchasing of planks, glue, nails, screws and the lathe for producing and repair of the furniture

loans.name: Thong

texts.en: Mrs. Thong S., 28, is married with two young children and lives in the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works selling clothes at an open air-market and earns on average around $6 each day in revenue. Her husband works as a motorcycle-driver, generally carrying people to and from the market. He typically earns around $4.80 every day for this activity. Mrs. Thong S. intends to use this loan to purchase more fashionable clothes so that she can meet her existing clients demand, as well as expanding her customer base.

loans.use: To purchase more fashionable clothes to sell in order to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Mahkam

texts.en:
Mahkam is 66 years old. He and his wife have raised three children who are already married and have their own kids. They adore their grandparents. 

Mahkam works hard, despite his age. For more than 40 years, he has worked the land. He keeps a garden. Now Mahkam grows grapes on his plot of land, as well. He stores the grapes during the winter in a storehouse. After he processes them, Mahkam sells them in the local market. His wife, his youngest son and his daughter-in-law help him in the business. 

Mahkam has already received a loan from IMON. He has a positive credit history; he repaid his loan without violation or delinquency. This winter has been very cold in Tajikistan. Therefore, Mahkam requests 700.00 Somoni ($225.00 USD) in order to buy glass wool to warm the storehouse and save his grapes. Mahkam promises to repay the loan in 12 months and he thanks all for their support.
