loans.use: Purchasing of glass wool in order to warm the storehouse with grasps

loans.name: Munirjon

texts.en:
Munirjon is 34 years old. He is married and has two adorable kids. His wife keeps the house and takes care of the kids.

In order to support his family, Munirjon sells suits for men. He has been in this business for 13 years. Munirjon has a wealth of experience and he is able to choose goods that meet the needs of his clients whose tastes differ. The business is quite successful and generates a stable income that allows Munirjon to improve the living of his family.

Munirjon has received several loans from IMON during his three years with the organization. He has shown himself as an accurate client and has a positive credit history. Today, Munirjon requests $1,000.00 USD for the term of 6 months. With the loan, he is planning to purchase new suits to sell and thus incrase his range of goods.

loans.use: To purchase new suits for men for increasing inventory

loans.name: Ha Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ha Thi T., 31 years old, has a 35-year-old husband and 2 children who are still going to school. Her main activity is to sell merchandises such as candies, wines, cigarettes, etc. Whoever has come to her store would never forget her friendliness to customers. During 7 years joining the Fund, she always uses her loan effectively. Her current income is 150 USD/month. This time she wants to borrow 1200 USD to buy more merchandise to improve her business. She also intends to expand her business into other fields like restaurant in the future.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hà Thị Thêu năm nay 31 tuổi, còn chồng chị năm nay 35 tuổi, hai anh chị có 2 cháu đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Công việc chính của chị là bán buôn, bán lẻ các loại hàng hóa như bánh kẹo, rượu, thuốc lá và một số mặt hàng khác. Ai đã từng đến cưả hàng kinh doanh của chị Thêu thì không thể quên được chị bán hàng luôn nhiệt tình với khách đến mua hàng ấy. Trong 7 năm tham gia, chị luôn là thành viên vay vốn và sử dụng vốn vay hiệu quả của Quỹ TYM. Thu nhập hàng tháng của chị Thêu là 150USD. Lần này chị muốn đề nghị Quỹ cho chị vay mức vốn 1200USD để mua thêm hàng phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh. Trong tương lai chị cũng có dự định sẽ mở rộng việc kinh doanh sang các lĩnh vực khác như mở hàng ăn.

loans.use: Buy goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Ataboev

texts.en: Ataboev Z. lives in Spitamen (Soghd oblast, Tajikistan).  He is married and has 3 children. Ataboev Z. applied to MicroInvest in 2007 and  is a serious and responsible client. His business' stability and income increase helped him to repay the previous loan and to improve his business situation.  Because he has been engaged in the livestock business from the early years when he helped his father raise and sell cows and sheep, Ataboev Z. has the appropriate knowledge for his business . In addition, he is engaged in  agricultural production and rice cultivation.  In time, he would like to purchase a horn pedigree bull to breed and further increase his livestock numbers. Now Mr. Ataboev Z. requests a loan of $350 for  business development and the horn pedigree bull purchase that would allow him to increasing significantly the family income.

loans.use: for business development and the  horn pedigree bull purchase

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi D., 40 years old, is living with her husband and her 2 children in Kim Dong, Hung Yen. She is the 5th member of the Fund. Her current job is to run a small food shop. Her food shop mainly sells out cooked rice noodle soup. Her husband, Mr. Nguyen Van Chuot, is a nice and hard-working man. He is always Mrs. D.’s great source of help. This time, she wants to borrow the TYM Fund 1200 USD to buy more ingredients for her food shop. Her current income is 160 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Định, 40 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và hai con tại huyện Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Chị là thành viên năm thứ 5 của Quỹ Tình thương. Công việc hiện nay của chị Định là bán hàng ăn. Cửa hàng của chị chuyên về bán bún, phở. Chồng chị, anh Nguyễn Văn Chuốt, một người đàn ông hiền lành chịu khó luôn giúp vợ đắc lực trong việc bán hàng. Vòng vốn tới, chị Định muốn vay Quỹ TYM mức vốn vay là 1200USD để mua thêm thực phẩm về bán hàng. Thu nhập hiện tại của chị Định là 160USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy food for her food shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new goods for inventory

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi L., 47 years old, is living with her 3 children in Kim Dong, Hung Yen. Her husband caught a fatal disease and passed away. She on her own struggled to raise her children to maturity and to send them to school. Her youngest child is still going to school now. She mainly uses the money borrowed from the Fund in breeding the chickens. Mrs. L. already has 200 chickens ready to be released from the coop for the Tet holiday. Besides, she also works on 2 hectares of rice field. Her income has increased from 30 USD to 125 USD/month after 3 years joining the Fund. She wants to borrow 575 USD to buy more chicken feed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Lẫm năm nay 47 tuổi sống cùng với 3 con tại Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Chồng chị mắc bệnh hiểm nghèo không may qua đời, một mình chị L. lũ nuôi các con ăn học trưởng thành. Hiện nay con út của chị vẫn đang đi học. Nguồn vốn vay từ Quỹ được chị sử dụng chủ yếu cho việc chăn nuôi gà. Trong chuồng gà nhà chị Lẫm có 200 con gà đang chuẩn bị được xuất chuồng trong dịp Tết. Ngoài ra gia đình chị còn làm 2 mẫu ruộng. Thu nhập của chị Lẫm đã tăng từ 30USD lên 125USD/tháng sau 3 năm tham gia Quỹ. Chị muốn vay 575USD để mua thức ăn cung cấp cho đàn gà của mình.

loans.use: Buy chicken feed

loans.name: Otajonov

texts.en: Otajonov M. lives in Spitamen, Tajikistan.  He is married and has 3 children. Otajonov M. has been the client of MicroInvest since 2007.  Otajonov M. from the first days showed himself as the reliable and responsible client. The business stability and income increase helped him to return in time the previous loan. Mr. Otajonov M. is experienced in business (about 10 years) and has the appropriate knowledge in livestock because he he has worked with  bovine animals from the early years. He helped his father on the farm as the stock keeper and further in the livestock raising and selling. It was the family business. Now he is a  schoolteacher but he still is engaged in livestock raising and selling because he has dreamed of having a  large flock and to open a business in  meat products making.  He dreams of having a horn pedigree bull and milk cow  for the further meat and milk goods production (to  supply to the bazaars: pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd and etc). Now Mr. Otajonov M. requests a loan of $375 for business development and the horn pedigree bull purchase that would allow him to increasing significantly the family income.

loans.use: for business development and a horn pedigree bull purchase

loans.name: Khudoinazarova

texts.en: Khudoinazarova N. lives in Spitamen, Tajikistan. She has been the client of MicroInvest since 2007 when she applied first for a loan for  business development. Mrs. Khudoinazarova N. started her business practically from scratch and had a scant assortment. Now she has the own trade outlet in the  bazaar and trades in Delftware. She is divorced and has 3 children but she is full of enthusiasm and readiness to work because she dreams about the good and assured future for her children. She has been engaged in the Delftware selling for some time. Mrs. Khudoinazarova N. has  Delftware suppliers and she has a wide-side assortment that is why she works with the clients of  different income levels. Thanks to her politeness and sensitiveness she has  repeat customers. Now Mrs. Khudoinazarova N. requests the loan of $650 for the Delftware business development and  new goods purchases.

loans.use: for the Delftware business development and the new goods purchases

loans.name: Mirzohabib

texts.en:
Mirzohabib is 34 years old. Mirzohabib and his wife, who is a nurse, are raising three children. All three go to school and Mirzohabib and his wife dream of their children attending college.

In order to support the family and to ensure a better future for the kids, Mirzohabib runs his own business. He has a small shop that repairs electrical equipment like, electrical cattle irons, electrical ovens, vacuum cleaners and heaters. He also sells electrical equipment. He is a good repairman and chooses high-quality equipment at attractive prices for his clients. Mirzohabib’s business is very stable and provides significant support for his family.

Mirzohabib has been working with IMON for about 2 years. He has been able to repay all his loans timely and precisely. Today, Mirzohabib requests $500.00 USD for 9 months. He is planning to purchase spare parts and the diagnostic devices for the repair of electrical equipment. Mirzohabib thanks all for their support.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and diagnostic devices to repair electrical equipment

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa is 46 years old. She is married and is the loving mother of three wonderful kids. Her husband is a pensioner.

To support her family, Sharifa sells children's clothing. She has been in this business for 14 years. Through the years, she has gained experience in choosing goods of fine quality that will meet the requirements of clients with various levels of income. The business is very stable and allows Sharifa to improve her family's lifestyle.

Sharifa has been working with IMON for more than 3 years. She managed her previous loans with accuracy and made all the payments in a timely manner. Today, Sharifa requests $1,000.00 USD in order to buy children's clothing for the winter season to sell. Sharifa would like to thank everyone supporting her and to ensure that she shall repay the loan in 6 months.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing to sell for children in the winter season

loans.name: Khakimov

texts.en: Khakimov D. lives in Spitamen, Tajikistan. He is married and has a child. Khakimov D. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007. His  business stability and income increase helped him to return his previous loan. Khakimov D. is experienced in business (about 5 years) and has the appropriate knowledge in livestock because he worked with the bovine animals from his early years. He helped his father in the farm as the stock keeper and further in the livestock raising and selling and milk production. It was the family business. His wife is engaged in livestock raising and selling also because it is the family business. Khakimov D. dreams of having a large flock and to open a business in the meat products making. In time he dreams of owning a horn pedigree bull and milk cow for  further meat and milk production (its supply to the bazaars: pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd and etc). Now Mr. Khakimov D. requests the loan of $500 for business development and the future horn pedigree bull purchase that would allow him to increase significantly the family income and permit him to plan further business development.

loans.use: for business development and a future horn pedigree bull purchase

loans.name: Luu Thi

texts.vi:
When TYM fund opened a branch in the village of Hoàng Kim in 2002, Ms Lưu Thị Thơ was one of its first members. Ms Thơ is 45 years old. She started with a loan of 50 USD which was invested in pig breeding. She had success with the breeding, the profit increased and she was able to qualify for bigger loans in later rounds. The last loan that she received, 1200 USD, was used to build new pig pen and develop hydroponic cultivation following VAC model. Her income increased 40%, from 100 USD to 140 USD a month. Her husband operates a carpentry shop out of their home. Together they have a steady income. Their son is attending university and their daughter is in grade 12. Ms Thơ is very well respected by her peers, she is the TYM village leader for the last few years. She was voted as "entrepreneur of the year 2007" by the women group in her village. This time she is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to buy chickens and feed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Khi Quỹ Tình thương đến với xã Hoàng Kim năm 2002, chị Lưu Thị Thơ, 45 tuổi là một trong những thành viên đầu tiên tham gia vào Quỹ. Với mức vốn vay ban đầu là 50USD chị chăn nuôi lợn nái. Số vốn vay tăng lên cùng với sự phát triển của dự án, vòng vốn vừa qua chị đã mạnh dạn vay 1200USD để xây dựng chuồng trại, tu sửa vườn trên ao dưới theo mô hình VAC. Thu nhập tăng từ 100USD lên 140USD/tháng. Chồng chị làm xưởng mộc tại nhà nên kinh tế rất phát triển, thu nhập rất ổn định. Con trai chị đang học đại học, con gái út đang học lớp 12. Chị Thơ nhiều năm được chị em tín nhiệm bầu làm cụm trưởng, tổng kết năm 2007 chị được hội phụ nữ xã bầu là hội viên làm kinh tế giỏi. Vòng vốn tới chị tiếp tục vay 1200USD để mua gà giống và thức ăn gia cầm.

loans.use: Buy chickens and chicken-feed

loans.name: Abduvalieva

texts.en: Abduvalieva B. lives in Spitamen (Soghd oblast,) Tajikistan. She is married and has 5 children. Mrs. Abduvalieva B. applied to MicroInvest in 2007 and recommended herself as a serious and responsible client. Her business stability and income increase helped her to return  the previous loan and to improve her business situation. Mrs. Abduvalieva B. is experienced in business of livestock and has the appropriate knowledge in livestock because she has been engaged in the livestock business from her early years when she helped  her mother on the farm in looking after cows and sheep. Now it is the family business that brings the general income. She is engaged in  livestock raising and selling and  milk production. In time she dreams of owning a pedigree milk-cow  that would ensure the milk products making and selling. Now Mrs. Abduvalieva B. requests the loan of $425  business development that will permit her to increase significantly the family income and to make a milk-cow purchase.

loans.use: for  business development and the further milk-cow purchase

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Tập, 39 years old, is a member of the TYM Fund at Hoàng Kim village. Her first loan was 30USD for investment in a small general store at home. After many rounds of small loans and with her cleverness to pick up opportunities, she changed business direction to scrap metal. Then she took out two rounds of special loan and opened a steal door manufacture at home. After 6 years with the TYM Fund, her family’s economy improves that she can afford TV, motorbike and education for her three children. She would like to take out a loan of 950USD to buy more scrap metal.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Tập, 39 tuổi, là thành viên tiêu biểu của Quỹ TYM ở xã Hoàng Kim. Vốn vay ban đầu của chị là 30USD đầu tư bán hàng nhỏ lẻ tại nhà. Qua nhiều vòng vốn vay với sự nhạy bén nắm bắt cơ hội, thấy việc thu mua phế liệu mang lại nhiều lợi ích kinh tế, chị bàn với gia đình vay vốn lớn từ Quỹ để kinh doanh loại hình này. Sau 2 vòng vốn đặc biệt chị Tập mở thêm cửa hàng làm cửa sắt tại nhà. Sau 6 năm tham gia Quỹ cuộc sống gia đình chị đã thực sự thay đổi: chị đã sắm sửa được xe máy, tivi … 3 con chị được tạo điều kiện ăn học đầy đủ. Mong muốn của chị là sẽ tham gia Quỹ lâu dài để vay vốn đầu tư vào dự án phát triển kinh tế. Vòng vốn tới chị Tập xin vay 950USD để thu mua thêm phế liệu.

loans.use: Buy scrap metal

loans.name: Muzaffar

texts.en:
Muzaffar is 37 years old. He is married and has 3 children of school age. His wife is a teacher of secondary school.

Muzaffar produces Tajik cradles. The cradles in Tajikistan are very colorful. They are made of wood. As a rule the national cradle is presented by the grandparents of a child when the baby is 40 days old. The entire family celebrates this event. Muzaffar has been in this business for 15 years. His wife and two children help him. Once the cradles are finished, he sells them from his house. The business provides stability that allows the family to have enough income to ensure the family can improve their living conditions.

Muzaffar has been working with IMON for three years. He has proven himself as a successful client, managing his loans with accuracy and precision. Today Muzaffar requests a loan in the amount of $1,000.00 US Dollars in order to purchase planks and paints for producing more cradles. Muzaffar is planning to repay the loan in 6 months.

loans.use: Purchasing raw material: planks and paints.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Sáng, 40 years old, is one of the first members of the TYM Fund, branch 7 of Mê Linh province. Her first loan was 30USD to invest in poultry and farming. After a year her family change to butcher shop and luncheon meat. The shop is popular and income is very steady at 200-230USD a month. She has a nice furnished 2 story house mean for her children’s education. She lives with her husband and 3 children at Tam Đồng village of Mê Linh. She would like to take out a loan of 1200USD to buy pork to make luncheon meat.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Sáng, 40 tuổi, là thành viên tham gia Quỹ ngay từ những ngày đầu thành lập chi nhánh 7 Mê Linh. Số vốn vay ban đầu là 30USD được chị đầu tư chăn nuôi, làm ruộng. Sau một năm vay vốn gia đình chị mạnh dạn chuyển S. buôn bán thịt lợn, quay giò, làm chả. Quán của chị rất có uy tín với mọi người nên lúc nào cũng rất đông khách đặt và mua hàng, thu nhập rất ổn định. Qua nhiều năm tham gia Quỹ gia đình chị đã xây được ngôi nhà hai tầng khang trang, mua sắm các tiện nghi sinh hoạt đắt tiền và đầu tư cho các con ăn học. Thu nhập từ cửa hàng là 200-230USD/tháng. Hiện chị đang sống cùng chồng và 3 con đang trong độ tuổi ăn học tại xã Tam Đồng, Mê Linh. Vòng vốn tới chị tiếp tục xin vay 1200USD để mua thêm thịt lợn về làm giò, chả bán.

loans.use: Buy pork

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., 48 years old, has been a member of TYM Fund (Kiva's partner in Vietnam) since 1995. She used her initial loan of 20USD to raise pigs. Like a lot of other families in the cluster, her family has no other job but raising pigs and farming. This is why Mrs. H.'s family still has a lot of difficulties. The quality of life increases significantly when she pioneered to change from the original method of farming to the VAC method (VAC stands for farming/gardening, fishing, and breeding animals). The first days were not easy, but Mrs. H. is still patient and firmly believe on her chosen project. With diligence and patience, after all those years, she now has 1 acre of land to use the VAC method, and this project continues to reward her a steady income. This loan cycle, Mrs. H. would like to borrow 650USD to buy foodstuff and fertilizer. She wants to continue to be a TYM Fund member and borrow money to increase her family income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hiệp, 48 tuổi, là thành viên tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1995. Vốn vay ban đầu là 20USD chị đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn. Cũng như bao gia đình khác trong cụm, ngoài chăn nuôi, làm ruộng, gia đình không có nghề phụ gì nên cuộc sống gia đình gặp nhiều khó khăn, vất vả. Cuộc sống có bước thay đổi khi gia đình chị đi tiên phong trong việc dồn điền đổi thửa, chuyển đổi sang mô hình VAC. Công việc trong những ngày đầu không dễ dàng nhưng chị Hiệp vẫn kiên trì đầu tư vào dự án mà mình đã chọn. Với đức tính cần cù, chịu khó, qua nhiều năm đến nay gia đình chị đã đạt thành quả là một cơ ngơi khang trang với hơn 1 mẫu VAC khá quy mô và đang cho thu nhập thường xuyên, ổn định. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 650USD để mua thức ăn gia súc, phân bón. Mong muốn của chị là tiếp tục được vay những mức vốn lớn hơn của Quỹ để đầu tư phát triển kinh tế gia đình.

loans.use: Buy foodstuff, fertilizer

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Trần Thị Định, 31 years old, lives with her husband and 3 children at Tự Lập village of Mê Linh, Vĩnh Phúc. She’s been a member of the TYM Fund for 12 years. After 2 rounds of loan she realizes that taking out big loan and weekly repayments fit her family’s business very well. Her decision of changing from raising pigs to poultry has prospered the business. She also built 2 incubators to provide ducklings to others poultry farms in the area. The income is about 300USD a month. She is well deserved the achievement award from the Fund. This time she would like to take out a loan of 1200USD to buy feed for her ducks.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Trần Thị Định, 31 tuổi, đang sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại xã Tự Lập, Mê Linh, Vĩnh Phúc là thành viên năm thứ 12 của Quỹ. Sau hai vòng vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi chị Định nhận thấy việc vay vốn lớn hoàn trả tuần rất phù hợp với gia đình. Nằm trên địa bàn thuần nông và chăn nuôi, lại gần chợ là nơi trao đổi hàng hoá rất thuận lợi, nắm bắt được thị hiếu người tiêu dùng, gia đình chị mạnh dạn chuyển từ chăn nuôi lợn sang chăn nuôi vịt đẻ và vịt thịt (1200 con) mang lại hiệu quả kinh tế cao. Không dừng lại ở đó gia đình chị còn xây thêm 2 lò ấp trứng, ngoài việc cung cấp con giống cho địa bàn xã, huyện, gia đình chị còn làm thêm trứng vịt lộn cung cấp cho khách hàng. Thu nhập từ dự án mang lại hàng tháng là 300USD. Chị Định và gia đình xứng đáng là gương điển hình làm kinh tế giỏi mà chi nhánh và xã trao tặng. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 1200USD để mua thức ăn cho đàn vịt.

loans.use: Buy feed for ducks

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyễn Thị Thiết, 43, joined TYM fund in 2000. Her husband, Nguyễn Bá Hoàn, is an army officer. They have 2 children who are still attending school. Their house has a street front so Ms Thiết took advantage of it, she opened a grocery store in the front of her house. She feels comfortable with the weekly payment arrangement with TYM so she applied for a loan to invest in her grocery store. Since then, she has received multiple maximum loans from TYM. In total she has received almost 6000 USD in loans. Beside tending her grocery store, she also raises about a dozen of pigs, 100 chickens for meat and eggs. Her 2 children are studious, they have excellent results in school. Her son is attending the provincial vocational school, her daughter is one of the best student in the village. Ms Thiết is an examplary entrepreneur of the TYM branch which her group belongs to. Her wish is to continue participating TYM fund for years to come. This time she is requesting a loan of 950 USD to buy merchandise for her store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Thiết, 43 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 2000. Chồng chị, anh Nguyễn Bá Hoàn, là một sỹ quan quân đội. Hai anh chị có hai cháu đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Nhà ở mặt đường nên chị Thiết sớm nắm bắt cơ hội mở cửa hàng kinh doanh tổng hợp tại nhà. Thấy cơ chế hoàn trả tuần của Quỹ Tình thương rất phù hợp với điều kiện gia đình nên chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn đầu tư. Chị Thiết là một trong những thành viên của xã nhiều vòng vốn vay tối đa của Quỹ, từ khi tham gia đến nay chị đã vay gần 6000USD. Ngoài bán hàng chị còn một mình chăn nuôi hàng chục con lợn, trăm con gà đẻ và gà thịt. Hai con của chị rất chăm ngoan và học giỏi, con trai đầu đang học trường chuyên của tỉnh, con út chị nhiều năm liền là học giỏi của huyện. Chị Thiết xứng đáng là tấm gương phụ nữ điển hình tiêu biểu của xã và chi nhánh, nguyện vọng của chị và gia đình là sẽ tham gia Quỹ lâu dài để tiếp tục vay vốn đầu tư dự án phát triển kinh tế. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 950USD để mua thêm hàng về bán.

loans.use: Buy goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Ishonkulova

texts.en: Ishonkulova N. lives in Spitamen, Tajikistan. She is married and has 2 children. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007 when she applied first for  a loan for  business development. Mrs. Ishonkulova N. started her business practically from scratch and had a scant assortment. Now she has her own trade outlet in the bazaar. She trades in  different cosmetics, small wares and perfume selling. Stable business and income helped her to pay back loans and to increase the new loan sum. She is full of enthusiasm and readiness to work because she dreams about the good and assured future for her children. Mrs. Ishonkulova N. has many suppliers and she has a wide assortment of goods which is why she works with the clients of  different income levels. Thanks to her politeness and sensitivity she has repeat customers. Now Mrs. Ishonkulova N. has stiff competition which is why she wants to provide new goods to increase the number of customers. Mrs. Ishonkulova N. requests a loan of $300 for  business development and  new goods purchases.

loans.use: for  business development and  new goods purchase.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha, age 25, is married with 3 children (ages 10, 6, and 3). She has a business of selling chapatis (round flat bread) and charcoal. She started this business in 1998, and now makes about $55 in profit per month for her work. She works daily from 5am to 10pm.

Asha hopes for a loan to expand her business by buying more stock. She belongs to the loan group Umani, which totals 38 members, who ensure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more food items and charcoal stock

loans.name: Sultonova

texts.en: Sultonova S. lives in Spitamen, Tajikistan. She is married and has a child. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007.  She has recommended herself as a reliable client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. She trades in the bazaar where her trade outlet is located. She is engaged in the special material for the national dress making  and selling. She is very experienced in business. Prices for her goods are lower than the bazaar prices and she has a wide assortment. That is why she works with the clients of  different income levels. Thanks to her politeness and sensitivity she has repeat customers. . Working in the  bazaar she meets stiff competition and wants to provide a wider assortment of new goods. It would permit her to realize her new business plans and to develop the existing business. Now Mrs. Sultonova requests a loan of $300.

loans.use: to develop the existing business

loans.name: Turaboev

texts.en: Turaboev M. lives in Spitamen (Soghd oblast) Tajikistan. Turaboev M. applied to MicroInvest in 2007 and recommended himself as a serious and responsible client. The business stability and income increase helped him to return, in time, the previous loan and to improve his business situation. Mr. Turaboev M. is experienced in the business of livestock and has the appropriate knowledge in  livestock because he  has been engaged in the livestock business from his early years when he helped his father to raise and sell  cows and sheep. Besides he is engaged in  agricultural production and rice cultivation. It is the family business  He dreams of purchasing a horn pedigree bull for further livestock breeding. Now Mr. Turaboev M. requests a loan of $300 for  business development and the further horn pedigree bull purchase that would allow him to increase significantly the family income.

loans.use: for the business development and the further horn pedigree bull purchase

loans.name: I Wayan Sampun

texts.id:
I Wayan Sampun, 37 years old, has 10 acres of paddy field. Within a year, he can harvest twice from his field. Every 1 acre produces 60-70 kg of paddy and with the price of paddy Rp. 2.100,- per kg, from his 10 acre field his gross income is Rp. 1.470.000,-. In one planting period of 6 months, the crop needs fertilizer and insecticide spray and the cost of that is Rp. 750.000,-. Recently the price of fertilizer and insecticides are increasing and it directly affects the farmer. The costs for insecticides can be pressed down by using high quality and disease resistant seed which price is higher than the local one, but produces more and a better yield. With the loan, I Wayan Sampun plans to buy the high quality and disease resistant seed.

Translated from Indonesian by Iman Persada, Kiva Volunteer.

I Wayan Sampun, 37 tahun, memiliki areal sawah seluas 10 are. Dalam jangka waktu satu tahun, sawahnya bisa dipanen sebanyak dua kali. Setiap panen, per 1 are sawah bisa menghasilkan 60 – 70 kg padi dengan harga padi per kg adalah Rp. 2.100.- Jadi untuk 10 are sawah bisa mendapatkan penghasilan kotor Rp. 1.470.000.- Dalam satu periode tanam selama 6 bulan, tanaman padi membutuhkan perawatan berupa pupuk dan semprotan anti hama. Seluruh biaya perawatan tanaman menghabiskan biaya Rp. 750.000.- Belakangan ini harga pupuk dan anti hama mengalami peningkatan sehingga dampaknya sangat dirasakan oleh petani. Hasil yang didapat oleh petani sangat dipengaruhi oleh pemilihan bibit padi yang bukan merupakan jenis unggul. Untuk jenis padi unggul harganya relatif lebih mahal dari jenis lokal, namun mampu menghasilkan lebih banyak dan lebih tahan terhadap penyakit. Dengan pinjaman yang didapatnya, I Wayan Sampun berencana membeli bibit padi unggul sehingga bisa menghasilkan lebih banyak dan lebih baik. Biaya perawatan tanaman bisa ditekan karena kwalitas bibit unggul yang tahan penyakit.

loans.use: To buy high quality and disease resistant seed.

loans.name: Nageeb

texts.en: Nageeb lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives with his own family. He is married with one son. He has a retail shop. He started this business 5 years ago. During this time, he attracted good numbers of customers in Kabul. Now he wants to enlarge his shop, so he requested an individual loan to complete his stock. He wants to make a good monthly income for his family. He is happy with all parts of his family and about this process of loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Ishmatov

texts.en: Ishmatov J. lives in Spitamen, Tajikistan.  He is married and has 3 children. Ishmatov J. has been the client of MicroInvest since 2007. The business stability and income increase helped him to return, in time, a previous loan. Mr. Ishmatov J. is experienced in business and has the appropriate knowledge of livestock because he  has worked with bovine animals from his early years. He helped his father on the farm as the stock keeper and further in  livestock raising and selling and  milk production. It was the family business. He dreams of having a large flock and to open a business in the meat products making.  In time he dreams of buying a horn pedigree bull and milk cow for further meat and milk  goods production (to supply to the bazaars: pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd and etc). Now Mr. Ishmatov J. requests a loan of $300 for  business development and a horn pedigree bull purchase that would allow him to increasing significantly the family income.

loans.use: for the business development and the horn pedigree bull purchase

loans.name: I Nyoman Nastra

texts.id:
Having a large field might not come in handy when it comes to cultivating and harvesting. Such a problem is faced by I Nyoman Nastra whose one acre of paddy field often becomes a lot of work for him. I Nyoman Nastra has to hire some labor to help him for plowing the soil, nurturing the crops, and harvesting. This affects his income. The loan he receives from Dinari would be utilized to buy a paddy thrashing machine to help him in harvest time. The tool does not need much manpower and he can lease it to other farmers. So the tool does not only help him, but it also generates another income for him.

Translated from Indonesian by Iman Persada, Kiva Volunteer.

Memiliki lahan yang cukup luas terkadang cukup merepotkan disaat mengolah dan memanen hasilnya. Apalagi harus dikerjakan seorang diri. Begitu juga yang dialami oleh I Nyoman Nastra. Dengan memiliki areal persawahan yang cukup luas, 1 hektar, terkadang merepotkan dirinya. Dalam pengolahan tanah, perawatan tanaman dan panen, seringkali I Wayan Nastra harus menyewa beberapa orang buruh untuk membantu pekerjaannya. Hal ini berpengaruh terhadap pendapatannya.

Dengan pinjaman yang didapat dari Dinari, I Wayan Nastra membeli sebuah alat perontok padi untuk membantunya disaat panen padi. Alat ini sangat membantunya karena tidak memerlukan banyak tenaga. Selain itu, alat tersebut bisa ia sewakan kepada petani lain yang juga memanen padi. Jadi selain dapat membantu pekerjaannya, alat tersebut juga dapat mendatangkan keuntungan baginya.

loans.use: To buy a paddy thrashing machine

loans.name: I Nengah Widana

texts.id:
Nengah Widana lives in a village called Manistutu on West of Bali. The village is located up on the mountain which makes it difficult to get water for irrigation and household necessities. The villagers are only counting on a small river which provides enough amount of water only in the rainy season. Facing such problem, I Nengah Widana cannot grow crops or cultivate the field maximally. He plants his field with corn. Having shortage in fertilizer and good quality seeds, he often gets low quality yield from his field. With the loan, he plans to buy fertilizer and good quality seeds so that his field can yield maximum produce.

Translated from Indonesian by Iman Persada, Kiva Volunteer.

I Nengah Widana tinggal didesa Manistutu, Bali Barat. Lokasi desa ini berada di lereng gunung, sehingga untuk pengairan, baik untuk perkebunan atau untuk kepentingan rumah tangga cukup sulit untuk didapat. Pengairan hanya mengandalkan sungai kecil yang mengalir didesanya yang airnya akan cukup apabila datang musim hujan. Karena air yang sulit didapat, I Nengah Widana tidak bisa bercocok tanam atau mengolah persawahan. I Nengah Widana menanami kebunnya dengan pohon jagung.

Namun karena kurangnya pupuk dan bibit yang berkwalitas, I Nengah Widana seringkali tidak mendapat hasil yang maksimal dari kebunnya. Dengan pinjaman yang didapatnya, I Nengah Widana berencana untuk membeli pupuk dan bibit jagung berkwalitas sehingga kebunnya bisa mendapatkan hasil yang maksimal.

loans.use: To buy good quality corn seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Mrs. Sim P. (age 27) and her family live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh. Sim and her husband (age 30), married for seven years, have one son. Their son is still young and stays at home. Sim is requesting her third loan with Maxima for the amount of $200, to buy thread and silk material for weaving.  Sim has been weaving (a skill she learned from her mother) for many years.  Her husband is also a silk weaver. He learned the skill from his wife and has been weaving for five years.

loans.use: To purchase thread and and silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Pheng D. is a widow with four children, one son and three daughters. Two of her children are married and living in different houses with their families. One of her daughters is working in a garment factory and her only son is doing farming with her. Pheng has been a farmer since 1979 and she has also been selling Cambodian snacks in her village since 2001. She and her family live along National Road number five about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.    

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA two times already. Now she is requesting another loan in the amount of $1,100. She will use this money for purchasing rice seed, fertilizer, pesticides, and to pay for a plowing fee.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and pay for a plowing fee.

loans.name: Kimseng

texts.en:
Mr. Kimseng H. (age 36) and his wife, Mrs. Um Sam Ath have been married since 1993. They have two daughters who are studying in the local school. Kimseng and his family live along National Road number five about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. He has been growing rice since 1993. His wife sells snacks in a Primary school in the village.

He has borrowed money from MAXIMA two times already. Now he is requesting another loan in the amount of $300. He will use this money for purchasing rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and to pay for a plowing fee.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and pay for a plowing fee.

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
Mr. Yat Choub has been married since 1996 and has two children, one son and one daughter. He and his family live along Tonle Basac River about ten kilometers from Phnom Penh. He has been a motorbike taxi driver since 2003. His spouse, Mrs. Ban Sam Ath is a housewife. She is looking after her two children at home and sending them to study at school in the village.

He is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time with the amount of $200. He will use this money for repairing his motorbike.

loans.use: For repairing his motorbike

loans.name: Kol

texts.en:
Miss Kol C. is single and lives with her mother (shown in picture). Her family lives along National Road Number one about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She is in the business of growing flowers for selling. She grows many kinds of flowers in the farm near her house. She started this business in 1980.

She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the second time in the amount of $600. She will use this money for purchasing a water pump and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.use: For purchasing a water pump and fertilizer

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Mrs. Neang S. had two children with her first husband--one son and one daughter. In 2006, she married her second husband and they have one daughter. Her family lives along National Road number one about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has been in the business of selling vegetables in her village since 1990. Her husband is a motorbike taxi driver.

She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time in the amount of $1000. She will use this money for purchasing vegetables for reselling and for repairing her house.

loans.use: For buying vegetables for reselling and to repair her house

loans.name: Sokim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokim S. (age 27) and her husband have been married since 2001. They have two children—one son and one daughter. Her son is studying in primary school in the village and her daughter is still young and stays at home. Sokim and her family live along National Road number five about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. She and her husband are in the business of growing rice since 2001. Besides growing rice, her husband is a construction worker.

She is asking to borrow money from MAXIMA for the first time in the amount of $100. She will use this money to buy fertilizer for growing rice.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for growing rice

loans.name: Meda

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 40 year-old Meda M.. She is single with three children, ages 16, 19, and 22. In 2000 Meda established a farming business, and now requires a loan of $175 order to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools for farming.

loans.name: Mann

texts.en: Mrs. Mann S., 35, is married with two children both of whom attend school. She works with her husband in a rubber plantation as labourer, from which they earn $3.50 each. Mrs. Mann S. would now like to purchase a hectare of rubber trees from the growers in her area so that they will not have to work for them, and can instead sell their own runner for a profit. This is why they would like to borrow $1000 to do this job effectively. She believes that this will enable her to raise her family's living conditions and enable her pay for her children's eduction.

loans.use: To purchase a hectare of rubber trees and resell them for a profit

loans.name: Mage

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 27 year-old Mage H., who is married with three children. In 2007 Mage established a clothing business. Mage has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. loans.use: To purchase additional stock of clothing in bulk for her clothing business.

loans.name: Kazinga C (Ii) Group

texts.en: Mary is 38 years old and married with four children. Her current business is cultivation (farming). She grows various crops and vegetables which include tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages, cassava and matooke. With the extra business profits, Mary intends to rent more land for cultivation.

loans.use: To buy more seeds, fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Albina

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 42 year-old Albina S.. She is married with six children, aged between 13 and 25. In 2006 Albina established a farming business, and now requires a loan of $450 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools for farming.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Mrs. Leng V. (age 37) and her husband, Mr. Svay Khat (age 39) have been married since 1990. They have five children--three sons and two daughters. Two of their children are studying in the local school. Leng and her family live in a fertile farming area along the Tonle Basac (river), a tributary of the Mekong, several kilometers south of Phnom Penh. She has been in the business of selling flowers since 2001. She buys flowers from farmers for reselling at a market in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a motor taxi driver and construction worker.

She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the fifth time in the amount of $1000. She will use this loan to purchase a contract for the future harvest of flower farms in her village. Two or three months later, she will sell them at a price higher than the agreed-upon price she pays today.

loans.use: To buy a contract for flowers for reselling

loans.name: Abdukaumov

texts.en: Abdukaumov A. lives in Spitamen (Soghd oblast, Tajikistan). Abdukaumov A. applied to MicroInvest in 2007 and recommended himself as a serious and responsible client. His business stability and income increase helped him to return, in time, the previous loan and to improve his business situation. Mr. Abdukaumov A. is experienced in the business of livestock and has the appropriate knowledge in  livestock because he has been engaged in  livestock from the early years when he helped his father raise and sell cows and sheep. Besides he is engaged in  agricultural production and rice cultivation. It is the family business  started by his father. In time, he dreams of purchasing a horn pedigree bull for further livestock breeding. Now Mr. Abdukaumov A. requests the loan of $300 for business development and the horn pedigree bull purchase that would allow him to increasing significantly the family income.

loans.use: for the business development and the further horn pedigree bull purchase

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs. Heng S., 40, is a mother of four children and work selling various kinds of fruits to the people in her community. She earns about $ 5 each day in revenue from this activity. Her husband is currently unemployed, which means that Mrs. Heng S. has to cover all the expenses of her family, including her children's tuition. With the small amount of income she makes it is difficult to meet her family’s needs. To help ease their troubles, Mrs. Heng S. has requested this loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband so that he will be able to generate more income for the family by operating  a motor-taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband so that he may operate a motor-taxi business.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov N. and her husband have been married since 1985. They have three children—two sons and one daughter. Pov and her family live in a fertile farming area along the Tonle Bassac (river), a tributary of the Mekong, several kilometers south of Phnom Penh. She has been in the business of selling bananas and guavas since 2003. She buys bananas and guavas from farms in her village for reselling at a market in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a construction worker. 

She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the second time in the amount of $300. She will use this loan to purchase bananas and guavas from farms in her village for reselling at a market in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: For buying flowers and guavas for reselling

loans.name: Zera

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30 year-old Zera K.. She is married with three children, ages 3, 9, and 13. In 2005 Zera established a clothing business. Zera has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a loan of $625 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. loans.use: To purchase additional stock of clothing in bulk for her clothing business.

loans.name: Kazinga C (Iii) Group

texts.en: O. is a single mother of one child. She currently makes a large variety of crafts like mats, sandals, bags, necklaces, and shoes. She would like to use her extra profits to expand her business and make a business building.

loans.use: To expand her crafts business

loans.name: Boimatov

texts.en: Boimatov A. lives in Spitamen, Tajikistan. He is married and has 3 children. Boimatov A. has been the client of MicroInvest since 2007. H has  recommended himself as a serious and strongly motivated client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures.  Mr. Boimatov A. is very experienced in business (about 8 years) and it is the family business. He is engaged in the business of  livestock raising and selling and milk production. He dreams of purchasing a horn pedigree bull and milk cow for  further meat and milk goods production (to supply to the bazaars). It is planned to include an assortment of milk products such as pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd and etc. Now Mr. Boimatov A. requests a loan of $500 for  business development that would permit him to increase significantly his family income and to improve the existing business.

loans.use: for business development

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 45 year-old Jeny K.. She is married with three children, ages 13, 17, and 24, and has two other dependents who are her nephews. In 2007 Jeny established a kiosk selling snacks and fast food business. Jeny has already received and successfully repaid one loans from SELFINA, and now requires a loan of $450 in order to purchase ingredients and equipment. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients and stock for her snacks and fast food kiosk.

loans.name: Phun

texts.en: Mrs. Phun P., 28, is married with one young child and works with her husband selling charcoal and coconut in the town of Kampong Cham, Cambodia. To transport their goods to town they use a motorcycle with a trailer attached to use as their business' transportation. On average, this couple earn about $11 each day in revenue. Mrs. Phun P. hopes to use this loan to expand her business by purchasing a large quantity of coconut to meet her growing demand. She is looking forward to raising her income and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase in a large quantity of coconut to meet her growing customer demands.

loans.name: Kazinga B(I) Group

texts.en: Federsi is a 45 year old woman. She currently handles poultry as her job. She plans to start up her own market stall with the extra profits.

loans.use: To help their poultry business.

loans.name: Rasulov

texts.en: Rasulov Y. lives in Spitamen, Tajikistan. He is married and has 4 children. Rasulov Y. has been the client of MicroInvest since 2007.  He has recommended himself as a serious and strongly motivated client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. Mr. Rasulov Y. is very experienced in business (about 10 years) and it is the family business. He is engaged in business of the livestock raising and selling and the milk production.  He dreams of purchasing a horn pedigree bull and milk cow for further meat and milk goods production (to supply to the bazaars). This would include such products as pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd and etc. Now Mr. Rasulov Y. requests the loan of $475 for business development that would permit him to increase significantly the family income and to purchase the pedigree bull.

loans.use: for the business development

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
Mrs. Yat T. (age 47) is a widow with six sons. Her husband died ten years ago. Two of her sons are truck drivers and the other four are studying in the local school. Yat and her family live along National Road number one south of Phnom Penh. She has been in the business of selling bananas and flowers since 1979. She buys them from farms in her village for reselling at a market in Phnom Penh.

She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time in the amount of $1000. She will use this loan in addition to her money for buying a truck for her son to carry construction materials and some for repairing her house.

loans.use: To buy a truck for her son to deliver construction materials and repair her house.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thy S. (age 48) and her husband, Mr. Doeun Samoeun (age 48) have been married since 1980. They have three children, one son and two daughters. One of Thy’s daughters is married and living in a separate house and the other two children are studying in the local school. Thy has been in the business of selling vegetables and fruit since 1993. In addition, she is also doing farming. Her husband is a construction worker. 

She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the second time in the amount of $300. She will use this money to expand her business of selling vegetables.

loans.use: Purchasing vegetable for reselling

loans.name: Urinova

texts.en: Urinova M. lives in Spitamen, Tajikistan. She is married and has 5 children. She has been the client of MicroInvest since 2007. She has recommended herself as a reliable client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. Her business stability and income increase helped her to return a previous loan and to improve her business situation. Mrs. Urinova is experienced in the business of livestock. She has the appropriate knowledge in  livestock because she has been engaged with livestock from the early years when she helped first her mother on the farm looking after cows and sheep  and then working with her husband. It is the family business that brings the general income. She is engaged in livestock raising and selling and milk production . In time she dreams of  purchasing a pedigree a milk cow  that would ensure the milk products making and selling. Now Mrs. Urinova requests a loan of $300 for  business development that would permit her to increase significantly the family income allow her to purchase a milk cow . It would permit her to ensure the good future of her children.

loans.use: for business development

loans.name: Sreypov

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreypov P. (age 30) is a widow with one daughter who is studying in primary school. Sreypov is living with her parents across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She is in the business of weaving silk at home. She learned to weave silk from her aunt and started her silk production in 1994. Her mother is also a silk weaver.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA three times already. Now she is requesting another loan in the amount of $400. She will use this money to purchase silk materials and sewing thread and to pay fees for preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials and sewing thread and to pay fees for preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Kazinga B(Iii) Group

texts.en: Mica is 45 years old and married with six children. Her current  business is poultry farming. She would like to finish her house that is under construction with the extra business profits.

loans.use: To enlarge the poultry farm.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 27 year-old Fatuma P.. She is married with two children, ages 18 months and 10, and has one other dependent who is her niece. In 2007 Fatuma established a pharmacy business and now requires a loan of $175 in order to increase her inventory of medicine. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. loans.name: Pisey

texts.en:
Mrs. Pisey K. (age 41) and her husband, Mr. Sek Rathmony (age 50) have been married since 1990. They have two children, one son and one daughter. Their children are studying in the local school. Pisey and her family live along National Road number one south of Phnom Penh. She has been selling fruit since 1979. She buys many kinds of fruit from farms for reselling around her village. Her husband has been a motor taxi driver for five years.

She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time in the amount of $600. She will use this loan to expand her business of selling fruit.

loans.use: To purchase fruit for reselling

loans.name: Chinda

texts.en:
Mrs. Chinda S. (age 42) and her husband, Mr. Rim Toulas have been married since 1989. They have three children—one son and two daughters. Two of her children are studying in the local school and her youngest daughter is still young and stays at home. Chinda and her family live along National Road number five about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. Currently, she is in the business of selling medicine at her home and has started another business selling groceries. Her husband is working in a company in Phnom Penh.

She is borrowing money from MAXIMA for the first time in the amount of $1000. She will use this money to buy grocery items for reselling at her store.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for reselling

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en: I am Sakina R. from the small town of Chichawatni, Pakistan. My husband transports goods on a donkey cart and one of my sons operate a cloth shop. Last year, we took a loan for my husband’s business and his business became stable.  This year we request a loan for my son’s clothing sales store. My group members are: Kishwer B., who requests a loan for her son’s pharmacy, Sakina B., who requests a loan to buy her son a rickshaw, and Shahnaz B., who will invest in their restaurant. All these women are very cooperative and make their repayments on time.

loans.use: To expand clothing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her grocery business in bulk.

loans.name: Ya

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Ya (age 55) and her husband, Mr. Phouk Moeun (age 56) have been married since 1975. They have three children—one son and two daughters. Ya’s son is doing farming. One of her daughters is studying in the local school and another one is weaving silk. Ya and her family are living across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She is in the business of weaving silk at home. She learned to weave silk from her mother and started her silk production in 1968. Her husband is a fisherman and does farming. He grows vegetables and rice.

Ya is requesting her fourth loan in the amount of $1000. She will use this money to purchase a water pumping machine, fertilizer, and pesticides for her husband who does farming.

loans.use: To purchase water pumping machine, fertilizer, and pesticide.

loans.name: Abdurahmanova

texts.en: Abdurahmanova G. lives in Spitamen, Tajikistan. She is married and has a child. She decided to become the client of the MicroInvest because she watched the successful business development thanks to the MicroInvest loan procedure. Now she is the client of the MicroInvest and she trusts completely its loan procedures. Mrs. Abdurahmanova started her business many years ago but she has not had investment opportunities so she was ready to stop her business. But by taking the loan in MicroInvest she improved the business terms and opened a trade outlet in the food bazaar. She provided  new goods and now she has a wide-side assortment (cultured milk products, meat products, sweets, vegetable oil, flour products, etc.). Thanks to her politeness and sensitivity she has repeat customers and works with the regular suppliers. She works with the clients of  different income levels. Now Mrs. Abdurahmanova requests a loan for $650 for the business development that will improve her business income and permit her to plan to start a new business.

loans.use: for the business development

loans.name: Suriya's Group

texts.en: I am Suriya M. A.. I am married and live with my family in a small city called Chichawatni, Pakistan. My husband and one of my son run a  pharmacy, they require capital to buy medicines for their store. This is not a very big city and finding medicines is bit difficult.  Therefore, they plan to buy these medicines in bulk. My group members are: Shamim B., who plansto use a loan for their doors manufacturing business, Saba B., who plans to use a loan for their blankets sales business, Zaib B., who plans to use a loan to start a small food stall, and Ayesha B. will plans to use the loan in their paints business. I help them because I believe that love and care are biggest remedy of all problems.

loans.use: To buy stock of required medicines

loans.name: Kazinga B(Iv) Group

texts.en: Christine is 32 years old and married wih four children. She owns a retail shop. With the extra business profits, she intends to construct a modern shade for her market stall.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge for her retail shop

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.pt:
Jose Alberto M. didn't officially marry, but he lived with a woman with whom he had three children. José is retired from the Mozambican Armed Forces. He contributed his youth so that the country could consolidate the victories gained with Independence in a climate of peace and harmony among Mozambicans. In this process of civil war that occurred in the country, he lost a leg, making him disabled.

Despite this, José didn't lose heart, neither did he let himself become depressed, and much less consider himself disabled. To the contrary--he rolled up his sleeves and went to fight. The fight to secure daily bread for his family. Because his disability pension that he gets from the Ministry of Defense isn't sufficient to sustain his family, he decided to enroll in the FDM credit program to be able to benefit from a loan. This is how he came to buy clothing in Maputo and sell them in one of the markets in the city of Xai-Xai.

Unfortunately, his wife, not contenting herself with a disabled husband, robbed him of some of his goods and left him and the children, still young. This was two years ago. At the moment, José isn't thinking of finding another wife. He says he has strength to raise the children alone. Still, it's possible in the medium-term future that he'll consider finding a companion. But he would be really careful to choose the one that would become his future wife and mother of his children, to not fall into the same trap he fell into the first time. But despite this, José is convinced that life shouldn't stop, that the only path is forward.

He travels twice a month to Maputo in order to buy clothes and sandals for his stall. On the first trip he bought clothing worth 3000 meticais, and on the second trip, clothing worth 1500, as it was to replenish stock. In the future, if the business goes well, he's thinking of improving his home using conventional building materials, as it is currently made of wood and stucco.

Translated from Portuguese by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva volunteer

Jose Alberto M., nao casou oficialmente, mas vivia com uma mulher com quem teve 3 filhos. Jose e desmobilizado das Forcas Armadas de Mocambique. Ele contribuiu com a sua juventude para que o Pais pudesse consolidar as conquistas alcancadas com a Independencia num clima de paz e harmonia entre os Mocambicanos. Nesse processo de guerra civil que gracou o Pais ele ficou sem uma perna o que lhe relegou a uma posicao de deficiente fisico.

Apesar disso Jose nao desanimou, e nem se deixou abater muito menos considerar-se invalido. Antes pelo contrario arregacou as mangas e foi a luta. Luta para garantir o pao de cada dia para o seu agregado familiar. Pelo facto de a sua pensao de invalidez que ele recebe do Ministerio de Defesa nao ser suficiente para sustentar sua familia, ele resolveu entrar para o programa de credio do FDM para poder se beneficiar de um emprestimo. Assim ele passou a comprar roupa em Maputo e a vende-la num dos mercados da cidade de Xai-Xai.

infelizmente a sua esposa certamente nao se contentando em ter um marido deficiente fisico, roubou-lhe alguns bens e abandonou-o a ele e aos filhos ainda menores. isto faz 2 anos. Neste momento Jose nao pensa em arranjar outra mulher. Diz ele que tem forcas para criar os filhos sozinho. Todavia e possivel que num futuro a medio prazo pensa em arranjar uma companheira. Mas ele tera muito cuidado ao escolher aquela que vira a ser a futura esposa e mae de seus filhos, para nao cair no mesmo engodo em que caiu pela primeira vez. Mas apesar disso Jose esta convicto que a vida nao deve parar. a frente e que deve ser o caminho.

Ele viaja duas vezes por mes para Maputo afim de comprar roupa e chinelos para a sua banca.Na primeira viagem ele compra roupa correspondente a 3.000,00 Mt e na segunda viagem compra roupa correspondente a 1500,oo, pos que e para reforcar o stock. No futuro se o negocio correr bem ele pensa em melhorar a sua residencia usando material convencional pois que agora a casa e de paua pique.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing and sandals in Maputo for resale

loans.name: Lieng

texts.en: M. Lieng (59) and her husband, Khin Run (61) have been married since 1970. They have three children — two sons and one daughter. Their daughter is in full time employement, while one of the sons is a monk and  the other one studying in Phnom Penh. Lieng and her family live across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  M. Lieng started her own business in 1989 selling groceries and shoes while her husband earns a small living growing rice and planting vegetables.  Lieng is requesting a second loan of $1000 which she plans to use to purchase grocery items which she will sell at her store.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her store.

loans.name: Ayesha's Group

texts.en: My name is Ayesha S.. I live with my family in Chichawatni, a small town in Pakistan. I am a mother of seven; three attend school while the elders could not get education due to our impoverished conditions in the past. My husband had to undergo few surgeries in the past and we had to spend a lot on him. Now he is fine and runs a grocery store.  I request a loan for his grocery store. He runs this store in a nearby busy market; at times I also help him at his store. I am a group leader of few other women and their families: Naseem B. plans a loan for their spices store, Farah B. requests a loan for their juice stall, Naheed B. would use a loan in their vegetable’s business, and Yasmeen B. would use a loan for her stitching business.

loans.use: To expand grocery store

loans.name: Kazinga B(V) Group

texts.en: Teddy is 32 years old, married, and has four children. She raises multiple forms of livestock, including poultry and pigs. In addition, she cultivates her land for crops. Teddy would like to apply for a loan in order to add another poultry shop to increase business and profits.

loans.use: To expand her farming business

loans.name: Khadeeja's Group

texts.en: I am Khadeeja M.. I am married and a mother of four: two girls and two boys. We live in a small house in Chichwatni, a small town in Pakistan. All of my kids are currently completing their studies. My husband operates a grocery store to make a living. At present, we need a loan for our grocery store, to buy a stock for it. I stitch clothes at my house to supplement my husband’s income and ensure that my kids keep attending school.  There are five women in my loan group and they are also request loans: Ramzana B. requests a loan for their motorcycle rental store. Razia B. requests a loan for their medical pharmacy. Shamshad B. and Shugufta B. want to expand their businesses with the loans. Salma B. requests a loan for their oils store.

loans.use: To buy inventory for the grocery store

loans.name: Marta

texts.en: Marta is 20 years old. She lives with her family in Aley. Marta is a product agent who sells a variety of items. She participates in supporting her only child. This is the third time Marta is asking for a loan from A. Majmoua. She needs $600 to buy enough products to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy products for her business

loans.name: Veronika

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 33 year-old Veronika M.. She is married with five children, ages 3, 6, 8, 10 and 13. In 2002 Veronika established a grocery, poultry, and milking machine rental business. Veronika has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a loan of $1050 in order to purchase additional chickens, and stock for her grocery store. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks to raise and sell, as well as additional stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Makprang

texts.en:
Mrs. K. Makprang (age 37) and her husband have been married since 1987. They have five daughters. One of her daughters weaves silk at home, three are studying in a local school, and the youngest one stays at home. Makprang and her family are living on an island off the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She is in the business of weaving silk and raising pigs.  She learned to weave silk from her neighbor and started her silk production in 1985. Her husband works for a local company and sometimes helps her in raising pigs.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA five times already. Now she is requesting another loan for $600 which she will use to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom and to buy baby pigs for raising.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom and buy baby pig

loans.name: Kamuli B1 (A) Group

texts.en: Joy is currently 32 years old. She owns a small drug shop that sells medicine. Joy would like to apply for a loan to use the extra business and profit to begin a clinic. She hopes that the clinic will be able to serve a wider range of patients and provide greater healthcare to her patrons.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine

loans.name: Pheab

texts.en:
Mr. C. Pheab and his wife have five children, one son and four daughters. One of their daughters is married and living with them. The other four children are studying at a local school. Pheab and his family live in a fertile farming area along the Tonle Bassac (river), a tributary of the Mekong, several kilometers south of Phnom Penh. He sells and delivers meatballs and other food with his motorbike around the village, which he has done since 2005. His wife buys flowers from local farmers for resale at the market in Phnom Penh. 

He is requesting his first loan from MAXIMA for the amount of $1000. He will use this money to buy a motorbike for his son in-law to travel to work and to help his wife expand her flower business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and buy flowers for reselling

loans.name: Manal

texts.en: ManA. is 30 years old. She has 3 children and lives with her family in the region of Aley. She makes handicrafts. ManA. is supporting her family through this business. This is the third time ManA. has asked for a loan from A. Majmoua. She needs to buy materiA. to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy material

loans.name: Aldevina Pedro

texts.pt:
Aldevina is married and the mother of five children. Aldevina's husband is no longer employed. He tends a garden plot and does small jobs to sustain his family. Because of this, Aldevina joined the credit program to help her husband in supporting the family. She doesn't have a fixed location from which to sell her merchandise. She walks from house to house, from neighborhood to neighborhood, to sell her merchandise, which consists of clothing and flipflops. Despite the difficulty, she doesn't think of quitting. The kids, when they're not in school, help her sell in their neighborhood. She travels twice a month to Maputo in order to bring back the clothes to sell. The business is running normally. It is sufficient to help her husband support the household, and to pay for school for their children. She has three boys and two girls. The girls are the oldest, and they, plus two of the boys, are in school. The last one is not yet in school because he is not yet old enough. But soon he will also be enrolled, as he will turn five years old this year.

Translated from Portuguese by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva volunteer

Aldevina e casada e mae de 5 filhos. O marido de Aldevina ja nao trabalha. trabalha ana machamba familiar e faz pequenos expedientes para sustentar sua familia. Por isso Aldevina entrou para o programa de credito para ajudar seu marido no sustento da familia. Ela nao tem local fixo para vender sua mercadoria. Ela anda de casa em casa e de bairro em bairro para vender sua mercadoria que consiste em vestuario, chinelos. Apesar de ser dificil ela nao pensa em desistir.Os filhos quando nao estao na escola ajudam-lhe a vender no bairro onde moram.. Ela viaja 2 vezes por mes para Maputo para poder trazer a roupa para a venda. O negocio corre normalmente. Da para ajudar o seu marido a sustentar o lar, e a pagar a escola de seus filhos. Ela tem 3 rapaqzes e 2 raparigas. As raparigas sao as mais velhas e elas mais dois rapazes estao a estudar. restanto o ultimo pelo facto de ainda nao ter idade. Mas em breve tambem sera matriculado pois que completara 5 anos o presente ano;.

loans.use: Aldevina would like to use the money from the loan for the purchase of more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Raghida

texts.en: Raghida is a 35-year-old mother with one child. Raghida lives with her family in Aley. She makes bread, the kind that is called "saj." This is the fourth time Raghida has asked for a loan from A. Majmoua. She needs to buy the necessary provisions to sustain her business. Raghida is actively participating in making a livelihood for her family.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Soe

texts.en:
Mr. Soe K. (age 58) and his wife, Mrs. Say Moe have been married since 1981.They have seven children— two sons and five daughters. One of their daughters is working in a garment factory and the other children are studying in a local school. K. and his family are living on National Road 6, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. K. and his wife are in the business of growing vegetables and rice for selling at the market in Phnom Penh. They started their farming business in 1992. (Shown in the picture with his wife and his daughter)

K. is requesting his first loan of $600. He will use this loan to make repairs to his house.

loans.use: House repairs

loans.name: Samira

texts.en: Samira is a 42-year-old woman. She has 1 child and lives with her family in the region of Aley. Samira refills propane gas for household use. Samira is supporting her family through this business. This is the fourth time Samira is asking for a loan from A. Majmoua. She needs to buy supplies to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for the business.

loans.name: Khom

texts.en:
Mr. U. Khom (age 27) and his wife, Mrs. Mao Puthy have been married since 2004.They have one daughter. Khom and his family are living at National Road 6 about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, and he has been working as a construction contractor since 2000. His wife stays at home taking care of their daughter.

He has borrowed money from MAXIMA three times already. Now he is requesting another loan of $700. He will use this money to purchase construction materials to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 36 year-old Maria Sinfukwe. She is married with three children, aged 2, 6, and 9. In 2006 Maria established a farming business, and now requires a loan of $175 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools. She thanks you for your support.

texts.en: Nisrine is a 23-year-old mother of 2. She lives with her family in Aley. Nisrine does embroidery and other kinds of handicrafts. She is supporting her family with the revenue of her business. This is the fifth time Nisrine is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. She needs to buy the necessary material to sustain and develop her business.

texts.en: Betty is 44 years old and is married with seven children. She owns and runs a small grocery store. She would like to use the extra profits to start up a piggery business.

loans.use: To expand the grocery goods she sells.

loans.name: Sunheang

texts.en:
Mrs. L. Sunheang (age 42) and her husband have been married since 1989.They have four children—three sons and one daughter. One of her daughters is weaving silk at home and the other three children are studying at a local school. Sunheang and her family are living on an island of Mekong River. She is in the business of weaving silk.  She learned to weave silk from her neighbor and started her silk production in 1987. Her husband also works as a silk weaver which he has done since 1994.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA six times already. Now she is requesting another loan for $350. She will use this money to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials, sewing thread and fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

She needs to buy the necessary material to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy material for her business.

In 2003 Emmy established a business selling fish, and now requires a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.
