loans.name: Yeang

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Yeang (age 39) and her husband have been married since 1986.They have five children—four sons and one daughter. One of her children is working in Phnom Penh and the other four are studying in a local school. Yeang and her family are living on an island on the Mekong River. She is in the business of weaving silk.  She learned to weave silk from her neighbor and started her silk production in 1983. Her husband is also a silk weaver -  a skill he learned from his wife in 1983.

Yeang is requesting her first loan for $200. She will use this money to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Kawaala 1C Group

texts.en: Cathy is 30 years old. She owns a restaurant and also offers outside catering. She wants to use the extra business profits to buy  more food warmers and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and buy another fridge.

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en: Fadia is a 49-year-old mother of 5. She lives with her family in the Chouf.  Fadia knits and makes other kinds of handicrafts. She is supporting her family with the revenue of her business. This is the fifth time Fadia is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. She needs to buy the necessary material to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy materials for her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 38 year-old Mary S.. She is married with four children, aged 2, 4, 11, and 13. In 2006 Mary established a phone voucher business, and now requires a loan of $175 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk.

Despite being a ‘developing’ country (forgive the label, there remains no consensus on an acceptable definition), it is amazing how many people have mobile phones in Tanzania and in Africa in general. Not just professionals, but grandmas in villages, school kids, street sellers. It can probably be attributed to a number of factors, led by the fact that it is the only form of phone communication available to most people, because there are few landlines, and followed closely by how relatively cheap mobile phones are here. All of this makes any phone-related business a safe venture. So, happy lending…

loans.use: Mary would like to purchase additional stocks of phone credit vouchers in bulk.

loans.name: Chrin

texts.en: Mrs. Chrin Nai Seam, 41, is married and lives in the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To supplement her family’s income she is employed at a garment factory and makes on average $3 per day. Her husband works purchasing oxen and reselling them for a profit, which earns him about $1.60 each day. Mrs. Chrin Nai Seam hopes to use this loan to buy more cows so that she and her husband will be able to generate more profits for her family. (Her husband is pictured because Mrs. Chrin Nai seam is unavailable).

loans.use: To buy more oxen in order to increase her income

loans.name: Adele

texts.en: Adele is 60 years old and has four children. She lives with her family in the town of Aley, where she sells produce in the local market. In the photo, for example, she is peeling chestnuts before selling them to her customers.  Adele uses her entire income to support her family, and has come to us for a loan to buy more agricultural items to sell. This is the second time this hard-working and energetic woman has applied for a loan, and she made very good use of the first one she received from us.

loans.use: To buy agricultural produce to sell to her customers

This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: Frosia would like to purchase additional stock in bulk for her general store.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs. B. Chantha (age 44) and her husband, Mr. Nhean Dy (46) have been married since 1981. They have four children—two sons and two daughters. All of their children weave silk at home. Chantha and her family are living on an island on the Mekong River. She is in the business of weaving silk.  She learned to weave silk from her neighbor and started her silk production in 1980. Her husband is a fisherman.

Chantha is requesting his first loan for $500. She will use this money to repair her house.

loans.use: House repairs

loans.name: Frola

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 39 year-old Frola M.. She is married with three children, aged 9, 12, and 15. In 2000 Frola established a business selling household items and utensils, and now requires a loan of $150 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: Frola would like to purchase additional stock of household items.

loans.name: Eseosa

texts.en: Mrs. Eseosa I. is 35 years old, married with three children, and lives in Benin City, where she sells provisions. She is soliciting a loan of $1050 to enable her to buy more provisions for sale. She learned the trade for a period of three years and started her business in 2001. She is a LAPO member.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Sokhim

texts.en:
Mrs. Y. Sokhim and her husband, Mr. Mao Mit have been married since 1989. They have six children—one son and five daughters. One of Sokhim’s daughters is working in a garment factory, three children are studying in a local school, and another is still young and stays at home. Sokhim and her family are living across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She is in the business of selling rice around the village by her bicycle which she has done since 2000. Her husband is a fisherman and grows rice.

Sokhin is requesting her third loan for $500. She will use this money to purchase rice for reselling.

loans.use: To purchase rice for reselling

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 37 year-old Eliza M.. She is married with four children, aged 12–18, and has one other dependent, who is her niece. In 2000 Eliza established a farming business, and now requires a loan of $275 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. loans.use: Eliza would like to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools for farming.

loans.name: Chinda

texts.en:
Mrs. M. Chinda and her husband, Mr. Nhem Cheng have been married since 1991. They have three daughters, two of whom are studying in a local school, and the youngest who stays at home. Chinda and her family are living across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She earns a living weaving silk.  She learned to weave silk from her neighbor and started her silk production in 1996. Her husband is a fisherman, grows rice and raises pigs.

Chinda is requesting her third loan for the amount of $1000. She will use this money to purchase silk material for weaving and to buy baby pigs for raising.

loans.use: To purchase silk material and baby pigs for raising

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 27 year-old Asha K.. She is married with three children, aged 1, 7, and 10. In 2005 Asha established a grocery business, and now requires a loan of $175 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: Asha would like to purchase additional stock in bulk for her grocery business.

loans.name: Uyi

texts.en: Mrs. Uyi O. is 51 years old. She is married with eight children and lives in Benin City, where she sells women's wrappers and jewelry. She solicits a loan of $700 to buy more wrappers and jewelry for sale. She learned the business for four years, after which she started hers, in 1983. She is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more women's wrappers and jewelry for sale

loans.name: Koko

texts.fr:
Mrs. Koko A. is married and the mother of four children. At 40 years old, she has been trading for almost seven years. Thanks to good management, she has considerably increased her sales throughout 2007. She has also hired a young woman who helps her with her work. With help from this loan, Mrs. Koko would like to increase the size of her business.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer Liana Bianchi

Madame Koko A. est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Agée de 40 ans elle exerce ce commerce depuis bientôt 07 ans. Grâce à sa bonne gestion elle a considérablement augmenté son chiffre d’affaire au cours de l’année 2007. Elle a aussi engagé une jeune fille qui l’aide dans ses tâches. A l’aide de crédit, madame Koko désire augmenter la taille de son commerce.

loans.use: Purchase of jewelry and five bales of children's clothing for retail

loans.name: Kit

texts.en:
Mrs. M. Kit (age 53) has been married since 1979. Her husband cannot work because has a serious illness. Kit has four children—two sons and two daughters who are weaving silk at home. One of her two sons is growing rice and the youngest one is studying in a local school. Kit and her family are living across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She is in the business of weaving silk.  She learned to weave silk from her mother and started her silk production in 1970.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA four times already. Now she is requesting another loan for the amount of $300. She will use this money to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Magreth

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 39 year-old Magreth M.. She is widowed with four children, aged 7, 12, 15, and 17. In 2002 Magreth established a charcoal business, and now requires a loan of $175 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk.

These small, black and dirty pieces of dry earth are important not just to charcoal sellers but to their customers, who rely on charcoal to cook their meals. Many Tanzanians still use small coal pots, in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal) and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light them. The fire requires constant fanning to ignite and maintain the flame, and makes cooking quite a hot and laborious task. It may not be the easiest or most environmentally friendly form of cooking, but it is the only option many people can afford.

loans.use: Magreth would like to purchase additional stocks of charcoal in bulk.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Mrs. Grace O. is 36 years old, married with five children, and lives in Benin City. She sells provisions. She is soliciting a loan of $875 to buy more provisions for sale. She started the business in 2002. She is a LAPO client. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Janane

texts.en: Janane is 47 years old and has two children. She lives with her family in the Lebanese town of Aley, where she works as a sales agent for different types of products that are popular in her area. She uses her income to support her family, and has come to us for a loan to buy more products to sell to her customers. This is the second time Janane has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua, and we believe she will use the new one as effectively as she did the first.

loans.use: To buy various products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Yat (age 29) and her husband, Mr. Pin Sivan have been married since 2002.They have no children. Yat and her family are living on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She is in the business of weaving silk.  She learned to weave silk from her mother and started her silk production in 1993. Her husband is also a silk weaver. It’s a skill he learned from his wife and he started his weaving in 2002.

Yat is requesting her third loan for the amount $400. She will use this money to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Mrs. Grace O. is 36years old, married with 5 children, lives in Benin City. Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and food Items, She is soliciting for the loan of $875 to buy more provision and foodstuff for sale. She started the business in 2002. She is a LAPO client. she thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuff for sale

loans.name: Eselika

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 62 year-old Eselika M.. She is married with six children, aged between 29 and 44. In 2002 Eselika established a farming business, and now requires a loan of $175 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: Eselika would like to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools for farming.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mrs. Mabel O. is 32 years old, married with three children, and lives in Benin City, where she sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She learned the business from her mother and started in 1999. She needs a loan of $600 to buy more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs for sale. She is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, drinks & foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Mr Kokou Z. as an entrepreneur selling coffee and cocoa. He is 38 years old, is married and a father of 06 children. He has worked in this sector for almost 4 years. In spite of the large size of his family, he manages to support all their needs with his business income. This loan will allow Mr Kokou to pay his suppliers in time, to expand his business to other areas and to rent a store for the storage of his goods. Mr Kokou is the man in the picture dressed in dark blue.

Monsieur Kokou Z. est un commerçant de produits café et cacao. Agé de 38 ans, il est marié et père de 06 enfants. Il détient ce secteur depuis bientôt 04 ans. Malgré la taille importante de sa famille, il arrive à supporter toutes ses charges rien que par les revenus issus de son activité. Ce crédit permettra à monsieur Kokou de régler à temps ses fournisseurs, de conquérir d’autres zones et de louer un magasin pour le stockage de ses marchandises. Monsieur Kokou est celui habillé en tenue provisoire de couleur indigo.

loans.use: Purchase of 3 tons of cocoa and 2 of tons coffee for resale to the international exporters

loans.name: Dima

texts.en: Dima is 36 years old and lives in the region of Lebanon known as Aley. She is a seamstress who makes curtains, and also works as a sales agent who sells different types of products that are popular in her area. Dima devotes her entire income to helping support her family. She has come to us for a loan to buy materials that she will use to make curtains for her customers.

loans.use: To buy materials to make curtains

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
Mr. K. Saret and his wife Mrs. Chek Ouch have been married in 1959. They have three children—one son and two daughters. All of his children are married and living separate house. Saret and his family are living on an island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. He and his wife are in the business of doing farming since 1973.Currently, he is growing ginger in his farm in the village.  

Saret is requesting his fifth loan with the amount $200. He will use this money for growing ginger.

loans.use: For growing ginger

loans.name: Naran

texts.en:
Mrs. O. Naran (47) is a widow with one daughter who is married and living with her. Her husband died many years ago. Her daughter and her son in-law are silk weavers. Naran and her family are living on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers frO. PhnO. Penh. She is in the business of weaving silk and also runs a grocery store.  She learned to weave silk frO. her mother and started her silk production in 1983. 

Naran is requesting her fifth loan for the amount $300. She will use this money to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loO..

loans.use:
To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for 
selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Noura

texts.en: Noura is the 42-year-old mother of two children who lives in the Lebanese town of Aley. To help support her family, she makes a type of food called moune which is very popular in her area. Noura has come to us for a loan to buy the ingredients she needs to make this dish. This is the second time she has applied for a loan, and we believe she will use this new loan as effectively as the first one she received.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare food to sell

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr:
Married and a mother of 4 children, Mrs Jeanne E. is 33 years old and has been selling loincloths at the large market of Kpalimé for 10 years. Since her husband lost his job more than 10 months ago, she has been providing for most of her family's needs and is able to send her children to school. Mrs Jeanne would like to buy many more loincloths with this loan to grow her trade, satisfy the requests of her customers and to benefit her family and its survival.

Mariée et mère de 04 enfants, madame Jeanne E. est âgée de 33 ans et est revendeuse de pagnes au grand marché de Kpalimé depuis 10 ans. Elle subvient presque à toutes les dépenses du foyer et les charges scolaires de ses enfants grâce aux revenus provenant de son activité étant donner que son mari a perdu son emploi de puis plus de 10 mois. Madame Jeanne veut, par ces fonds acheter beaucoup plus de pagnes pour élargir la taille de son commerce, satisfaire la demande de la clientèle et dégager plus de bénéfices pour la survie de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of 5 balls of loincloth for resale

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 50 year-old Juliana A.. She is widowed with six children, aged between 13 and 30, and has one other dependent, who is her cousin's child. In 1998 Juliana established a farming business. Juliana has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a loan of $875 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and equipment. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: Juliana would like to purchase farming equipment as well as seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Thol and her husband have been married since 2003. They have two children, one son and one daughter. Both of her children are still young and stay at home. Thol and her family live in a fertile farming area along the Tonle Bassac (river), a tributary of the Mekong, several kilometers south of Phnom Penh. She sells meatballs, boiled eggs and other kinds of food. She started her business at the beginning of 2007. Besides selling food she also grows banana for selling. Her husband is a driver for a company.

She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time for the amount of $400. She will use this money to buy chairs and tables to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase chairs and tables for selling meatballs, boiled eggs and other kinds of food

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Mrs. Blessing A. is 26 years old, married with three children, and lives in Benin City. She sells live chickens; she is soliciting a loan of $875 to buy more chickens for sale. She learned the business for six months, after which she started hers in 2004. She is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more live chickens for sale

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Mrs. M. Vanny (age 28) and her husband, Mr. Pet Sophy (age 34) have been married since 1999. They have three daughters. All of her daughters are still young and stay at home. Vanny and her family live along national road 1, south of Phnom Penh. She is in business raising pigs. She started her business in 2000. Her husband is working for a company in Kean Svay district.

She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time for the amount of $700. She will use this loan to purchase baby pigs and feed for pigs.

loans.use: To purchase baby pigs and feed for pigs

loans.name: Siham

texts.en: Siham is 50 years old and the mother of four children. She lives in the Lebanese town of Aley, where she makes embroidery and other kinds of handicrafts to help support her family. This is the third time Siham has come to us for a loan, and we are confident this latest loan will help her expand her business.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies for an embroidery business

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr:
Mr Yao D. is one of the best hairdressers of the city. A single man without children, he is 25 years old and has been an owner of his hair salon for the past 6 years. He has three apprentices and with this loan, would like to buy new shaving machines and open a new salon for his younger brother who has just graduated in hairstyling.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur Yao D. est l’un des meilleurs coiffeurs de la ville. Célibataire sans enfant, il est âgé de 25 ans et est maître de salon depuis 06 ans. Il a 03 apprentis et désire avec ce crédit acquérir de nouvelles tondeuses et ouvrir un salon pour son petit frère qui vient d’avoir son diplôme de coiffure.

loans.use: Acquisition of 4 shaving machines and setting up a new hair salon for the satisfaction of customers

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en: Najwa is a 46 years old and the mother of four children. She lives in the Lebanese town of Aley, where she supports her family by making embroidery and other kinds of handicrafts. This is the third time Najwa has sought a loan from Al Majmoua, and we are proud of the way she has used her previous loans to expand her business and support her family.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies for a handicraft business

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Mrs. Augustina U. is 30 years old, married with a child, and lives in Benin City, where she sells drinks. She is soliciting a loan of $875 to buy more drinks for sale. This, she said, will help her boost her business. She learned her trade from her mother and started her business in 1994. She is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Mrs. Martha E. is 41years old and married with six children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells phone-recharge cards and makes calls. She is asking for the loan of $450 to enable her to buy more cards for sale, which she said will help her boost her business. She studied this trade for six months and has been in the business since 2003.

loans.use: To buy more phone-recharge cards for sale

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
For the past 10 years, Mr. Kokou FOLITSE has been working as a carpenter. He is married to two women and is a 32 year old father of six children. Thanks to his bravery and the quality of his furniture pieces, he has gained the confidence of the majority of the population. Thanks to the income from his business, he can provide for the needs of his family and manages to save. With this loan, he would like to buy a hundred boards and 50 chevrons in order to continue to make his furniture masterpieces.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Depuis 10 ans monsieur Kokou FOLITSE exerce l’activité de menuiserie. Il est marié de deux femmes et est père de 06 enfants et âgé de 32 ans. Grâce à sa bravoure et à la qualité de ses meubles il a gagné la confiance de la plupart de la population. Grâce aux revenus de son activité, il subvient aux besoins de sa famille et arrive à épargner. Il désire par ce crédit acheter une centaine de planches et 50 chevrons pour l’exécution de ses œuvres.

loans.use: Purchase of 100 boards and 50 chevrons to make furniture and resell it on the market

loans.name: Allah's Group

texts.en: I am Allah R. from a small town Pakpattan, Pakistan. I have three kids, my eldest daughter is eight and is in grade two, my son is five and currently does not attend school and the youngest daughter is two. My husband is a rickshaw driver. His rickshaw is not in very good condition and we need to replace it. I bought a piece of land for my house last year with the profits from our business. I have a couple of friends for many years, I want them to establish their business and earn for their families. Nasreen B. requests a loan to buy an additional motorbike. Naseem A. requests a loan for their grocery store to buy a stock of items such as sugar, flour and oil etc. Nazia R. will also invest the loan to expand their grocery store. Sughran B. requests a loan to buy a cow.

loans.use: To replace older rickshaw

loans.name: Kawaala 1C (Ii) Group

texts.en: Racheal is 29 years old. She owns a poultry farm. She is applying for a loan to help expand her business and support her children through their education.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en: I am a widow Khursheed Anwar. I am a mother of three boys and two girls. None of my kids could attend school due to the death of their father. After his death we have faced very poor financial conditions. Last year, I bought a cow by obtaining a credit from Asasah, a microfinance institution. At present, I request another loan to buy an additional cow. I request loans for few of the other women: Fozia B. and Sughran B. request loans to buy cows. Riaz B. would like to get a new cabin for their rickshaw which is used by passengers to sit. Soba B. would use the loan to buy goats for the business.

loans.use: To buy an additional cow

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs. Mary E. is 32 years old and married with five children. She lives in Benin City and sells electrical materials. She is seeking the loan of $875 to enable her to buy more electrical materials. She learned the business from her husband and started her operation in 1997.

loans.use: To buy electrical materials for sale

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Miss Rosemary O. is 20 years old. She is single and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells women's clothes. She needs $875 to enable her to buy more clothes for sale. She studied her kind of business for a period of six months and started her shop in 2006. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more women's clothes for sale

loans.name: Vincent

texts.fr:
Mr Vincent A. is the person dressed in the red sports shirt. He 29 years old and is a father of two children, first of whom is in the fifth grade and the second in the middle of the first grade. Mr Vincent works in the coffee industry, which is the second agricultural product exported after cocoa. His work is very profitable since he is the only person who has the permit to work in the area. He has worked in this sector for the last 5 years, and with his income, he is able to support his family as well as save some money. With the money saved, he would like to buy a second gining machine to better meet the population's nees and to better support his family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur Vincent A. est celui habillé en polo rouge. Il est âgé de 29, marié et père de 02 enfants dont le premier est en classe de cinquième et le second au cours moyen première année. Monsieur Vincent opère dans l’égrainage du café qui est le deuxième produit agricole exporté après le cacao. Son activité est très rémunératrice puisqu’il est la seule personne à pouvoir s’installer dans la zone. Il opère dans ce secteur depuis 05 ans et avec ses revenus il supporte les charges de sa famille et faire une épargne. Il souhaite avec ces fonds acquérir un deuxième égraineur pour mieux répondre aux besoins de la population et de mieux supporter sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase and installation of a second ginning machine

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.fr:
Enyonam N., age 25, is single and has no children. He has stayed with his trade as a hair stylist for four years and employs three apprentices. With his income, he not only supports himself but also covers the cost of schooling for his younger brother, who is almost done with his secondary education. In addition, Mr. N. saves some of his income. With this loan, he intends to acquire four electric clippers and to renovate his salon in order to meet his customer expectations.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur Enyonam N. est célibataire sans enfant et âgé de 25 ans. Il détient le métier de la coiffure depuis 04 ans et a engagé 03 apprentis. Il supporte par ses revenus les frais scolaires de son petit frère qui en classe de première et subvient à ses propres besoins. De plus il épargne une partie de ses revenus. Par ce crédit, il prétend acquérir 04 tondeuses et aménager son salon de coiffure pour la satisfaction de la clientèle.

loans.use: To acquire 4 electric clippers and to renovate his barber shop

loans.name: Mugema E (I) Group

texts.en: Hadijah is 48 years old and married with four children. She sells vegetables and fruits in the market to earn a living. With the extra profits, she wants to buy a small plot of land.

loans.use: To expand her current business.

loans.name: Mugema E (Ii) Group

texts.en: Jesca is 28 years old, married, and has one child. She owns a small restaurant. Jesca is applying for a loan to earn a diploma in catering and use the money to help her expand her business and profits.

loans.use: To buy more catering utensils, particularly saucepans and food warmers

loans.name: Mugema E(Iii) Group

texts.en: Annet is 46 years old and married with six children. She owns a small retail shop. With the extra business profits, she intends to support her family and pay the school fees so her children may receive an education.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for her shop to increase profits.

loans.name: Kawalad(I) Group

texts.en: Joyce is married with two children. Her current business is selling new clothes and cloth fabrics. She mainly deals with a type of fabric called Bitengi. She intends to use the extra profits to buy a fresian calf.

loans.use: To add investments and purchase more clothing.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 40 year-old Rehema K.. She is married with four children, aged 6, 11, 14, and 17, and has two other dependents, who are her nieces. In 2000 Rehema established a grocery business, and now requires a loan of $175 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: Rehema would like to purchase additional stock in bulk for her grocery business.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Yawa C., age 38, has been a seamstress for over a decade. Married and the mother of six, she has seven apprentices and specializes in women's fashions. Given the funds, she would buy five sewing machines and get training in men's fashions in order to serve both genders. She would also like to buy cloth for resale to her customers, so that their options for clothing are more easily decided.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Madame Yawa C. est couturière depuis plus d’une décennie. Elle a 07 apprenties et est spécialisée en couture dame. Mariée et mère de 06 enfants, madame Yawa est âgée de 38 ans. Elle souhaite par ces fonds, acheter 05 machines à coudre, suivre une formation en couture homme afin d’embrasser les deux sexes et d’acheter des tissus pour la revente à ses clients pour leur faciliter le choix du tissu à coudre.

loans.use: To buy 5 sewing machines and 2 bales of cloth for resale  and to renovate her shop

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 34 year-old Mary M.. She is married with three children, aged 7, 12, and 13. In 2005 Mary established a mobile phone accessories and recharge vouchers business, and now requires a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk.

Despite being a ‘developing’ country (forgive the label, there remains no consensus on an acceptable definition), it is amazing how many people have mobile phones in Tanzania and in Africa in general. Not just professionals, but grandmas in villages, school kids, street sellers. It can probably be attributed to a number of factors, led by the fact that it is the only form of phone communication available to most people, because there are few landlines, and followed closely by how relatively cheap mobile phones are here. All of which makes any phone-related business a safe venture. So, happy lending…

loans.use: Mary would like to purchase additional stocks of phone accessories and recharge vouchers.

loans.name: Kawala D(Ii) Group

texts.en: Juliet is married with two children. She owns a beauty salon which offers a number of  services like hair dressing, styling, plaiting and bridal packages.  Juliet wants to use the extra profits to pay school fees for her children and also buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase more hair oils and dryers for her salon.

loans.name: Jennifa

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 23 year-old Jennifa B.. She is married with one child, aged 7. In 2003 Jennifa established a batik cloth business, and now requires a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: Jennifa would like to purchase additional stocks of batik cloth in bulk.

loans.name: Mugema D(I) Group

texts.en: Irene is a single mother with two children. She runs a small hotel. She wants to go for a postgraduate diploma with the extra business profits.

loans.use: To buy more hotel equipment to expand her business

loans.name: Lizzy

texts.en: Mrs. Lizzy T. sells provisions. She is 45 years old and married with eight children. She is from Edo State and is a member of LAPO. She needs the loan of $375 to enable her to buy more provisions for sale. She has been in business since 1999.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
For over 12 years, Akou G. has been a baker. A widow for over three years, she is 39 years old and the mother of four children, all of whom are in school. She manages to provide everything that she and her family needs due to the profits from her sales. Also, she employs two people who assist her with various tasks. She would like to use this loan to buy five bags of flour and three boxes of sugar and to have a second oven constructed.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Depuis une douzaine d’année madame Akou G. est boulangère. Veuve depuis plus de 03 ans elle est âgée de 39 ans et est mère de 04 enfants qui sont tous à l’école. Madame Akou arrive à subvenir à toutes ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants grâce aux bénéfices de ses ventes. Elle a aussi engagé deux personnes qui l’aident dans ses diverses tâches. Elle souhaite par ce crédit acheter 5 sacs de farine de blé, 03 cartons de sucres et se faire construire un second four.

loans.use: To buy 10 bags of flour, 5 boxes of sugar, and to build another oven

loans.name: Abir

texts.en: Abir is 28 years old and has two children. She lives with her family in the region of Lebanon known as Borj Barajneh. Abir sells accessories, and has applied for a loan to buy more inventory to sell to her customers. This is the first time Abir has sought a loan from Al Majmoua, and she is excited about the prospect of expanding her business and better providing for her family.

loans.use: To buy products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mugema D(Ii) Group

texts.en: Rina is 28 years old and a single mother of three children. She has a small hotel. She intends to buy a generator and pay the children’s school fees with the extra business profits.

loans.use: To purchase more hotel equipment

loans.name: Loutfi

texts.en: Loutfi is 67 years old and lives with his family in the Borj Barajneh region of Lebanon. Loutfi owns a shoe store, and has applied for a loan to buy more merchandise to sell to his customers. This is his fifth loan from Al Majmoua, and we are proud of the way our loans have allowed him to provide for his family and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 31-year-old resident of the region of Lebanon known as Borj Barajneh. He owns a bakery, and has applied for a loan to buy the provisions and supplies he needs to generate more revenues. This is the third time Hussein has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua, and we know him to be a hard-working and energetic businessman.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a bakery

loans.name: Mugema D (Iii) Group

texts.en: Teo has a small drug shop. She wants to use the extra profits to buy more furniture for the drug shop and also take a diploma course in nursing.

loans.use: To purchase more medcine for her drug shop.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 49 years old and lives with his family in the region of Lebanon known as Borj Barajneh.  Ali has four children, and supports himself and his family by working as a car mechanic. He has applied for a loan to buy supplies for his business, and hopes to use the income generated by these supplies to build a bedroom for his children. This is Ali's fourth loan from Al Majmoua, and are proud of how well he and his small business are doing.

loans.use: To buy material

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Mrs. Helen B., who is a tailor, also sells drinks and clothes. She is 38 years old and married with four children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State. She needs the loan of $875 to buy clothes to sell. She studied her trade for four years and started her own business in 1988.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Nada

texts.en: Nada is 47 years old and lives with her family in the Borj Barajneh region of Lebanon. Nada makes a living working as a sales agent for a wide range of products used by the people in her area. She has come to us for a loan to replenish the inventory of items she has to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Abravi

texts.fr:
Married and the mother of three children, two of whom are in school, Abravi HOUMADO, age 30, has been in this business for three years already. Using the profits from her work, she ensures that household expenses are covered. She would like to use this loan to buy 25 new travel bags in order to meet customer demands and to earn more.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont deux fréquentent madame Abravi HOUMADO est âgée de 30 ans et exerce ce commerce bientôt 03 ans. Par les profits de son activité elle assure les dépenses du foyer. Elle souhaite par ce crédit acheter 25 nouveaux sacs afin de satisfaire la demande de la clientèle et de gagner plus.

loans.use: To buy  25 travel bags to meet customer needs

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is 45 years old and the mother of four children. She lives with her family in the region of Lebanon known as Borj Barajneh. Fatima makes pottery for a living, and needs a loan to buy raw materials and supplies for her business. This is her four loan from A. Majmoua, and we are proud of how well she and her company are doing.

loans.use: To buy material for a pottery-making business

loans.name: Omonor

texts.en: Mrs. Omonor O. makes and sells beads. She is 35 years old and married with three children. She needs the loan of $375 to buy materials for the making of her beads for sale. She studied the business for four months and started her operation in 1999.

loans.use: To buy more materials for beads

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a 46-year-old mother with four children. She lives with her family in the Borj Barajneh region of Lebanon. Amina sells clothing for a living, and needs to buy new inventory to sell to her customers. We are confident that she will make good use of this loan, because this is the fourth time we have had the opportunity to lend to her and know that she is a hard-working and energetic businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Elham

texts.en: Elham is the 58-year-old mother of ten children. She lives with her family in the region of Lebanon known as Borj Barajneh, where she owns a grocery store. She needs a loan to buy merchandise to sell to her customers. This is the fourth time Elham has applied for a loan from A. Majmoua, and we are very confident that she will make good use of this one, as she has with all the previous ones.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Mugema D (Iv) Group

texts.en: Fatuma has a retail shop and mainly sells household products and a few foodstuffs. She wants to use the extra profits to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase more shop items in order to expand current business

loans.name: May

texts.en: May is a 53-year-old woman. She lives with her family in the region of Borj Barajneh. May sells wool for knitting. She needs a loan to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business. This is the first time May is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Endurance

texts.en: Mrs. Endurance O. sells baby items. She needs the loan of $275 to buy more baby things for sale. She is 35 years old and married with two children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

loans.use: To buy more baby items for sale

loans.name: Endurance

texts.en: Mrs. Endurance O. sells baby things. She is a member of LAPO.She needs the loan amount of $275 to buy more baby things for sale. She is 35 years old, married with 2 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

loans.use: To buy more baby things for sale
